Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: safety86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince Conti this past weekend. I was in room 255 which is a window room. The location is prime as it is less than a block from Bourbon Street. The staff was great and super friendly. There is also free wifi throughout the hotel. As one reviewer posted, the pillows are flat. My bathroom looked to be recently remodeled with nice fixtures and tile. My only advice is to ask for a window room.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of French Quarter --shh -- but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: bbnn
Reviews.Content: Around the corner from Bourbon Street, but amazingly QUIET! We walked everywhere - OK, a few streetcars to the outlining areas, but that's a must. We received an amazing greeting from the front desk even though our flight was delayed and it was very late. The carpets are worn, but if it was pristine it wouldn't be NOLA. Loved the bric-a-brac on the room doors. I'd stay again. Very competitive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nannysc
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the Prince Conti Hotel was most enjoyable, complimented by the professional and friendly staff. Our Queen Deluxe room was very clean and nicely decorated. The Housekeeping staff addressed our special requests without hesitation and Ava at the front desk always welcomed us with a friendly greeting as we passed through the lobby. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Carlene K
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Prince Conti at the visitor center as soon as we crossed the state line. We have learned you get the best deals booking through the visitor center, even better than on the internet. I try to make sure I include this information whenever I write a review on a hotel. We arrived in New Orleans Tuesday, after the basketball tournament and again wanted to stay in the French Quarter. We booked our room for three nights and only had perhaps a 10 minute wait for our room to be prepared. All I can say is the service is excellant, especially if you happened to have Ms. Ava as your desk clerk. She took excellant care of us even booking our tours for us. The valets were great about taking care of our luggage, even going above and beyond to get my jacket out of my car on a rainy morning and keeping it dry by putting it under his coat. I took my own pillow and if there are any complaints it's that the pillows were very flat. The room itself was very nice, a great bathroom with a wonderful shower. This probably sounds funny, but I was thrilled to see a wing back chair in the room. I have a bad back and laying in bet watching TV just kills me. The other thing I must mention is that our room did not have a window...it was an inside room. While quaint and very quiet, I prefer a window in my room. Another thing you need to be aware of is the cost of parking. The first night at the hotel is $10.00 and then it is $28 a night thereafter. Just another reason to make sure you stop at the visitor center to book your room. It will help defer the cost of the parking by making your room rate less. The hotel is approximately 1/2 block off Bourbon Street. I just want to say one thing here for those of you traveling with children...stay away from Bourbon Street. It is full of homeless people, more strip bars then I can ever remember being there with pictures in the windows of the acts taking place inside, and girls in the doorways with little on shaking their booty, and prostitutes trying to hit on Johns. Definaltely not a place for children. There are many other places like Jackson Square and the French Market and Royal Street, or take the trolly down to the Convention Center for three flours of shopping for all kinds of souveinors. This was not my first trip to New Orleans, but this is my first trip post Katrina. This is NOT the New Orleans that I used to love. Once again do not believe all that you see on TV how everything is all just wonderful again because that is not the case. Take the "City Tour", there are many of them and you will see just how much has been destroyed by Katrine. Rebuilding is slow at best. My heart goes out to the people of the ninth ward. This was probably my last visit to New Orleans. It has just become to dangerous and seedy for me.

Reviews.Title: “music festival made it a great place”
Reviews.Author: rudy7799
Reviews.Content: great staff that was very helpful. everything was close to walk to. room was well maintain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the PCH. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We arrived around 8 am, not expecting our room to be ready for awhile, but it was. Check in was super fast and easy, and everything about the hotel facility is quite charming. We were booked in room 365 - highly recommended, as it has a window and is located towards the back, so it was extremely quiet. Everyone we met on the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the hotel even delivered a chilled bottle of champagne to our room, as we were there celebrating my 50th birthday. We stayed in a king deluxe room, and had plenty of room. The AC was cold, the water hot with good pressure, and everything was clean. I did take my own pillow, although we had 5 available in our room - I just prefer my own. The location was the best you could hope for - just about a block off Bourbon, but also with restaurants and bars in pretty much every direction. All in all, I would definitely stay at PCH again and recommend it to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location- bring a pillow”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there last week and we greatly enjoyed it. Super friendly staff, very nice and charming room, and you could not have asked for a better location. Anything you would want to see in the French Quarter was within walking distance, short walks at that. If I had to find something to complain about is that the pillow were super flat. It was almost as if you didn't even have a pillow. If I were to go back to NOLA I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Prince Conti for 3 nights. The location couldn't have been better. It is a stones throw from Bouron St. but once you get to the hotel, you can't even hear the noise. Everyone we encountered on the staff was friendly. The decor of the hotel was a little shabby but for how often we were in the room, it didn't bother us. We liked this hotel because it had a more historic feeling of being right in the midst of everything. If you want something a little more upscale, choose a chain thats further down Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Prince Conti!”
Reviews.Author: Stack61
Reviews.Content: This is a great property! Stayed there 2 or 3 times and have yet to be disappointed. It is a great location; close to everything, but away from the noise of Bourbon St. The rooms are quite clean compared to most French Quarter properties and the staff will do whatever it takes to make your stay enjoyable. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us!”
Reviews.Author: B J
Reviews.Content: I did literally hours and hours of research trying to figure out the best hotel to suit our needs in NOLA. We tend to stay in higher-end chain hotels when we travel. Ultimately for this vacation we decided for our first time in NOLA we should stay in an historic hotel in the French Quarter (rather than a chain in the business district). We also needed a microwave and fridge, and a room quiet enough to get some sleep (which can be tough to find in the FQ). With a little trepidation, we chose Prince Conti. Any qualms we may have had vanished right away when we arrived. The small lobby is very pretty, and all of the staff was friendly and helpful. We had reserved a Junior King Suite, and I believe I asked for the highest floor (in this case, 3), and a quiet location in the building. We liked our room right away. None of the furniture was new, but everything was very clean and well kept and looked appropriate to our expectation of what a FQ hotel would be like. The bed looked like it could be uncomfortable, but in fact it was not at all! I usually don't sleep well in hotels, but I did here. The bathroom was clean, functional, and in good condition. The fridge and microwave were great for our leftovers from big meals all around NOLA. We were VERY happy to find two flat screen HDTVs in our room. Temperature controls were simple and worked well. The hotel's location was also perfect, being about a half block off Bourbon and a very short walk to Canal. We were able to walk everywhere in the FQ, and the hotel served as a nearby safe haven when we were worn out from walking among the revelers. When we wanted to venture further afield, we just walked to Canal and took the various streetcars (including taking one to a nearby car rental place so we could venture even further). We also had breakfast at the Conti Cafe (the attached breakfast only place), which was nice. We really liked the staff there and talked and joked with them a little. The "Southern Eggs Benedict" is *really* good! I've been trying to think of any negatives during our stay, but really the only small thing I can think of was that the wireless internet signal in our room wasn't as strong as it could've been. But then it was free, and it did work, so it's hard to even fault that. Maybe we were just lucky to get the most perfect room in the place, but honestly, we're pretty fussy and we loved it. We would have no qualms about staying here if we make it to NOLA again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Prince Conti. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. We couldn't organise a hire car ourselves, so the Manager, Brad, went out of his way phoning all over New Orleans to find us a hire car for the next day. We highly recommend the location and the service of this hotel. We thank everyone at Prince Conti for their service and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NDRaigg
Reviews.Content: My only complaint was that rooms were smelly, possible because of humidity. this may be standard in New Orleans, I'm not sure. The rate was very reasonable. Very central location in French Quarter, which was the most important thing for me. The hotel is nothing special other than that. I'm giving it 5 stars because of good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and safe hotel.”
Reviews.Author: davesmith_africa
Reviews.Content: A 2 storey hotel with very good service culture, good security and excellent location. We booked a superior room and got a 1st floor room with a view of the parking lot behind the hotel, we were happy to get a view outside, some of the internal rooms don't have windows, The bathroom is very small but adequate and well appointed with good quality fittings and clean. The windows don't open but the central heating and cooling system is very effective even though some fresh air would be nice. The hotel is about 20m from bourbon street in the upper french quarter with easy access to canal street and the street cars. All in all a good value for money Hotel in one of the best cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: casey f
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent service! The rooms were a bit small but when your in New Orleans how often are you in your room. We could walk anywhere and that was what was most important.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time wasn't a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful stay on our first visit to the Prince Conti Hotel, we went back. I ordered a suite for a romantic weekend with my wife. The suite turned out to be a large meeting room with a huge table and 12+ chairs and a wall case filled with books, a kitchen set up for meetings and a little bedroom. Totally unsatisfactory! The hotel moved us to a damp room in a bulding that was once a garage that had a TV and carpet older than me, and I'm old. The staff seemed to be concerned, but by then we just made the best of a bad situation.

Reviews.Title: “Want to pay 200.00 / night to hear every drunk in the quarter?”
Reviews.Author: Yvetteni
Reviews.Content: The prices vary depending on the night. Our first night was 80.00. Not bad right? It was so loud I didn't sleep a wink ( which is what I paid for). Then, on Friday it went up by 120.00! Honestly, walk or cab to the French Quarter but don't plan to sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FLdaytripper
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel (a block off bourbon, few blocks from Canal) is wonderful, that would not matter if the hotel itself did not deliver. The good stuff- -My room was a good size, especially for an older hotel. We had a 2 double bed room with two closets and a good sized bathroom. The bath was not huge but it had a full tub and room to turn around. -Service was very friendly. We did not have any issues to address so I can't say how they handle problems. I guess is it better to have no problems so we didn't have to find out. -parking was easy and valet service was prompt. Maybe a bit pricey at $30+ per day. -Rooms are quaint, if a bit older. -Bombay Room Bar has some very good bartenders who were helpful in educating about different drinks (he gave me a mini class on martinis) and make a fine drink. -check in/check out were easy and quick. -Cabs were plentiful. We never called for a cab since they were constantly driving by. We never waited more than 30 seconds for a cab to role by The bad stuff -Beds are hard. And small. Luckily my wife and I had a double so we each got our own bed. -TV's are old and tiny and the service is iffy. However, we were in the FQ and watched TV long enough to get ready in the morning so it wasn't that big of a deal. -Our room had no window. It was very odd. It did have a huge skylight that let in a ton of light. It was really not so much bad as it was just weird. Over all, I would happily stay here again. I may ask for a room with a window next time. We did not eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that part.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: LindaGinette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only few steps from Bourbon street. The room was clean and bathroom was all redone. We had a 2 beds room on the 3rd floor so not too noisy. Do not expect a 5 stars as this is an historic place and if you have already travelled in Europe, you will find the same charm. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Do not bother, just park your car for an extra charge and enjoy New Orleans. If you can, we suggest you skip the Conti cafÃ© since the prices for breakfast are super expensive, service is not friendly at all and food is very basic! Just cross the street and go to the Jagerhaus (German), you will not be disapointed, I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anika920
Reviews.Content: The rooms were average nothing special. Pillows are too small. Our room was at the far end window facing Bourbon St. I could faintly hear the noise outside but wasn't bad at all. The rooms lack sound proofing though it is very easy to hear others coming and going and esp the slam of the door. I typically dont care about what the hotel has to offer but I found staying for 3 days I was wanting a workout room, pool or jacuzzi. The staff wasn't particularly nice or rude. We weren't told where the vending machines were or how to get to our room upon check in. The restaurant had good food but nothing special and was overpriced. We chose to stay at Prince Conti because the price and location were the best for what we were looking for. It is very easy to walk all over New Orleans' French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the cost”
Reviews.Author: 913NOLAtraveler913
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice in the past 6 months. It's in a very convenient location. The employees are all very friendly and helpful, especially Ms. Ava, at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Facility @ Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: I wrote a ;note of commendation after 8 of us stayed at the Prince Conti in December. 2 had to stay elsewhere. It was friends and family from Wa., Ohio and Baton Rouge. The physical facility is very nice, with nice rooms and hallways and lobby, a good restaurant and parking. The staff were unbelievably good, from the front desk people to the parking to the restaurant. We even ran into some of the staff in the French Quarter and had a good time visiting with them. It is nice that they obviously really liked their work at the Prince Conti. A very positive experience and still reasonable. Also, right in the heart of everything. We were able to walk everywhere. Many thanks to wonderful management and staff! Pat Coryell PS: we did have a dog with us and since they aren't allowed inside he had a good place to stay in the covered pickup bed, was safe there and we took him with us outside, as appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Prince Conti!”
Reviews.Author: MelaniePF
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've stayed here for most of my visits to New Orleans and have yet to have a bad experience. Friendly staff, clean hotel, and excellent location (close enough to Bourbon but not too close)!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous in every regard!”
Reviews.Author: scottfop
Reviews.Content: Though my family always stayed at the old Downtowner (now the Inn on Bourbon by Ramada) at Bourbon and Toulouse, I have found a new oasis in a city of fun yet chaotic noise and commotion, and it's half a block from Bourbon Street. The Prince Conti is a GORGEOUS old Southern and very classy hotel with more charm and characted than you would ever imagine looking at its rather austere facade on Conti Street. The rooms are very spacious and have 15' ceilings and drapes, the furniture is a bit "dated" but very clean, and by that one wouldn't expect modern stylings in such an old building with so much character. The furniture fits the architecture. Even the doors to the rooms are quqite beautiful with their ornately carved woodwork grilles. The bathrooms are newly and beautifully restored and fitted with marble, ceramic tile and gleaming white fixtures. Now a note on the size of the rooms: most are what I would consider a very spacious room, and no doubt the ceiling height helps this. But they have a handful of "petite" rooms, and they are not kidding! They are smaller than the cabin on a cruise ship. You step in the door, you can set your luggage down and either step into the bathroom or sit on the bed, not much more in all honesty! And the price differences between them and the other normal rooms is not that great. There are also two restaurants, Cafe Conti and the Bombay Club (the latter of which is pricey but very elegant and serves true and authentic Creole cuisine). Literally right across the street, like 30 feet from the front door, is a fantastic German restaurant called Jager-Haus. Delicious for breakfast, lunch and dinner (dinner is a bit pricey but you can get a coupon on the tourist map at the front desk of the hotel) and the other, a true French restaurant of the old world charm and order: Broussard's. The staff is marvelously helpful and friendly, from Cindy at the front desk and Van at t he Bellman's stand during the days, to the ladies on the night shift (I apologize but forgot their names!) and even Mr. Valentino, the owner and manager who truly made me feel welcome and valued as a new guest. The location could not be better, and the major sights to see and tour are either walking distance or available via taxi, horse and carriage or arrangements by the very helpful and capable desk and concierge staff. The Conti Museum of New Orleans History is only two blocks from the front doors of the hotel in the opposite direction from Bourbon Streetm and two blocks beyond that is the Church of Our Lady of Guadalupe, which is the former St. Anthony of Padua French Mortuary Chapel ating from 1827 and also containing the Shrine of St. Jude, on the corner of Conti and Rampart Street. It is a small and unassuming church but extremely rich in New Orleans/Yellow Fever Epedemic and Archdiocesan history. Behind the Church, across Basin Street and inside the white concrete wall, is St. Louis Cemetery #1, the oldest and one of the famous above ground cemeteries in New Orleans, and also the final resting place of Voodoo Queen Marie Laveaux (if you're into that). The other beautiful thing about the PCH's location is that, though literally half a block from Bourbon Street, when one enters their room at night, it is QUIET as opposed to those hotels right on Bourbon. A real retreat and place of beauty and serenity. My only constructive comments, NOT complaints, are that 1) the mattress in my room was very soft. I only say this because I prefer a firmer mattress due to chronic back issues, but I slept rather well, and 2) the lamp shades might need replacing soon due to the carelessness of past guests and just years of use, and by that I am referring more to the interior linings, and 3) they should get firmer, overstuffed feather or other types of pillows. I don't care for those thin foam pillows that really don't breathe well. The A/C in each room is WONDERFUL as are the large-sized ceiling fans. Hey- it is New Orleans and one of the hottest and most humid climates in the country! Regarding the price, I am not making the salary I once was (who is anymore?) so a lesser cost would have really helped me out alot, but it is what it is and I did have a good time. I judge hotels by the following criteria: 1) location, 2) my feeling of safety, 3) condition of the property and rooms and, most importantly: 4) would my mother stay there? She would in spades at this one! The hotel is perfection and one would be doing themselves very well to stay there and give it a try. (Well, perfection except for the juvenile-acting drunks staggering in from Bourbon Street at 4 and 5 AM!) THANK YOU Prince Conti staff and Mr. Valentino for a simply fantastic and quite-pleasantly surprising experience. I have only been home a few hours and am already thinking about when I can sneak back down there for a few days and stay at the Prince COnti and enjoy the sights, sounds (and tastes!) of Nouvelle Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Thomellis
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a super low rate from a "Papa Noel Special" for the month of December. We checked in late on Christmas Day and the staff were so pleasant and nice. We stayed on the second floor in the back annex and I would recommend that room to anyone. We basically had our own floor and the room was huge, but without the noise you might expect from being so close to Bourbon st. The front desk gave us coupons for the breakfast restaurant and the staff was so accommodating. On the last day they let us check out and leave our bags at the front desk while we went out sight-seeing before we left on our cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: georgiegirlno1
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti was a pleasant surprise. You can't beat the location being a half block from Bourbon street! And once you went into your room, you really couldn't hear the noise from Bourbon so you could still get your sleep. The rooms were clean and comfortable - my only complaint would be the small, flat, pillows - but that's a personal preference. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. They run a secure establishment so you don't have to worry about the room next to you being full of 8 people instead of only 2. I would highly recommend this hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere different on my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “This not the place to stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: Last year I was there with some girlfriends for the Essence Festival weekend I wouldn't recommend this hotel to no one because it must of had mole in it because I could not stop coughing when I was there. Then we were told that we were disrupting other people when have the time we wasn't in the room except to sleep. When we told them that we was not there they still accused us when the noise was coming from another room, which we made no complaint because they was just enjoying them self. Reminder that we was there from Friday to that Monday and that when we was told that by the front desk manager on the last night of staying there. Their customer service was the worst and very augmentative. I hope they realize that the customer is always right. What better way to get the point across we wont patronize them and we will tell everyone of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: mle0629
Reviews.Content: Went to Louisiana for a wedding, and spent an extra couple of days in New Orleans. Stayed here and didn't regret it a bit! Loved that it was so close to Bourbon ST. Staff was very friendly--they actually let us leave our car parked for a bit after we checked out (had some time to kill between checkout and our departing flight), which we appreciated. We'd definitely stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - close to Bourbon yet far enough”
Reviews.Author: ktflisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Veterans Day weekend 2011. What a great value! Half a block off of Bourbon - far enough to not be bothered by the noise but close enough to enjoy. The beds were comfortable, the rooms clean. We did not eat at the attached restaurant. We have visited New Orleans several times - this is our favorite hotel so far.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Tanya K
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here on our second trip to New Orleans, and we had the most wonderful stay. The staff was some of the nicest people we met the entire time and they were incredibly helpful. While the hotel itself was very nice, the Bombay Club was a definite highlight. The manager on duty most of the time we were there (Lance I think?) was AMAZING. He gave us the best and most honest advice and was just a genuinely great person to be around. The drinks at the club were also most delightful (the Violet Fields martini was to DIE for!). In short, we loved it and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In drastic need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: checkpointcheryl
Reviews.Content: I reserved online and walked confidently into this hotel, because the location is great, the pictures of the exterior looked elegant, it is advertised as including the "Bombay Club" restaurant, and the name is classy. We booked a suite. I could not believe it when we entered our room and discovered that there was NO WINDOW. No window at all. We asked if anything else was available and were moved to a dismal, sad, dingy but spacious room on the fourth floor. This could be a nice hotel but it needs clean carpets, new furniture and a coat of paint desperately.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a company meeting”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel and one of the suites for our region meeting in Feb 2012 and had 11 people total. The suite was set up as our meeting room which made it nice and cozy as well as gave us the ability to all sit at a meeting table and be formal at the same time. The pricing was uncomparable, the staff was wonderful, and the rooms were nice and clean. I would definitely recommend this to others that are looking to travel to the French Quarters of New Orleans. We had Karla at the hotel help me set up everything and she was on it and quick at responding, I greatly appreciated all of her help.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't disappoint at all!”
Reviews.Author: BillyLaLa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are going on a cruise with a group with friends and came to New Orleans two days early to take in NOLA. I chose this hotel as the price was right, the location was right, and I wanted a boutique hotel with the New Orleans feel. And an 89% approval rating from TripAdvisor members. We got it all. If you want a chain or a fancy hotel then this isn't the place for you. If you want a comfortable hotel that is unique to the area then this is the place. Sure some of the decor is dated, the carpet is a little worn, but the place is clean and well maintained. Their are two criticism's that I have. 1. The pillows are horrible and need to be replaced, but still woke with no neck pain. 2. The walls and doors are very thin and you can hear conversations in the hall and except for the occasional revelers it was quiet. I would stay here again. And the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience with minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: cogitosum3
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and were not disappointed. It is a half block off of Bourbon Street, but we did not have any noise problems. We had a view of the parking lot, but that didn't matter. Everything was more than adequate, except for the blankets, which had holes in them, and the towels, which were threadbare. There was also an odd smell we couldn't quite place, but was not very strong. Front desk was helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the Bombay Club bar was an oasis for adults with jazz at night. We had our first sazarac (sp?) cocktail there, which is supposedly the first cocktail ever and was invented in New Orleans. It's made with rye whiskey, lime, sugar and absinthe and tastes somewhat like a Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Dianeod
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely charming hotel very close to Bourbon street but very quiet. We had a massive, clean room with a really cosy bed. WIFI is free and connection was really good. The cafe at the entrance is great, we got a $2 discount for breakfast. The sweet potato pancakes were divine and MASSIVE! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernice J J
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel just around the corner from where all the action starts in the French Quarter, if you so desire it: The Bourbon Street scene! However the hotel is a quiet respite from all the goings on. It is clean, well maintained, and had a quiet, French charm. We stayed here for a week in January 2012, just before Mardi Gras, and could not have been more pleased with the pleasant comfort. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room is a good size with a comfortable, king size bed and the bathroom, modern and clean. And the rates were very reasonable. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot and price”
Reviews.Author: Tjsands2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on French quarter. Just around the quarter from bourbon street, walking distance To many attractions. Price was reasonable and staff was excellent. Plan on coming back and staying their again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ernieCentralIllinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Prince Conti (pronounced with a long I, we were told by the locals) on our way out on a cruise. The hotel has the historical and architectural charm. It is a very old building. The rooms are very small with older carpet and older televisions (small and not the flat screen type). The beds are not top quality. It is an older mattress that probably needs to be updated. Our room on 2nd floor had a bad odor, something like dirty carpet. They had sprayed room spray, but it didn't help. Our friends stayed in a different room and they had no odor in their room. I would have complained, but we were only there for one night and they let us into our room early because we flew in and arrived by taxi. We were grateful to get into our room early. The housekeeping manager inspected the room right before we entered our room, because she was coming out of the room as we arrived at the door. The staff did not meet us outside at the curb, so we had to carry our luggage inside and up to our room. They did hold the door open for us coming in the front entrance. The taxi driver was surprised they did not come outside too. The lobby is very small. There is no complimentary breakfast offered. There was a restaurant on the property, but we did not go in it.The rooms have paper thin walls. I could hear everything said as people walked by. We were near the ice machine so we had a fair amount of traffic by our room. There was also a lot of noise above our room. I am guessing the floors are hard wood because there was a ton of squeaking above us as they moved about. I joked that the people above us had dance practice in the upstairs room starting very early in the day. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of all the action. It was nice to walk to the clubs and restaurants that evening. It was nice and warm weather in January. The cost of our room was $159 for the night, which is probably reasonable for the location. We had no other complaints or problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Conlet
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a trip to New Orleans and were very pleased with the Prince Conti hotel. The location can't be beat - less than a block from Bourbon St with none of the noise! It is surrounded by restaurants. We arrived earlier than anticipated and were told our room would be ready in an hour, so we migrated straight to Acme for oysters. On our return we were amazed at the size of the suite - a large bedroom, a complete kitchen with full-sized stove, frig, micro, etc., and a large dining room/living room with an enormous table and six leather chairs. A pullout sofa and chair completed the room. True the furniture was a bit dated, but very clean. The front desk staff was very helpful in giving us suggestions for restaurants although this was not our first trip, so we had favorites to revisit. We had previously stayed at another of their properties, and were pleased with that as well. We will definitely stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Luke M
Reviews.Content: We just got back from New Orleans. The Prince Conti Hotel was excellent. Rooms were very clean, Bathroom shower pressure was great, staff was helpful and nice. Location was great, just a block down from Bourbon Street. I would def recommend to park at the hotel, your car is safe and you can come and go as you please but you are in walking distance to every place you would like to go. The Deja Vu restaurant across the street had great food and was very reasonably priced. I would def come back here.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: johnny w
Reviews.Content: Great little property with lots of charm. From the front desk staff to housekeeping, everyone made us feel right at home. One lady at the front desk (can't remember her name) helped us plan two days of fun in the french quarter with tours and dinner. She was a delight. The hotel is definitely boutique and a little bit older, but the rooms are quaint and clean. Breakfast at the Cafe Conti was delicious. Valet charges were a bit steep, but average for the french quarter. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful of room selection at the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: Sheila M
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel, just steps to Bourbon Street. It is reasonably clean, certainly not spotless as in other reviews. We stayed from January 11-14 before a cruise and on the 21st after the cruise. BEWARE OF SOME OF THE ROOMS. The first room we were offered had no windows. I don't even know if that is legal. It was across from the lobby area, and down a hall. Very dungeon like. The second room we were offered only had a skylight. Are they kidding? Again, I don't know if it is legal for fire regulations. We marched down to the front desk and asked for a room with windows, and Ava (a very pleasant lady) sent us to room 355. It was a regular room, but very damp and the carpet was almost wet. The heat was turned on Thursday and Friday and it barely dried out. We left the door open in our room most of the time. There is no air circulation in this hotel. There were threadbare towels and the other linens and bedspreads had seen better days. One of the beds was loose to the headboard and rattled even if you just put your hand on it. We had requested a room for when we got back on the 21st, I insisted on a window. Well, there was a crabby front desk clerk this time. She said ok. We we got back on the 21st the same crabby clerk was there. I asked about a room with a window again, and she sort of smirked at me. I didn't know what was in store for us. We got room 232, right by the elevators. It had windows alright. Three large ones, all facing Conti Street. The hotel was supposedly sold out, so we couldn't get another room. The din started about 7pm. Sirens, shouting, music, arguing, yelling and so on til 5am. I am sure the desk clerk put us in one of the worst rooms in the hotel since I demanded not to be in a dungeon. The only reason I stayed there as my friend had stayed there before and liked the location. I think she was given a regular room at that time. It is too much of a crap shoot to stay here. It needs new linens and some updating. I still can't get over the fact that they have rooms that would break fire regulations in most cities. Be aware of the pitfalls of this hotel and find out more information if you book a room here. There are lots of other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic elegance amid a hurricane of fun”
Reviews.Author: jayboy711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is another one of those historic New Orleans gems. The nature of the French Quarter is crowded, so don't go expecting a sprawling brand new piece of modern architecture. Instead, if you embrace the rich history and authentic detail that imbue this hotel with a museum-like grace and character, you will really, really enjoy yourself. Location is the key for this hotel. A block from Bourbon Street. A few blocks to Canal. Three blocks from Rampart. I won't even attempt to tell travelers where to find exceptional food or the infamous New Orleans night life. You'd have to stay in your hotel room closet to avoid it. Unless you have a specific destination in mind, I recommend just walking out to the street, picking a direction, and walking until you find something interesting. You won't have to go far. Valet parking is available, but I'd recommend using one of several pay-to-park lots within a block or two. Take your things out of your vehicle, pay much less. Also, the wifi signal in our room was weak and occasionally caused aborted uploads. At times, this was frustrating. My only other issue would be with the card keys for the rooms. They were unfamiliar to me, lacking a magnetic stripe so they couldn't be demagnatized by cell phones, etc. But during my stay, they constantly became non-functional. As a result, my friend and I had to get well over 20 keys issued to us over the course of just a few days. The staff, however, was friendly, attentive, and professional. They made accommodations for my early check-in and were quick to facilitate a last-minute addition of another friend to my reservation on the second to last day of my stay. The manager named Cindy was classy, smart and in control. It was a pleasure to stay here and it was a pleasure for me to let her know I'd be writing them a favorable review. For the optimal French Quarter visit, I prefer staying in a building that has been there for many decades, a building like this one, with an historic elegance. With this hotel, you don't sacrifice amenities to get that experience. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: SouthTxFoodie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly near to everything. Nothing is more than either a few steps or a few blocks. I was not prepared for how close everything is. We walked a short way and were right on Bourbon St or near the St. Louis Cemetary. The hotel is small, quaint but well kept, and they valet. Only one elevator to go up. The staff were very friendly and what we asked them they went above and beyond. I had a friend who got sick and they were so nice as to offer their microwave for us to heat up some soup or help us find a place to get soup. Tons of brochures and guides in the lobby for us to get. Our room was adequate as we did not spend much time in it. It was pretty roomy and had strong smell of smoke which we did not like but got used to. It helped they had a great ceiling fan so we aired it out. The room was really clean and well kept. Nice flat screen T.V. Good hangers and a very nice, clean, and working bathroom. Our beds were not very comfortable and felt springy but still able to sleep. The double beds are small and if you are taller than 5'9 you will have problems. Also one of the walls is paper thin and you can sometimes hear people talking. One morning we were awoken by people getting in at 4 a.m in the room next to us. A noisy argument broke out and I promptly called management who quickly took care of the situation. But overall pretty quiet. They have a nice breakfast restaurant whose meals two people can share because of the generous portions. Our room was not haunted however the first night a curious thing happened to me and a friend. Our blankets were messed with at night. Overall if you want to be in French Quarter then stay here. It's clean and the staff are friendly. I do not recommend children under the age of 14 staying here only because so close to Bourbon St and did not see any.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, but....”
Reviews.Author: artdesi
Reviews.Content: Mostly friendly staff, nice, clean room, good location if your goal is to be close to Bourbon St., but...we were wakened every night and into the wee hours by lots of noise from the street below, some happy, some not-so-happy (people), garbage trucks, early morning traffic...perhaps if our room was on the other side of the hotel? Lobby computer was a joke when we tried to print boarding passes, ending up in failure, checking in from our laptop in the room. Oh, no desk in the room

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi&papa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 days in suite 101, and let me tell you. The people that work there are very nice and do a very good job at making you feel at home. Every time we go back to New Orleans we are not staying anywhere else. From the guys that park the cars to the people who work the front desk they are the best. So close to Bourbon and still so quite. We loved this place. Thanks, Charles at the front desk we really miss you!!!! Mimi and Papa K.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Location is tops!”
Reviews.Author: dutchdob
Reviews.Content: Room was clean we got the last one for the night room 105 which I must say if you are a light sleeper this is not your room. Its right by the entrance the halls are loud and our bathroom shared a wall with the dish kitchen for the hotel restaurant. Nonstop racket til 1am. We didn't really care though, there are three late night food restaurants on the same block, and the best part of bourbon street is right outside the hotel. We stayed out until then anyway. We also stayed at Holiday inn french quarter and I would say this is a nicer hotel, and the location is also a lot better. We also had a very nice big tub with jets, very nice room for the 129 dollars I paid. Would stay again, the staff was friendly, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: smarttoddy
Reviews.Content: Normally I stay at different French Quarter hotel but since members of my family had already booked here we decided to give it a try. As indicated in previous reviews, yes this is an older property so you are not getting fancy down comfortors and brand new furniture, If you want that you can go around the corner and pay $200 more per night. For a good location in the Quarter with very friendly front desk service, a family owned chain, a breakfast place next door, convenient parking ($28 per night) a reasonable price and within walking distance of all the French Quarter activities I would suggest you give them a try. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place... and would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda L
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans on a Girls Trip. We stayed at the Prince Conti 3 nights. It was good. Now this is a older hotel, so there is older decor. We found the lobby, elevator, hallways and our room was clean. The beds were okay.. the matteresses could be replaced. We had a suite... room 351. I slept on the sofa bed, which wasn't bad. The bathroom had been remodeled and was nice.. it had a bidet, but we didn't try it. We turned it on and giggled! HA! The room had a decent sized mini fridge, hair dryer and coffee pot. We had two flat screens in the room. There was an old (unsuable fireplace even). I took a picture of one of my friends.. and there is a white streak going thru the picture.. hmmm?? Then one night the room got extremely cold. The hotel is supposed to be haunted.. soo??? The hotel staff was very friendly, from the desk clerks (Monica made sure every night when we'd return that we had something to do the next day and made recommedations too). The cleaning people were very helpful too. I would definitely stay there again.. the location is awesome! Definitely try Jagerhaus... we tried a breakfast and a lunch there. Also.. down past Bourbon Street.. Oceana is great and the hotel staff can give you a 10% coupon for there. Their breakfast is HUGE and wonderful.. plus their oysters were great. The raw were good, but the grilled with their own sauce is the BOMB!

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: The mattresses were thin and saggy. The headboard was loose and rattled against the wall everytime we turned over in the bed. The bedspread was "pilled" and faded. There was an "unidentified" waste product underneath the corner chair. Obviously, the floor had not been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: D_elle_D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti during a very busy weekend in NOLA recently. The room we had was perfect for what we wanted (a home base close to the French Quarter) and it had a really nice feel to it. In fact, the whole hotel itself was quaint and quietly welcoming. However, I can't say the same of the hotel staff we encountered - we simply did not experience the same level of hospitality here as we did elsewhere in our travels, and some staff members were a touch on the unfriendly side (although it is possible they were simply just very busy). As a result, I wouldn't stay here again as a first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience and Very Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: gapeach49
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to New Orleans since 2004, so we didn't know what to expect. I wanted to stay at a hotel in the French Quarter that wasn't terribly expensive. The Prince Conti fit the bill. We had a lovely suite with plenty of room and it was so quiet! We were just half a block fom Bourbon Street- easy walking distance to just about anywhere. The staff booked a city tour for us that was very informative. we also felt safe there. The Cafe served good food. We didn't go into the Bombay Club which was located 0n site. We definetly recommed this hotel and we look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ltuminello
Reviews.Content: The location can not be beat. You are literally steps off Bourbon Street. When in New Orleans, you never stay in your room, so take this review with a grain of salt. Our room, 243, was small and the bathroom was very tiny. At the sink you could almost sit on the toilet. This didn't really bother us as we were rarely in the room, but to get ready and sleep. The beds are terrible. We could feel the springs in our back. Seemed like they were 20+ years old. Not comfortable at all. The hotel and rooms are clean. The Bombay bar at the hotel is nice and the food was good. ALL of the staff were very nice and accomodating. We stayed at their sister hotel, Place d'Armes, in November and enjoyed our stay there better though.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: budthrasher
Reviews.Content: Just steps from the heart of Bourbon Street, very nice room, friendly staff and a steal @ $69 per night (+$28 per day parking). We were very happy with our stay. And don't miss the Jagerhaus German restaurant, right across the street. Wunderbar!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AshGator1
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel - literally steps away from Bourbon Street - but the hotel itself is average at best. Pros: The bathrooms seemed recently renovated and the water pressure was awesome. The service was very good, very nice people. The location is perfect for a stay in the French Quarter. Cons: The rooms are old, dingy, stuffy, and the windows don't open so you can never get that musty smell out of the room. The bed and bedding were old, not something you really want to sleep on, not comfortable. The walls were PAPER THIN - I could hear everything that was going on outside my door, in the rooms next door, and the one above (the floor boards creaked every time they walked around). This might be an OK hotel for the traveler that is not really looking to spend any time in the room or get any sleep - like many visitors to Bourbon Street - the bars never close :) But I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, clean - need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: jctusa
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of Travel Advisor reviews and forum posts, we decided on the Prince Conti Hotel. It was a good choice. Located only a 1/2 block from Bourbon Street, you can enjoy the proximity, without all the noise. Sure is convient to have your room so close that you can easily return for a pit stop or unload any purchases, then head back to the action. The hotel itself is older, but clean and the staff is very courteous, we were even treated to a "gift" to celebrate our birthday, which was a pleasant surprise. We were happy with the room itself, although the lighting was a little dark and the walls a little thin, but no real complaints. My only negative would be the WIFI signal, which was very weak in our room 362. I went to the lobby and the internet worked fine, the manager said they would look into the problem and meanwhile suggested I try to connect near the hallway, which did work for one day. The next day, I tried a similar approach with no luck and then went to the lobby to try, where someone finally told me that the entire WIFI was down throughout the building and part of the Quarter itself. It never did come back. We utilized the Hotel parking and had no problem with that, although you may want to leave extra time for the valet to get to your vehicle. Could be a wait. We also decided to dine at the Bombay Club for our birthday celebration and thoroughly enjoyed that experience. (review will follow soon). I would not hesitate to stay at the Prince Conti again or to recommend it to anyone looking for a good value in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Clean NOLA Hotel w/Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: kmcanderso
Reviews.Content: This is our go to hotel when in New Orleans. What makes us return trip after trip is the staff. They know the city & are quick to recommend hidden gems. They remembered our names and greeted us as we entered and left the hotel. A small touch but one that makes us feel at home. The hotel is aging but very well kept & the housekeeping impeccable. Warning: it is a boutique hotel so those expecting a large chain will be disappointed. Yes - the rooms are small but not uncomfortably so. However, when we are in NOLA the hotel is a place to sleep, shower & begin our next adventure so we do not need world class amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Shuver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here MANY times over the last 3 years. It is a wonderful hotel and a great location. Just steps from bourbon street and walking distance to everything else! I was sad when they changed from the real brass keys to the electronic locks. But the atmosphere is great rather you are here for fun or romance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JoElla C
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in this area and overall this hotel met all expectations. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Great location to restaurants, bars and entertainment. Room size good, bathrooms a little small but nothing uncomfortable. Carpet seemed a little 'dated' but nothing seemed to be 'dirty'. Hotel staff is extremely concerned about cleaning rooms and supervisor double checks jobs when completed so overall very pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: JudyJ54
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, easy access. Eat breakfast somewhere else. Not fancy but who stays long in the room in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “really close to Bourbon st”
Reviews.Author: Wenatcheeann
Reviews.Content: only a half block from Bouron st, but much quieter. good service, clean and comfortable rooms, good price. We stayed 2 nights before a cruise and 3 nights afterward - Had different rooms each stay. both rooms were great. We checked in on Christmas day also at about 10:30 Our rooms were ready although we really didn't expect to have a room that early. It may have helped that we were there before the cruise and the desk clerk knew us. We did not have any of the poor experience that was mentioned in a former review. the housekeeping staff was quiet on our floor and very efficient. The lighting in the bathroom was great but the lighting in the room was a little dim. not a problem to me and yes it was amazing that the hotel was quiet even after the football game. I know many of the guests that night attended the game. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance; poor staff”
Reviews.Author: JLynne52
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, brother-in-law and I stayed here for 2 nights after returning from a cruise. It is a quaint, boutique hotel 1/2 block off of Bourbon St on Conti St. We arrived on Christmas day and the woman at the front counter was anything but friendly. I called ahead since we arrived in New Orleans at 10:00am to see if rooms might be ready. She answered "Prince Conti". I said, "Good morning and Merry Christmas!". I heard silence. She relented and said, "oh, yeah, Merry Christmas", with little enthusiasm. She stated that everyone was still sleeping and no rooms would be available but they would be happy to store our luggage and call us when rooms would be ready. We arrived, checked in, stored luggage - she was very matter of fact with no sense of humor at all. She did answer questions, but curtly. When the rooms were ready, my husband got the call on his cell. My sister never got a call. They gave a room to my sis and b-i-l that had no heat. After calling down 2 times, another gal at the desk said that, that particular room should not have been rented as they were waiting for a part for the heater. They sent a staff person up with a new key - for a room on the floor below - but we wanted to be near each other. We called the desk again, they sent up another key for a room 3 doors down, which was nice. They seemed put out at having to do this. The rest of the stay had different front desk staff who were cordial. The hotel was clean and comfortable. It is an old hotel and as such has all of the personality of an older hotel with dimmer lighting and creaking floors, if you like that sort of thing. We rather like the personality of it and spent much time outside the room anyway. The housekeeping staff are loud in the mornings and others staying there were up and down the hallway all night - quite loudly. But then, it is, New Orleans, so you expect that, especially the second night when the Saints beat the Falcons at the Superdome in town. Lots of celebrating! There is a breakfast cafe next door that looks quite good and the Bombay Club Restaurant. We did not eat there as we went around the corner to Cafe Beignet for breakfast and to Deanie's Seafood for dinner - only 2 blocks away. The location is great because it is so near Bourbon Street. A 4-block walk gets you to the trolleys and you can walk all over the French Quarter. We booked this hotel through Hotels.com and got a very good rate - less than $100 per night. Not sure I would stay there again. Next time I would probably book another boutique hotel to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely reserve again”
Reviews.Author: Muriel B
Reviews.Content: A quick trip with friends turned out to be one of the best getaways ever! We stayed two nights at the Prince Conti--great service, very helpful and knowledgeable staff, conveniently located for exploring the French Quarter. Parking the car at the hotel was reasonable and a good choice. Going the few days right before Christmas allowed us to see all the local holiday decorations without fighting the crowds. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TexasCrapsman
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at the Prince Conti. Like many of the smaller hotels in the French Quarter, the Prince Conti is an older property that possesses the charm and quirks that go with age. The hotel is in a great location: one/half block from Bourbon St. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We had a junior suite which provided plenty of room and the bonus of a refrigerator and microwave. The bathrooms are small but adequate. The furnishings were somewhat worn but clean. HVAC was very good for an older hotel. Although the "chain" hotels (Hilton, Sheraton, Omni, etc.) in the Quarter may be more modern, the Prince Conti gives you a great feel for the New Orleans vibe. We will return for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the French Quarter-Quiet, safe & friendly”
Reviews.Author: DestinMarie
Reviews.Content: A quick trip just before Christmas was our favorite trip to NOLA yet --took another couple & we all were quite happy with our accommodations at Prince Conti. I Still can't believe how quiet it was in our room. Kept our car in the secure valet lot cuz we could easily walk everywhere - even to Marigny for the world class Snug Harbor Jazz Club. Breakfast had great crepes in a French cafe, but skip the Bombay Club (attached restaurant) as they ignored our party of four & generally had a stuffy atmosphere, in spite of the warm looking decor. Not a problem because great food is everywhere in NOLA. This time we enjoyed K-Paul's Louisianna Kitchen, Oceana, and of course, Cafe Du Monde beignets! Gave the 4 stars because there was a funky smell everytime I turned on the faucet in our bathroom sink. Our freinds stayed in 263 and it had lovely high ceilings & seemed more roomy than our King room. If you want the best deal, go to the hotel website, as their rates were even better than the December special we found on the internet ad. WiFI worked great in the rooms, but the computer & connection in the lobby is unbearably slow, so bring your own laptop or see if you can use the computer in one of the sister hotels like the Ste. Marie.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: SilverThreads_11
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the door, I felt like family. Brad noticed the receptionist was busy, so he took me into his office to get me checked in. While there, he gave me an outstanding recommendation for a memorable dinner. Knowing that I had only hours to get a taste of the city, Brad and the receptionist pulled strings to get me into a marvelous tour. Being steps from Bourbon Street was quite a privilege - I was able to spend my hours enjoying the scene rather than getting there. To cap the evening, I gave myself a relaxing hour listening to the pianist in the onsite restaurant. Finally, the accommodations were the perfect blend of old world elegance and modern convenience. I only wish I'd had more time to enjoy the hotel itself. An added bonus was the very economical room choice, nice for someone traveling alone. I should mention the staff noted that my assigned room had been painted recently, so, they upgraded me to another (odorless) room. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “great charm, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Prince Conti Dec. 6-10 in a King bedroom. The room was clean, large, and had great views. Our bathroom was bigger than our friends who also had a King room down the hall, but our bathroom their bathroom appeared renovated recently. Ours just had a stand in tiled shower which was perfect. The bathrooms have pedistal sinks and ours had a huge arched window with awesome views of the Quarter. The windows did leak water alittle, but I could have cared less...it's not my house! Housekeeping did a great job too. The rooms had a t.v., but they were old 19" box style. Oh well! We watched very little t.v. anyways! Hotel was clean, EXTREMELY charming!, and had everything we wanted and expected for such an awesome price. It was literally a block away from Bourbon St. and their is NO way I would ever want to stay on Bourbon (way too loud), but it was amazing how just a short block away it was quiet. We did not eat at the hotel or the restaraunt located kind of within the hotel. TOo expensive for our taste! But they seemed classy! Though we did not use it cause we had no car, we saw many people taking advantage of the valet parking right in the hotel. Literally you pulled into a carriage way by the hotel door and someone took your car through the little tunnel to park it. I think it was expensive though...like $25-30 a day. If your coming to hang out in the french quarter or take the street cars to the garden district etc...don't waste your money renting a car...it will just be more of a headache to worry about driving down the little one way roads that are often blocked off, and parking is expensive and hard to find. Walk!The hotel will call you cabs if you need them, but they are plentyful on the roads all the time. Overall..great hotel, in an amazing location for a great price. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service and great price”
Reviews.Author: bkkth
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Prince Conti. It is an older property in the French Quarter, but kept in great shape. I found the hotel on the web by chance but am certainly glad I did. Staff was great, room clean and the price right. I will return to the Prince Conti the next time I visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: quazyquam
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans in October 2011. The hotel was located 1/2 block off of Bourbon Street but we were never disturbed by the fun being had by all! It was very convenient for everything we had planned to see and do. Our room was very spacious, clean and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Be sure and try the breakfast menu at the hotel. Fabulous food and staff! We had a great time and would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we were very pleased with our hotel choice. The location is excellent. It's a small cozy hotel reminiscent of Europe with larger beds and rooms. The staff is also very friendly and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to friends traveling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: EETravelfortwo
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is located less than a block from Bourbon Street, so if you're looking for a French Quarter location with plenty of action nearby, this will work out nicely for you. You can easily walk to bars, French Market, the Riverwalk, and to the St. Charles Trolley. Even Frenchman music district isn't bad walk. The staff was very friendly and did a nice job. Called a great taxi driver for us, held our bags, etc. The room itself was O.K. Smelled a little musty (a fairly typical New Orleans problem with the climate). Not tiny, but not that big. Bathroom was fine. Could hear some of the Bourbon Street noise from the room at night. Didn't blow us away, but will certainly do the job if you need a place to stay. p.s. - great music and a nice atmosphere inside the Bombay Club attached to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dch
Reviews.Content: Good stay. This hotel is close to everything-easy check in . We were in room ready to go out in less than 10 minutes from arrival. Typical New Orleans charm you find old NO hotels.Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CenlaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a girls' getaway. I visit New Orleans often, but this was my first time to stay at the Prince Conti. I felt it was a nice, safe, affordable choice. The hotel is conviently located. It's easy to walk pretty much anywhere you want to go in the French Quarter or Central Business District. It's close to great restaurants, shopping, etc. The hotel is not very big, which gives it a comfortable, homey atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable, but not luxurious. The bathrooms are small, so it's hard for more than one person to get ready at the same time. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff really contributed to our satisfaction with the hotel. Everyone from the front desk associate to the valet was extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. Check in was effortless and it only took a few minutes to get our car when we were ready to leave. I would recommend the Prince Conti and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirlana
Reviews.Content: Located in the French Quarter only a half block away from Bourbon Street. Amenities and attractions all within walking distance. The breakfast at the cafe was excellent and the staff are all professional and courteous. Would recommend going for a martini at the Bombay Club where the bartender will serve you the best martini you've ever had. The room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “JR SUITE ..NOT...”
Reviews.Author: barbhal12
Reviews.Content: When you hear JR SUITE you think this will be a step-up....not so fast....the couch was old and dirty...we were afraid to sit on it...the door in the bathroom stuck and made a noise every time you tried to open or close it...there were several eletrical plug covers missing.....there were 2 closets...the mirror doors on both closets were broke...the bedspreads on both beds needed to be updated and were old.the valet who works days had no personality or people skills.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: lolatoes
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times now and will continue to go back each time we visit New Orleans. We usually travel with a few friends so being able to get a suite at the Prince Conti that has 2 double beds + a pull out sofa for an average of under $200/nite is a great deal! We'll sleep 4-5 people in the room so the extra space that comes with having a separate living room from the bed room is very helpful with all of our chaos. Plus the room has a fridge & micro for our leftovers & beverage storage. The location is perfect if you want to be right in the heart of the frech quarter, it's half a block off of Bourbon on a side street called Conti so it's not quite as loud as being righ on Bourbon but it's still close enough to run back to the room at anytime. If you're looking for complete silence then you'll want to stay somewhere outside of the Quarter, there's always people carrying on a having a good time around Bourbon street so plan on dirty streets and late night hoots and hollers anywhere within about a block of Bourbon. That's not to say that you won't be able to get a good nights sleep at places like the Conti, but if you're a light sleeper, maybe bring some ear plugs just in case, we do :-) The rooms are pretty good here, they have very high ceilings and the bathrooms were just re-done recently. The beds are not very fluffy, but depending on how much you drink during the day you won't notice that anyway. If you're looking for a decent place that has some character, is very reasonably priced, is close to the fun party stuff and nearby to great food and awesome street performers (Royal Street) then the Prince Conti is the place to stay... we look forward to our next trip back there very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carman L
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the French Quarter and totally affordable and clean. Walking distance to everything we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm”
Reviews.Author: beerbob1950
Reviews.Content: Four nights for a business convention and it was what I wanted. Right in the French Quarters about a half block from the middle of Bourbon St. I could walk to the convention center (about 1/2 mile) for my meetings and lots of shopping, dining and partying available during my free times. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and small, I didn't feel like I was in a cookie cutter hotel where you have a hard time telling one hotel from another. The rates were very reasonable. I'm looking for to visiting New Orleans again and this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mandy R
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, centrally located in French Quarter. Cindy was awesome with a medical emergency (not from drinking believe it or not :)) we had and assisted us in finding an emergency room as well as arranging for a late check out and holding our room in case we needed to stay for an extra night. The hotel was clean, the beds are really comfortable and reasonably priced. If you are going to NOLA and need some place to stay I would highly recommend this hotel. Everyone there was super nice, accommodating and assisted with all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTravelista
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti is a traditional and very quaint hotel. It's right in the heart of the French Quarter and within walking distance of everything. I would recommend for couples and singles over families. Just because of where the hotel is located and the activities that happen when the sun goes down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: travelagentnancy
Reviews.Content: Location, excellent staff,spacious rooms and delightfully charming New Orleans feel will make the Prince Conti my new perfect stay! Recently spent 3 days and wanted a convenient hotel within the French Quarter with reasonable rates. From the front desk to the bell captain and cafe waitress everyone was so helpful, kind and very responsive. Thanks Vann for your assistance. There are more luxury properties but for a great stay at a fantastic price, nothing beats the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Peggy”
Reviews.Author: Peggy K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of wedding party recommendartion and was greatly satisfied. Excellent location in French Qtr; close everything within walking distance; yet quiet and charming. I would definitely rebook! Staff extremey courteous and helpful. Room good/bed comfy. Two small issues while the bathroom was new and modern there was no vent for shower steam. Also, our room was located near the "noisy" ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jamesmaddy
Reviews.Content: We liked the Prince Conti hotel, itâ€™s half a block off Bourbon Street, far enough to still be quiet. The room was clean and comfortable, we had a good sized room, particularly after arriving from New York. The standout is the desk staff, particularly Lisa who clearly likes her job & is enthusiastic about New Orleans. We appreciated the time she took to mark various places on the map for us & gave us recommendations and discount vouchers for restaurants. The cafe is next door is lovely for breakfast with lively wait staff â€“ but not the place if youâ€™re in a rush!! If we were to return to New Orleans, weâ€™d stay there again & recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Staff, Great Price & Location!”
Reviews.Author: JPenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prince Conti at the end of September 2011 for our anniversary, and are still completely smitten! The hotel has an old vintage charm, the bed was comfy, and the entire staff was so warm, friendly, and helpful. If you want to be close to Bourbon Street, but not on it â€“ this is the place! Also, breakfast at their CafÃ© was also very good. We fell in love with NOLA and will definitely be going back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Martin P
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect - close enough to everything in the French Quarter but far enough away from the noise of Bourbon St. Staff were very friendly & helpful - got my son a wheel chair to use for the length of our stay when he injured his foot. The upkeep of the hotel could be a little better: scratched up hallway walls & worn furniture, and the wait staff in the breakfast cafe need some improvement, but overall it's still a great value.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here twice (Oct 2010 & Aug 2011) and will again”
Reviews.Author: jay n
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the place to me as a safe comfortable place to stay when travelling alone and it sure was! The location is perfectly convinient. The rooms are clean & cozy, and the staff were all perfect--helpful and friendly without being obsequious or "corporate." The breakfasts in the cafe can't be beat! I felt I got my $'s worth both times, & I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Voodo fest weekend (Halloween weekend)”
Reviews.Author: Michele D
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel during Halloween weekend, it was in the perfect location of all of the activities around Bourbon Street. Excellent service by the following employees-Lisa, Myia and Ava.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween weekend 2011”
Reviews.Author: JawsSD
Reviews.Content: Friends from Oh, Ca and Tx joined forces to celebrate the weekend and were well taken care of by the staff at Prince Conti. Great location and the accommodation are pretty good. Rooms are not large but adequate. Bombay Club in same bldg provides Great entertainment drinks and food - a bit upscale but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Alisa L
Reviews.Content: We live on the north shore and just wanted to get away for a few days for our anniversary. Prince Conti was a very Good choice. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. All of the staff treated us with respect and courtesy.. We truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Update needed”
Reviews.Author: Kendall M
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for visiting the French Quarter. However the rooms are in desperate need of upgrades. The doctor is dated and feels dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: ElaineRicci
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked a room at the Prince Conti on fairly short notice, as we had been staying in Cajun country and decided on a whim to spend a night in New Orleans before heading to Alabama and Florida. We couldn't have picked a better hotel! The Prince Conti is an older hotel, but clean and charming. The rooms are remarkably soundproof, which was a delighful surprise to us, as the hotel is within a short walking distance of Bourbon St. We found the price very reasonable, considering the location and classiness of the place. The staff was most friendly and accommodating. The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable (even my husband thought so, and he is extraordinarily picky when it comes to mattresses). We did have to wait a little while for our car, as many people were checking out at the same time, but that wasn't a problem for us, as we were not in a particular hurry; if you will be in a hurry, you might wish to check out early to avoid the rush. That said, we recommend the Prince Conti highly and hope to stay there again when we next visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “It's pronounced Kahn Tie!”
Reviews.Author: vialux
Reviews.Content: First of all congratulations to both management and the owners for establishing such an accommodating and professional staff. All of the employees were great. The hotel's location is perfect just one block north of Bourbon right in the heart of the French Quarter. Everything you could possibly need is within crawling distance. The deluxe king room I rented was nicely appointed and spacious enough to spread out a bit without feeling cramped. Other rooms may feature views while I was treated to mechanical waste in the adjacent alleyway. Keep the shades drawn and enjoy the room decor instead. Really a non issue regardless, as whose awake during daylight in the quarter? The only thing I have even leaning toward a complaint is that the walls are mighty thin. I was treated to the conversation of retired folks above me and the amorous endeavors of other people somewhere nearby. The direction of the disturbance is often not even identifiable. Just an ongoing muffled rumble when guests are present. For a real treat be in your room when the cleaning staff puts the tidy on the room over yours and play pin the tail on the moving vacuum on your ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: country1944
Reviews.Content: Made reservation at the welcome center upon entering state. Saved $30 by doing so. Since we didn't have a chance to go online to check it, we were more than a little nervous about what we would find. Could not have been happier with choice. As others have said, great location, quaint and clean. Bonus is security of parking area. Can walk to anyplace in French Quarter. Wanted to get an early start in morning, so we ate at hotel coffee shop. It was adequate but considering where we were, should have spent a little more time and gone to Deanies. Very cooperative about late check out and leaving car in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: scooby32
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Prince Cont before and yet again it never disappoints. the staff are excellent, room large and clean, location fantastic and at a good price. I have stayed at other hotels in the quarter but this little gem beats them all, not fancy but true New Orleans hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: momideerst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what I call "shabby chic" but very clean. It is a half block from Bourbon St., 3 blocks from St. Louis Cemetary #1 and an easy walk to the French Market. The casino is also walking distance (about 12 blocks). The staff is pleasant and well-informed. The room was small but adequate for 2 adults. Free WIFI, coffeemaker and hairdryer. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom was adequate. Considering the price we were more than satisfied.
