Across from the lobby is the hotel restaurant and I highly recommend starting your day with breakfast there. (ask at the desk for a $2 discount coupon). Parking cost $30 a day. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New Orleans. We have stayed at pricier hotels on Canal and Poydras Sts. but found the Print Conti to have more of the New Orleans "flavor". 2 other couples in our party stayed at the Prince Conti and everyone was very satisfied with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfy room, low price, in French Quarter, walk to French Market”
Reviews.Author: atomicgrandma
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling alone, I was still very at ease here in the hotel and the French Quarter area. Staff were very helpful. My room was small but I had all I needed for my 2 night stay including free wifi and coffee maker. If you like pristine luxury you may be disappointed (carpet was kind of old) but If you like lower price, somewhat funky, this hotel is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: paesano223
Reviews.Content: Great Location close to all of the action in the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but very clean and everything worked. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: Hi all, my wife and I just stayed at the Prince Conti in downtown New Orleans while I attended a conference. The hotel came highly recommended by a friend and in talking with others at the convention I am convinced we got the best deal in town. The rate was good, the room was clean, and the staff were more than accommodating. In turn, I now recommend the hotel for anyone looking for the charm of the french quarter without all the aggravation of french quarter drama. A+

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: rhonda c
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great French Quarter location. The room we stayed in was small but very nice and very clean. The hotel was convenient to everything in the Quarter. I recommend the hotel for price and location. I will book again!

Reviews.Title: “NO A/C, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: InkyAnnD
Reviews.Content: We checked in and immediately noticed our air conditioning was not working. They sent a maintenance technician, who was no help. We continued to contact the front desk, which they sent their bell boy to our room who offerred no assistance. We were transferred to a new room the next day, but were not compensated for the first night or even given an apology. It is close to Burboun, but if you can find somewhere else for the same price do it.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful choice for staying in a boutique hotel near Bourbon Street. We couldn't have been happier with our choice! The hotel is right, and I mean RIGHT off Bourbon Street on Conti and within close walking distance to almost any tourist site/event anyone wants to see or do in New Orleans. We were within steps of Bourbon Street, and the street noise was almost nonexistent inside our room and private courtyard. The room and bathroom were appropriately sized. The beds and bedding were fine for us. The staff was some of the friendliest and helpful we've experienced in my travels to New Orleans. Thank you "Cindy" for help at the front desk. From other previous reviews on Trip Advisor, we learned to ask for one "the back room suites", and were not disappointed. it's well worth the price for the King suite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the French Quarter! We'll be back another time and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Home in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins4LIFE
Reviews.Content: This was our third time visiting New Orleans and our first at the Prince Conti. The whole experience was great! I never fault anybody for their negative reviews or personal opinions but after staying at the PC myself I wonder if these people stayed at the same property. Like the last reviewer we showed up 3 hours before check in and were greeted quite friendly by every member of the staff. It seemed to be an overly busy Tuesday morning but the front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. Knowing we were way early and would have to wait I was kind of curious to see how we would be treated. After we were able to leave our car and baggage at the hotel we went to lunch and recieved a call from the front desk about an hour and a half later saying our room was ready. We had a Jr. Suite 1 King bed that was plenty big. The room and bedding was in great shape and everything was very clean. The bathroom was spotless and the shower had great water pressure.(a factor most people are concerned about). Being so close to Bourbon St. allowed us to come back and freshen up our own drinks(a very good way to save at leat $30-$40 a night) and use the facilities when needed. We heard no noise coming from Bourbon St. when we did turn in for the night. I have stayed at 3 different hotels within the French Quarter and buy far this was my best experience. We will definately stay here when we return next time!

Reviews.Title: “We Will Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Connie S
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti was possibly one of the best hotel experiences, ever! Check in is at 4pm, but we arrived at 12:15pm. Ava, the fabulous lady who check us in, said our room was ready, and we could go right up. The staff was the genuinely friendly, courteous to a fault and they treated each other exactly as they treated their guests. Our room was clean and in good repair, and the housekeeping staff were great. The hotel is literally a half a block from Bourbon Street, and within walking distance of anything in the Quarter we wanted to see, including the street car scenic tour of the Garden District. I highly recommend Prince Conti and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Prince Conti on a trip to New Orleans with friends. The hotel was very nice and well maintained. The rooms were spacious and had a classic, "turn-of-the-century" New Orleans style with all of the modern conveniences you'd want. The hotel is very secure. The front desk and parking staff were extremely professional and helpful. Plus, the location is fantastic. Less than a block from Bourbon Street, making it easy to stumble back! Yet, it was far enough away so that the hotel room wasn't enveloped in the sounds (and scents) of Bourbon Street once it was time to call it a night. All in all, this was a great hotel at a ridiculously great price. I would highly recommend the Prince Conti!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: April S
Reviews.Content: Clean, cheap, quiet,totally enjoyed out stay... Just steps from Bourbon St... The only hotel I will ever stay at in New Orleans...

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the room with the confrence table and court yard”
Reviews.Author: Kevin O
Reviews.Content: It is the best hotel I have stayed at in NOLA and likely the cheepest. gives you the full Fench Quarter experience and it is close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valexSpring
Reviews.Content: Clean, cheap & just steps from Bourbon St. Not well staffed. Valet, concierge, maintenance man was ALL the same guy! Reported flaming wall plug twice and it never got looked at. Bar closed before 10:00 p.m although we heard it was nice. Cafe was open very limited hours but it was VERY GOOD! Hotel staff was very nice just not nearly enough of them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: Great value, excellent service, clean, comfortable, convenient! We will definitely stay here again. We couldn't ask for anything better! We even were given a complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary! Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were in New Orleans recently for a Saints game and had the pleasure of staying at the Prince Conti. We go to NOLA often, but this was our first stay here and what a pleasure. From the excellent, professional staff to the generous sized rooms and the Sweet Potato pancakes in the on site cafe. Thanks Guys, we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Nawlins Hospitality missing here”
Reviews.Author: jmsdcs1411
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed to find that one of our old favorites is no longer the warm, hospitable place we once knew. A few months ago we were in NOLA, and discovered that the Prince Conti had been renovated. So, we recommended the hotel for our next family gathering. We were so excited for our extended family (four rooms, including a suite, were booked) to experience the warm hospitality that we had enjoyed on so many visits to the hotel . Instead, we found that it is now just another hotel with no regard for their clientele. Check-in, check-out and don't bother us... this is the attitude we experienced. We truly love NOLA and visit every few months and we are heartbroken that the wonderful people that made it such a special place seem to have disappeared in the aftermath of KATRINA. For our next visit, we will return to the Bienville House...so far, its the only place we've found the old, traditional warmth of NOLA hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a Prince”
Reviews.Author: rcdave_10
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in New Orleans with family members <mini family reunion> and chose the Prince Conti due to it's location and historic appeal. First the good: Location is fantastic - less than a block to Bourbon St. Also, it's home to the famous Bombay Club where one can sip and enjoy specialty martini's. The price for the rooms were really low for that area of the French Qtr <$139 plus tax>. The ambiance was what you would expect in an old French Qtr Inn. Now the bad: Walls are paper thin, so be careful how loud you are... The staff were mostly helpful - until we asked to extend our checkout from 11:00 to noon. They refused to even consider it, which then caused us other problems at our family bfast at Brennan's. While trying to enjoy our VERY Expensive bfast, we had to ask family members to run <litteraly> back to hotel to remove suitcases from rooms and then leave Brennan's a second time during our VERY Expensive bfast to remove the vehicle from the valet. We were told "if you don't remove your car by noon, it's not going to be pretty" WTH??? We'll most likely not be back at the Prince Conti after that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: My first visit to New Orleans and I took a chance on this hotel.We LOVED IT!!! The staff was excellent from the time we pulled in to the time we left. It was clean, affordable and a half block from Bourbon St. The hotel restaurant was wonderful as well (they are only open for breakfast). Will go back to this hotel when we go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great staff, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ScorpionCelt
Reviews.Content: The staff were simply lovely, especially Cindy at the front desk who helped a good friend of mine out in a tight jam with another hotel during a very busy weekend. The accommodations are solid - nothing overly fancy and well priced for the location. Some very charming features of the hotel, and definitely a New Orleans feel, which is nice. This is likely our destination hotel for years to come on Labor Day weekend. Thanks for a great stay! You did me and my group proud!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel just a half block from Bourbon street in the French Quarter. The employees, especially Cindy, are very courteous. The rooms are clean and free WiFi. Great hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of charm and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nerowoof
Reviews.Content: Came in for Southern Decadence over labor day weekend. Arrived early and experienced no troubles checking in, Cindy at the front desk was very helpful all weekend and made sure our stay was top notch. All the staff are very friendly and the rooms had a nice New Orleans charm and were clean. Have stayed in many hotels in the French Quarter but don't need to find a new place after this year. Looking forward to booking again next year at the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Cindy is my savior!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen A
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at another New Orleans hotel and had a nightmarish experience the first night!! My buddies all got rooms for Labor Day Weekend at the Prince Conti so I called one of them early at 8:00am because I didn't want to spend another minute at the other hotel asking if they knew if they had any rooms open at the Conti. He called down and spoke to Cindy and she hooked me up with a room that had been cancelled due to Tropical Storm Lee. She was an absolute pleasure to deal with! The room was clean(unlike the other hotel), the internet worked(unlike the other hotel), and the sheets were clean(unlike the other hotel). I will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in NoLa!!! Thank You Cindy! Thank You Cindy! Thank You Cindy!!! You are a savior!!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Hotel New Orleans, LA”
Reviews.Author: MomaDChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about a block from Bourbon Street. The employees were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The only drawback is no pool, so you have to go to Hotel Marie which is about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLJJWEIS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to everything in New Orleans. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable! I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti is my favorite French Quarter hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MelaniePF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close enough to Bourbon Street and other main attractions in the French Quarter but without being right in the center or the mayhem. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and I always find good deals on rates for them. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: UndomesticGoddess
Reviews.Content: One of the couples on our weekend get-away found this little gem of a hotel and decided that we should all stay here for the first night! The cost of the room made us a bit nervous...we had never stayed in a room with this type of pricetag! It was Dirt cheap (off-season) and 1/2 a block from the middle of Bourbon Street! (My husband and I upgraded to a suite to make ourselves feel better about the booking!) Prince Conti is a historic boutique hotel, with fabulous service, clean antiquated rooms, up to date amenities and location, location, location. There is also a 'ghost' that hangs out at the Bombay Club to add to the mystique! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JHender161
Reviews.Content: After visiting New Orleans many times and usually only needing a place to put our heads we decided to stay somewhere more reasonably priced. We made reservations at the Prince Conti and were not disappointed. From the time we arrived our hosts made us feel welcome and appreciated. The front desk, housekeeping and bell staff were friendly and accomodating. While check in is not usually until 4PM we were allowed to check in at 1PM. Believe me at other locations in NOLA this has not been the case. The room was clean and fresh and more than served its purpose and a little more since the weekend was full of rain. The room did have a windown to allow light in but next time we will ask for a room with a street view. I am a pillow monger and the pillows were a little thin but I was ok with that since there were 5. This location is a quick 1 minute walk to everything on Bourbon street but without the noise. This location does not have a pool but the staff offered us use of the pool at one of their sister properties just a block away. Very nice and happy with our decision.

Reviews.Title: “best birthday ever”
Reviews.Author: cheryl_cooner
Reviews.Content: room was great. a older hotel with all the new orleans charm you can handle.rooms were clean.service was excellent.the staff even sent up a bottle of complimentary champagne shortly after my arrival.started my birthday and my visit off to a wonderful start. staff was helpful with restaraunt and entertainment suggestions. location was steps away from bourbon street. never want to stay anywhere else. we were made to feel welcomed and like we had made new friends.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandotsan
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New Orleans and the French Quarter..and the best. This hotel is located less then one block from Bourbon St. and all its noise...but we did not hear any thing at all..we satyed in the mini suite and it was great..when we return we will stay here again...LOVED IT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Love at first sight"”
Reviews.Author: Noon225
Reviews.Content: My family and I first experienced the Prince Conti Hotel about two years ago. We came down every year for the "Bayou Classics", a historical football game between Southern University and Grambling Tigers, right after Thanksgiving. It's a great place to stay. Friendly and very helpful staff members, clean and fashionable rooms, plus you are within walking distance of all the great shops within the French Quarter. It's a gem at a fraction of the cost. My family and I always enjoy our stays there. And just like the last two years before, we will look forward to our stay there again. "It's priceless"!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of our best experiences!”
Reviews.Author: thelittlebucket1
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip for months, my first time to New Orleans. We chose the Prince Conti because it had several good reviews and was right in the middle of where we wanted to be. The staff, they are Great People! Friendly and helpful no matter what is happening. The room we stayed in was on the third floor, (ok the only draw back, ice machine on the second floor.) We had a kingsize bed, yes they are firm.... but not bad beds! I have a sleep number bed at home, it is difficult for me to quickly adjust to any bed. But I slept just fine on this bed, if you look, the mattresses are brand new. So, I think that some of the other reviews were really overkill. We had a great stay at Prince Conti, we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JennTravelRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with 2 friends just for a girls getaway.. we had a great time! This hotel is in a great location, just around the corner from Bourbon St.. you can easily walk anywhere! The accomodations were clean, I just thought the bathroom was a bit cramped as it is just a pedestal sink with a tiny ledge below the mirror to put your makeup etc which was rough with 3 girls, but it really was a great trip! Reasonably priced as well, compared to the other hotels on/close to Bourbon anyway. If you are looking for a cheaper place, you can definitely stay further away from all the action. And as far as New Orleans in general.. we hada great time! When we weren't drinking or eating on Bourbon, we did a plantation tour and an airboat tour.. awesome! Tons of fun and learned a lot! I can't wait to go back to New Orleans! Just be prepared to gain at least 5lbs from all the excellent restaurants!!

Reviews.Title: “True French Quarter feel!!”
Reviews.Author: soulmates1128
Reviews.Content: We love the prince conti. It's the only hotel we stay at in New Orleans. The hotel is right off of bourbon st. and in walking distant of everything!!! The staff is great, rooms are nice, and its one of the few hotels with onsite parking. We try and stay at least once a year!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and we will visit again”
Reviews.Author: steve m
Reviews.Content: This property is well situated int he French Quarter and convenient to all area attractions. The service staff was extrmemely friendly and more than accomodating in answering questions and making recommendations. The dpouble bed deluxe room was larger than we expected, well maintained and very clean. An excellent value for the price. We'll visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: SammyinLA
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. Small but good rooms with great furnishings. The hotel staff were all very friendly. Less than a 5 minute walk to the thick of the action on Bourbon St, but far enough away not to be annoyed by it all. Great place to stay with or without children, and especially for someone without transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: debdup
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Prince Conti hotel in the French Quarter. This has been at great experience all the way around. All of the staff have been very friendly and helpful. There are 3 adults in our party and the room is perfect: tastefully decorated, very clean and peaceful. We booked on the hotels web site and got a great rate of $ 53.00 a night for 2 Dbl beds. Parking is $28 a night, but that is pretty normal for the area. Half a block from Bourbon St. Read a couple reviews that the beds were uncomfortable , that was not the case for us- slept like a baby. Try the Blue Plate Cafe - The food and service is great .

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps not for Royalty, but within my Budget and Style”
Reviews.Author: wlamb123
Reviews.Content: Turn-ons: the rooms were well-furnished and stylish, typical amenities included coffeemaker, cable television and soap/lotion/shampoo, the service and location cannot be beat. Turn-offs: the shower was a wee-bit disappointing (awkward shower head), the elevator was slow and the lights flickered as the elevator approached my floor. Parking may be a hassle. Yet, I would return depending upon another hotel's availability. A great second choice in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time and Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: E2275
Reviews.Content: Really can't beat the location. You can stumble from Bourbon street into the hotel. It's a block away. The staff is courteous and helpful. Everything was in walking distance and rooms were quiet and comfortable. If there was a complaint, it would be that there are no places to get ice on our floor. However, going down a flight of stairs to the second floor is a small price to pay for the location and price. We also liked the Bombay Club which was a nice low-key spot to grab a drink and relax. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: sjsanchez
Reviews.Content: When I got to the Prince Conti Hotel, there was a mix up with my reservation. They had me arriving a day later. Once they realized what happened, Lisa, who was at the front desk went out of her way to make sure that I had a place to stay for the night and booked me a room at a very discounted price at a sister hotel. When I returned back the next day for my room, they had my room ready for me even though there must have been 4 families waiting for their rooms! The Prince Conti is well worth the stay and is only down the block from Bourbon Street to boot. I will certainly stay here on my next trip to New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and prices”
Reviews.Author: butterkatyafly
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for great location and modest pricing. I loved the interiors of my room. Although the view from the window was disappointing. A roof and walls of another building...

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonaldMacD
Reviews.Content: I was recently in New Orleans on a business trip and following a tip form a good friend, I decided to stay at the Prince Conti. I knew that I was going to be busy during the day but wanted to experience the city during the evenings. I delighted to find that the options offered to me by the manager were amazing. He directed me to the perfect spots to unwind from a long day of meetings. I was directed to some of the most amazing restaurants I have ever been to and was even sent to the local spots to grub on what New Orleanians feast on. I would never have gotten to experience these things if I had not stayed at the Prince Conti. I am planning another trip to New Orleans for me and my wife and I am relieved to know exactly where I will be staying. I know we will be taken care of and given the best reatment while staying at a gem like the Prince Conti. I hope this helps any potential guest decide to book there nights with this hotel. Thank you again and I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little gem with an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: mudpuppy_17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who stays there frequently. We all live about an hour from the city, and sometimes it's great to stay a night or two. We were really impressed with this little place!! The location could absolutely not be better- you are a block from Bourbon (although the hotel is quiet as can be..) and centered in the midst of an array of fabulous restaurants. Our room was comfy with great views...and if you go on a Sunday, as we did, you'll find yourself paying an unbelievably low price. The Conti is our new go- to spot in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hotel is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, if you want to be close to Burbon st. and the rest of the French Quarter. The hotel is clean, and the room was spacious and quiet, but the whole ensemble lacked charm, and the touches that make a place special.

Reviews.Title: “plan to be back”
Reviews.Author: carlvidrine
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Rooms where clean and the price was inexpensive. Staff was friendly and informative about The French Quarter. Location was 1/2 block from Bourban St. which made the entire French Quarter within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle Free, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FilmNoir23
Reviews.Content: In town for one evening. GREAT rate ($59), GREAT location (In the French Quarter). Was able to find cheaper parking a couple of blocks back on Rampart, which was NO issue. Rooms are small and quaint. Was not there long enough to sample The Bombay but hear it is quite nice too. All in all, a charming little Hotel...could not have been happier for a quick in and out stay in the heart of New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, hard to find though”
Reviews.Author: oktravelerokc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans on our way home from Gulf Shores Alabama. We had stopped at the Louisianna rest stop and ran into a really nice little lady named Barbara who kinda sorta talked us into staying in New Orleans for the night on the way home. She said we would really like it. So, we thought, what the heck, why not. The welcome center has specials with these hotels and we got a reasonable room rate for the night. We get there and it is very difficult to find so we drove around the block about 10 time and finally we spotted there small sign. Very pretty building nice clean rooms, the only complaint was the beds were really short and uncomfortable. Service was good and the people were nice. We stomped around Bourbon Street til all hours of the morning and had a good time. It was different!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location, and also Price - all GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: grffn715
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to everything, because it is located right in the French Quarter. Any place worth going outside the French Quarter was close with the help of the Trolley Car or an inexpensive cab. By the way, Steve at Jefferson Cab Company (504-207-777) or directly (504) 222-3964 was the best cab ride (early, efficient, nice manners, personable) that I've had in a long time. It's less expensive than the main cab companies, but Steve represents his lesser known cab company very well. The only complaint that I had about the hotel (I was nervous because I was traveling solo, but no problem), was that it was a bit noisy from the street. If you are a light sleeper, you might want to bring earplugs or ask for a room away from the street). The staff was VERY friendly, the gourmet cafe there at the Prince Conti was excellent! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: WeenjoytravelingUSA
Reviews.Content: When you are one-half block off of Bourbon Street and only pay $ 51.00 per night you shouldn't complain. In fact, there was nothing to complain about. Room service was excellent. Hotel was clean. We enjoyed it all, no problems, no complaints. Only the valet was kind of high, but they all are. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: AndyFWB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last year for our engagement weekend. Had a good time. The location is excellent - within a few minutes from Bourbon Street and Jackson Square. Rooms are rather small and a bit damp - reminded me of lots of hotels in France. Parking is a bit expensive but advisory - nearby complimentary parking was nowhere to be found!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: pookibabe
Reviews.Content: We got a room in the back building very large and quiet booked through their website for 59

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room was only so so”
Reviews.Author: kp196426
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Prince Conti by the staff at the Hotel Marie since they had no availability and we booked the last room late in the day. We paid $89 for a room with two beds with a view of a brick wall and a really strange looking skylight. In addition, we paid $28 for parking. The room was OK, but the drain in the shower was slow which resulted in having to stand in several inches of water while showering. In addition, when I pulled back the sheets there was a long dark brown hair in the sheets-eww! I don't know if the hair belonged to a member of the housekeeping staff or to a previous guest, but it was late and we were exhausted so we just slept in the bed anyway. Location was great, just a half block from Bourbon Street, although we probably will chose another hotel next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return if they updated their beds!”
Reviews.Author: sunshin3daydr3am
Reviews.Content: There really are a lot of positives about the Prince Conti; the staff is pleasant, cheerful, and helpful; the location is perfect, situated right between Bourbon and Dauphine (but I got none of the noise from Bourbon at all), and you can easily walk just about anywhere you want in the French Quarter. We arrived very early in the day and not only did the staff store our bags for us, but the clerk took our cell phone number and called us about an hour later to let us know that they had a room ready and would check us in early. Not many places will treat you like that. Then, there's the negatives. The big problem was the beds, which we joked throughout the stay must have been left over from the Civil War. I have never in my life slept on such an uncomfortable, worn, mushy bed, where a spring is literally stabbing you no matter how you try to contort your body to get away from them. My back STILL hurts from sleeping on these beds! If the hotel would just buy a few new mattresses, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. The other negative was slight, and that had to do with the cleanliness of our room. The cleaning staff had left hair all over the tub (which I just cleaned up myself) and the sheets were pretty old and had some holes in them. We didn't get daily service, so it was like this when we checked in. There is free wireless Internet available in the guest rooms, but I generally found that it was slow and seemed to "go out" every five minutes or so when I tried using it. Overall, this is a solid hotel, but be very careful about the beds. Also, make sure to bring ear plugs with you because you'll hear every word spoken in the corridors and every slamming door (though that beats Bourbon St noise any time).

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip!”
Reviews.Author: LARC130
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay at this hotel and we will continue to come back. The service is always friendly, the price is right and the location is fantastic. Visited the Bombay Club for the first time and it too is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “My No-Fail Hotel In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: railfanppk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here infrequently for years, even well before the storms. I love the location and every room I've had has been what I expected or more - which is to say a very good room, clean, comfortable bed, quiet. The location of this hotel is what I like - near Bourbon Street without being on it, walking distance to some very good restaurants and best of all, with one of the nicest hotel bars in all of New Orleans, the Bombay Club. Very upscale, good drinks and service, nice appetizers. Live quiet, civilized music many evenings. The Bombay Club is a good place to close out a day of "doing" New Orleans, a city which needs all the (tourist) dollars it can get. Broussard's Restaurants (recommended) is right across Conti Street. Also right across the street is a "German-style" restaurant (avoid at all costs) which might be one of the worst restaurants, both service and food, in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better overall atmosphere!!!”
Reviews.Author: tourdeles
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Prince Conti was absolutely wonderful!!! Would recommend to everyone and anyone that wants to truly experience New Orleans!! Lovely rooms and great staff. The cafe downstairs has excellent breakfast!! I cannot wait to return to NOLA and will definitely stay at Prince Conti!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyicekat
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti was an awesome place to stay at and at a great rate. Great location with it being in the heart of the French Quarter and only a block from Bourbon Street. Staff was more then helpful and very friendly. I did find parking very expensive at $28 plus tax per day. Room was very clean and comfortable. I found the bed to be more comfortable then some expensive places I have stayed in. The only thing about the rooms and some have complained about it in other reviews is the walls are very thin and can hear other people going in and out, but it wasnt that bad. I would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: dnmoses
Reviews.Content: We spent our Christmas in New Orleans here. It was a great value for the location. A lot of the hotels in the Quarter run really great specials during Christmas. We were in the Quarter a block from Bourbon. There were plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Our room was spacious. The bed was a little hard and the pillows too soft for my liking, but it was clean. Continental breakfast was included in the price of our room. It was enjoyable. We had Christmas dinner in the attached restaurant "Bombay Club". It was a pre fix menu. I thought the meal was really good and the service impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Uncomfortable, & mediocre--saving grace was location”
Reviews.Author: ayprlthing
Reviews.Content: Perks: If you want to be downtown in the heart of all the debauchery and fun of Bourbon Street, this is your hotel. I lived in New Orleans for a little over a year and this little place is right in the heart of the French Quarter--less than a block from Bourbon and about a 10 minute walk to Cafe Du Monde or Canal Street to the street cars/buses. We didn't have a car but I believe there was parking available for an extra daily fee. We stayed 04/07/11 - 04/10/11 which was during French Quarter Festival, a little busier than your average time of year but not quite as crazy as Mardi Gras or Jazz Festival. And now the negative... 1.Our room was the "Double Bed Petite Room" -- it was $199 for Thursday and jumped to $279 for Friday and Saturday. Waaaayy over priced. It seemed pretty run down and not really updated. 2.The room was extremely small and often difficult for my husband and I to move around at the same time. It didn't look anything like the pictures on the website. The bed was shoved against a wall and there was a small "desk" on the other side of that. I wouldn't even want to call it a bed--it was more like a mattress stuffed with potatoes. No amount of alcohol could have made that bed comfortable. 3. It is near Bourbon Street so of course as soon as you walk out, the smell will hit you. 4.The cleaning staff seemed friendly enough but on our 2nd day/night there, I noticed that some of my expensive facial cream ($30 bottle) went missing. I reported it to the front desk and was told that a manager would get back to me....I'm glad I didn't hold my breath. I filled out an incident report and everything and got absolutely no follow up with staff at all. I was extremely disappointed about this. 5. Cafe Conti never truly looked open whenever we walked by. It seemed the only time I saw people in there was when it was hotel staff gathering to chit chat. Overall, the room was forgettable. I don't mind paying more for a room if it's got charm and the service and amenities were there but for what we paid, I wish we could have stayed elsewhere. I'll be revisiting my NOLA again but definitely steering clear of Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “family road trip”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRuby011
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti is in the ideal location in the French Quarter. A short walk to all the action on Bourbon St. as well as everything else---shopping and restaurants. Clean and quiet with a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: my2cents88
Reviews.Content: I stumbled on this hotel after doing some search online. It is literally half a block from the busy part of Bourbon Street. Yet, even with a room facing the street, we couldn't hear any noise at all. Valet parking is $28 which is a little steep. However, we parked in a parking gargage on North Rampart, a leisurely short walk away for $15 with in & out privilege. Be ware which website you book though, you can pay $69 instead of the $44 we paid (weekday). We had a "petite room" with a double bed. I was worried the room would feel cramp but it was not. The bed is not the most comfortable I slept in. However, the price and location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great...but”
Reviews.Author: texastwosome22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a junior suite. Hotel is located in French Quarter, 1/2 block from Bourbon St. The good news is the location, the friendliness of the staff and the internet access in room. Other considerations are the darkness of the room; we had all the lights on and opened the drapes in front of the window, and the lighting was still dim. The room and the hotel has seen better days. Day before we left we noticed that there was water on the shelf in the closet and it was coming from the ceiling. It appears that the air conditioning condensate was dripping from the ceiling, and the ceiling in the closet was mildewed. We let the hotel know and they offered to get us another room, but since it was our last night, we stayed. My wife wanted me to mention that the only mirror in the room was in the bathroom, above the sink. She would like to have a full length mirror when getting dressed.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: janefaye
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel was a pleasant place to stay in the French Quarter. Good air-conditioning (which was very nice after walking around hot streets). Great staff. They were friendly and accomodating. I certainly would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: CindyTalbert
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Prince Conti this past Thurs and Friday night. The room was comfortable, the location was perfect and the staff could not have been more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SudieSarah
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about booking a hotel in the Quarter that was so reasonably priced. Was it a dump, too noisy? It was great. A little gem, tucked into a perfect location. Easy walking distance to all the great places. Staff was great, very helpful with recommendations. The room was perfect, nicely appointed, and very quiet even though it looked over a busy Quarter street. I'll certain book it again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Prince of Mildew”
Reviews.Author: thicket123
Reviews.Content: I have always gotten good advice on Tripadvisor, but this recommended hotel was a total bust. After viewing what looked to be charming images of the hotel, my husband and I booked a junior suite for a 4 day getaway. What we got was a dingy, dank, mildew infused, airless cell which had seen one too many partygoers. One inhabitant left the remnants of Bourbon street's finest concoctions on the floor. It was actually difficult to see because it was hidden within with the filthy, stiff, gray carpeting. Since the mass had parked itself right in front of the bathroom, you got the unforgettable experience of stepping on it, with your bare feet, in the middle of the night; the soapy, sopping mess seeping between your toes in fetid runniness....YUM! The bedding made Motel 6 look like the Four Seasons. The top blanket, if you could call it that, was a wafer thin, matted piece of polyester with all the plushness of styrofoam. It was abound with holes and tears from all the years of drunken frolicking. You lay there shivering, in your saggy bed, with the vents moldy air billowing down on you. How lovely....the charm we were looking for! We complained and they offered us another room. We decided to leave and found a wonderful hotel down the street. The staff at the PC never asked us why we were leaving. The front desk woman was surly and could not have cared less. We paid $190 for that sad room. Prince Conti needs a total renovation so don't believe those photos. NO French Quarter charm!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel. Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: FLACHICK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prince Conti and really liked it. It's close enough to bourbon street, yet far enough away that you don't hear any of the noise. It is an easy walk to everything in the French Quarter. (loved the little bar, Erin Rose that is across from the hotel, great Mojitos! ) The staff at the Prince Conti was friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a jr. suite on the 2nd floor. It was a pretty good size and had 2 small closets. We didnt have a great view (one window had a view of the roof, the other window overlooked a narrow garden area) but hey, we werent there to hang out in our room. :) The room was very clean. I was really impressed with the cleanliess of the bathroom. Little soaps, shampoo and lotion are there if you need it. My only suggestion for the room is that they update the bedding (the comforter reminds me of my grandma's from the 1970's and not in a nice antiquey kind of way). We really had a wonderful stay at this hotel and will definitely be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great staff”
Reviews.Author: crumbles1234
Reviews.Content: Great Location, off bourban by 1 block. so cuts down on noise but yet so close... Beds a little rough but worth the low price...

Reviews.Title: “That's where you left your heart...”
Reviews.Author: RichardFlanagan
Reviews.Content: Since moving from NOLA after the storm, whenever I can make it back into town I stay at one of the hotels in the heart of the Quarter. Of all the ones I've stayed at, Prince Conti is by far my favorite. Small enough to be quaint, but spacious and comfortable, the staff were a pleasure and the location was wonderful. The only caveat is that Conti Street intersects with Bourbon right in the middle of the seediest part of the strip clubs. During the day it's not an issue; at night it just means traveling for a block or two surrounded by the worst the Quarter can offer- walk a block down to Royal, though, and you avoid all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: oldtimer60
Reviews.Content: Just 1/2 block off Bourbon Street. Safe and quiet. All staff very helpful. No frills, but the rooms were a nice size, and were immaculately cleaned every day. And the price is right! Can't beat it for value and proximity if you want to be near Bourbon Street. Would definitely go there again! Beware - 3 rooms with no windows. (We didn't have one of those rooms.) Be sure you ask when you reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: ButlerFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Prince Conti. We were lucky enough to have room 104. The Hotel is only a block off Bourbon St. which is just far enough to be away from the roar of the activity there. Our room was over the top, with a private courtyard, huge sitting area, full kitchen and wonderful bedroom. There was also a coffee pot, so we brought our own Starbucks and had a cup every morning before going to Cafe du Mond for breakfast. From there we could walk to all the Bourbon St. places and Decatur St. to get to the Cafe, the Riverfront streetcar line or on to Frenchmen St. which is where all the jazz clubs have gone to. Staff was great, present 24 hours and responsive to all our requests. The manager is a member of the owning family so he was on top of everything. His tips on things were great. Can't recommend this place enough , the photos by the way on the internet dont do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: olgita522
Reviews.Content: For someone that has been to New Orleans before, I knew how important location was...we wanted to be close enough to walk everywhere but at the same time not listen to all the obnoxious drunks on Bourbon Street.....FAB!!! Our Room had no window but had a sky light, at first I was put off by it but then I realized how great it was if you want to sleep in after a night of debauchery!!! The beds could be have been more comfortable but for the price we could not go wrong. It is not a 5 star hotel but who really needs that in New Orleans, it is all about partying hardy!!! I would definitely stay here again....could not ask for better location and the price was right..SPecially if you book through their website

Reviews.Title: “The Conti Is Great”
Reviews.Author: boynurse77
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here more then once, each time the place gets better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with great service and value”
Reviews.Author: McGruter
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Prince Conti Hotel. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Great location near Bourbon street without the noise. Room was very clean, although the view was lacking. Bombay Club and the Prince Conti Cafe have excellent meals with the Bombay club offering live entertainment almost nightly with a laid back atmosphere. On a seperate note, several guidebooks including Frommer's recommend eating at Deja Vu across the street for breakfast. Spend the few extra dollars and save yourself the headache by eating at the Conti Cafe. Ordered breakfast at Deja Vu at seven in the morning, staff were drinking and therefore service was very slow. Waitress was smoking a cigarette when she brought out our two breakfast sandwiches 45 minutes later.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable, clean & right in the heart of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: pwjones44
Reviews.Content: My wife & I brought our 12 year old daughter to New Orleans for a short vacation during Spring Break. We found the staff to be very accomodating. They answered all of our questions & made some great suggestions for places to go & things to do. Their service was very quick & cordial. The entire hotel was clean & tidy, the room was large enough & comfortable. The hotel is 1/2 block from Bourbon Street, so we were right in the midst of the Quarter as soon as we walked out the door. Also, the hotel was so easy to get to from I-10... even I couldn't get us lost! We had a great trip, and the Prince Conti played a large part in our enjoyment. We will definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tabatha98
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you are wanting to hang out on Bourbon st! While it is close enough to walk to just about any attraction in the French Quarter, You are only steps away from the middle of Bourbon St. I have stayed in many hotels in the Quarter and my husband and I decided that this is where we will always stay from now on. The hotel could use a little updating, but it was clean and still nice. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating. The prices are great and the beds were comfy. There was a little issue with the hot water heater but they had it fixed in just a short while. No harm done! While it is about 1/2 block away from the big party, it is far enough way to give you a nice quite place to stay. . If you are hanging out on Bourbon street it is close enough to run back to make a pit stop and not ruin your evening! :) If you are hesitating about this hotel, go ahead and book now!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place during Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: blr5004
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed here during Mardi Gras this year. We chose Prince Conti because of all the reviews I read on TA and I agree with all the positive comments. The hotel is in a fabulous location- just steps away from Bourbon- yet when we were in our room we did not hear the noise from the street. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and took time to answer our 100 questions about where to go and what to do. When we called the front office for something (towels, forks, etcâ€¦) they came to our room within a few minutes. Mardi Gras is such a crazy time, but I felt very safe staying at Prince Conti; they had a great security staff! Our room was plenty large and the beds were comfortable. I have AT&T and we had horrible service in the area (perhaps because so many people were there for MG?) but the hotel did offer free wifi. Our room had a Jacuzzi which was a fun surprise. Something a little different was the fact the shower and toilet were in the same room- there was no separation. It never caused a problem for us but we had to be careful to dry the floor by the toilet good or our socks would get wet. Iâ€™d like to return to Nola someday and when I do I would gladly stay at Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: lizzie1nc
Reviews.Content: I keep thinking I must not have been at the same hotel everyone else is writing about. After much research on trip advisor and seeing such great reviews I decided to stay at the Prince Conti. I booked directly from the hotel so when I saw the room, my first reaction was "wonder what the room would look like if I had gone through a travel site?" Some may say charming and quaint - I would say "tired, worn and needed attention"- at least our room. I know you don't go to New Orleans to stay in your room and we didn't. But the times that you are in your room - it should be comfortable. Our front door was warped and wouldn't shut unless we slammed it. Same for the bathroom door which also had a door handle/cover that needed to be reattached. I can't believe that housekeeping wouldn't let maintenance know that the doors were sticking or that a guest wouldn't have brought it to their attention before I did upon checking out. My guess is they just don't care. Walls are so thin that we might as well been rooming with our next door neighbors since we could hear every word they said. You could hear people's conversations in their rooms as you walked down the hall. There is no space in the bathroom. Only a pedestal sink and a ledge for placing toiletries; a bathtub and a toilet. other good and the bad: We were allowed to check in very early - very nice. We got there at 9:30AM and they had our room before 1PM (not supposed to check-in until 4) Internet is very slow. I will say the room was very clean and I really appreciated that. The room just needed some updating - new comforters, new TV (not that we watched it). Great location in the quarter - no noise from Bourbon Street. Felt safe. Best part of the stay was the Cafe Conti. It does have a great breakfast and great prices. Great vending machines on 2nd floor. I think the rooms on the 2nd floor must be nicer than the 3rd floor (where we were). One side of the hall has only brick so you wouldn't have half the noise. Whole floor just seemed to look better even from the hall. All in all, I probably would choose some place else to stay next time. I want to give it a great rating like everyone else, but just don't see where they are coming from.

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Conti best breakfast in the French Quarter!!!”
Reviews.Author: Plafalce
Reviews.Content: I had the best shrimp, spinach and cheddar omlet I've ever tasted this morning. The shrimp were large and fresh as were the other ingredients. The potatoes were cooked perfectly with peppers onions and deliciously spiced. The coffee was dark and rich just as I like it. The service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there ! Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lgage2
Reviews.Content: my husband and I went there for our 38 year anniversay. Cindy the front clerk and Mike the bell-boy was worth the trip. I will go again only if they work. We were treated important Mike overheard us say it was our anniversary and we had champagne in our room late check out next day and they let us keep our car there the next day until 2pm while we went to french market. we walked everywhere and was in good area to be I could watch bourbon street from our window. room was nice. thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: otisbailey
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel proved to be one of the better places I have stayed during many trips to New Orleans. Valet parking was incredibly easy and the service provided by the hotel for parking was outstanding. we stayed in a suite and the rooms were exceptionally well care for and very clean. there were tvs in both rooms and the suite was very spacious. the hotel was very centrally located and close to everything. My return trips will be booked at this hotel in the future. We stayed during the first part of the Madi Gras season so were a little worried about the noise but it proved to be very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sand_Dawg1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prince Conti the week before Marti Gras this hotel is a GREAT location if you want to hang out and party on Bourbon St. The staff is awesome from the front desk to the bell staff and concierge; one great perk of the hotel is they offer valet parking (this is huge in the French Quarter) at a reasonable price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay, overall.”
Reviews.Author: Woguy
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is located just half a block from Bourbon Street, but it remarkably quiet (we heard little street noise, though the walls between rooms are a bit thin). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but we understand that space is at a premium in that area. The prices are reasonable for that location, but they vary dramatically from weekends to weekdays. Also, you will pay $25 a day to park. Our major problem was that hot water was hard to come by in the bathroom, which was in need of some serious upgrading. It is a good place to say, on balance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Eggs_Benedict
Reviews.Content: Enroute New Orleans stopped at the welcome center. I inquired about hotels in New Orleans and was directed to the wall to call the Prince Conti Hotel. I won't give away the price, suffice it to say I was floored by the deal. The front desk staff was great, the room, while somewhat outdated, was comfortable, clean and quiet. Originaly was going to stay one night and ended up staying an extra night. Highly recommended for value and location, location location - a block north of Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti - C'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: HotMess22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently visited the infamous French Quarter of New Orleans and found it to be everything we wanted and more ... especially our fabulous lodgings. The Prince Conti serviced us extremely well and its great location and understanding staff made us feel right at home. We would recommend it to anyone looking for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: kms314
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at the Prince Conti all around. The service was absolutely delightful--everyone on staff (front desk, bell hops, restaurant servers, etc) were all genuinely kind and wanted to help. They honestly made us feel right at home. The room was perfect, big and very clean. Basic, but just perfect. The location is ideal, right in the quarter, next to Bourbon, but completely silent in the rooms. They brought a bottle of champagne to the room to celebrate my mom's birthday--it was little touches and kind words like that which made our stay unforgettable. The cafe was perfect for breakfast--we ate there almost every day. Our servers were so nice and the food was really good--southern breakfasts and strong coffee! Also, it was pouring almost the entire trip and they always had umbrellas for us to borrow. I don't have a single complaint, truly! I had to move to another hotel (a big, luxury chain) for part of my trip as I had to attend a conference and I was really sad to leave the Prince Conti. The service and location of the Prince Conti was far superior. We loved it and will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Big daddy from DC”
Reviews.Author: zonk404
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! Perfect location in the French Quarters. It was one block from Bourban Street. For the value, you cannot beat it !!! I would stay again in a minute. Hotel was quite and the room had soft towels and extra pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Happy 10th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: RonaldMacD
Reviews.Content: Recently, my wife and I celebrated our 10th anniversary in New Orleans. We could think of no other place to go. I was referred to the Prince Conti by a friend of mine and we decided to stay there. I was not disappointed. The staff was excellent and very accomidating. The location of the hotel to everything we wanted to do was perfect. Staying in the French Quarter is like no other place. We had an issue with our car and trying to park on the street at night but the manager was nice enough to take care of us. He saw our situation and saved us money by offering us free parking. I have never been personally taken care of by a hotel manager, it really made me feel important. I cannot wait until our next visit to New Orleans because now I won't have to worry about where I will stay. i recommend the Prince Conti to anyone looking for a real New Orleans experience. Laissez les Bon Temps Rolles! Eric and his wife Natasha

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Merriment1
Reviews.Content: I had to drop someone off in New Orleans and decided to stay the night. I have stayed in the French Quarter before and I like to try new hotels. I have found a keeper. The staff was wonderful and my stay was great. I could walk to any thing I needed and even thought we were close to Bourbon Street it was no problem. Thanks for making my stay stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: imawandrer
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is located just 1/2 a block from Bourbon St. Very nice location for walking anywhere in the French Quarter. I had read that to get a good night's sleep, to ask for a quiet room, not on the street. That was very good advice! Our room had a window, but no view, just an unused area and the wall across. It was very quiet, so that was good! Friends had a room overlooking Conti St. and they said it was very noisy into the night, from party-ers. They seemed to enjoy the local "flavor" though, so it suited them. The room was well appointed and clean, and we enjoyed the antiquity of it. It was cold in NOLA when we were there and we had some trouble with the heat. It was resolved. There was a free continental breakfast included. We felt the day front desk person was a bit aloof and not too friendly. She was helpful, however, answering all our questions. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Prince Conti is a gem and it is always a pleasure and treat to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: daddysbadgirl
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed another fabulous stay at the Prince Conti Hotel. Once again, the staff was delightful - our vacation was the best ever! This hotel is perfectly located, as Conti Street is very close to Bourbon Street but far enough to get away from big crowds on busy weekends. Also the Prince Conti is home to The Bombay Club, which is a fantastic restaurant that features very talented live music and great food. I can't imagine staying anywhere else while visiting New Orleans - Miss Cindi and the rest of the Conti staff consistently spoil us. Our next visit can't come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LKG1010
Reviews.Content: This was a great smaller hotel that offered us an excellent rate for a group trip. It was located extremely close to all the great French Quarter attractions and the service was fantastic. It did not have breakfast, and the rooms were a tad warm, but clean, affordable and located in an excellent part of the heart of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Stilettoteez
Reviews.Content: We were in NOLA getting married the stay at the Prince Conti was excellent the staff was GREAT attentive they really made our stay easier pleasant. The rooms were cleaned and the over all experience was awesome. I don't think there was anything negative for me to say about our stay there. We've actually decided tat when we return we will definitely stay at the Prince Conti again.

Reviews.Title: “Lisa at the front desk was such a nice lady. She let me bum a cigarette for a review, so here it is!”
Reviews.Author: sthompson157
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The hotel is right off Bourbon Street, was very pretty and we will come back next time we are in town, rates allowing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: lpgoad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prince Conti this week. Hotel is in a great location -- staff was as pleasant and as helpful as they possibly could be. Room was in excellent condition. This is an older hotel with older furnishings, but if you want to be close enough to walk around the Quarter, this is a perfect choice. Will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NewOrleans Stay”
Reviews.Author: JKAR
Reviews.Content: This was a second stay in this hotel for us,last year took friends from Europe for a weekend in New Orleans,it was EXCELLENT then & still is. The staff friendly, helpful, the hotel lobby & rooms have such charm with marble/carpets/molding; furnishings in room beautiful,breakfast in cafe could not have been better,excellent food. Location is perfect 1/2 block from Bourbon St.I cannot say enough good things about Prince Conti Hotel, this will be our place to stay when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location.”
Reviews.Author: dennis30041
Reviews.Content: Very good stay room was better than anticipated. Great location across the street from our favorite bar the DejaVu. Second favote right down the street the Erin Rose. Rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “nice older hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Jimbird65
Reviews.Content: Location is in the French Quarter, very near Bourbon Street, but my room was quiet and I slept well. The staff was pleasant and helped me check in early. My rooms had older furniture, with character, but a newer and comfortable bed. There was some room to move around, but the bed and other furniture took up most of the space. The free wifi was great the first night I was there, but despite a strong signal I could not get on the web on later nights. This was a pleasant stay for me, not to be confused with a deluxe hotel but it served its purpose of providing a pleasant sleep in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationDay1DEC24
Reviews.Content: We had a great time . Room was very clean, staff was very kind, and help us out a lot. would stay here again , close to every thing. Thank you for a great time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: galici
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, including NYE. The hotel's best features are 1) its outstanding location, and 2) the Bombay club's wonderful bar! Our room, with King bed, was tiny. The carpet was dingy. The mattress sucked. The pillows were old... But, we didn't really care all that much. We were never in the room. If this stuff is important to you, look elsewhere or you'll probably be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Price, and Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: kettells
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Prince Conti with my girlfriend. We are college students and on a tighter budget than the gainfully employed and this hotel fell into our price range. The hotel is located just a half block from bourbon but somehow we heard no noise what so ever. The hotel is not ultra fabulous but is great for the price. Surprisingly, we slept better at this hotel than we often sleep at home. Bathrooms are small but workable. They offer free wi-fi which a lot of other hotels we looked at didn't. The small restaurant attached to the hotel serves breakfast but the little cafe across the street is half the price and makes great omlettes and coffee. The staff were very helpful with whatever we needed and happily showed us some "authentic" New Orleans things to do since we didn't want to spend the whole time wandering down Bourbon Street drunk. As with anywhere in the French Quarter, be aware that Rampart Street runs just a few blocks north of the hotel and beyond that is sketchy ghetto-land (just because HBO made a show called Treme doesn't mean you should go there) where you are bound to get robbed, raped, or killed. Not to discourage anyone, just keep in mind to keep your wits about you and not to venture outside the French Quarter unless you know its an O.K. area to enter (Canal Street is not bad unless you get up north of the quarter). But back to the hotel, I was more than satisfied but if you have a bit snobbier tastes maybe spend more money and stay at the Ritz or something. Another thing, if you want to have food in your room like we did, just pick up a foam cooler from Wallgreens on Canal and fill it up with ice from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: mck59
Reviews.Content: I booked on-line sight-unseen based on price and location.Compared to other hotels in the French Quarter the price was moderate so I was surprised at the quality of the hotel and the service. Our first night we were disturbed by noisy partying in the next room and when we complained we were promptly moved to the other side of the hotel. The included Continental breakfast was served at our table by a pleasant waitress in a charming room ,large juice,great coffee,and a toasted croisant with honey. The room was small but comfy with two full-size beds and lots of fluffy towels,very clean and well serviced. Don't be put off by the small lobby or the $25.00 charge for parking,space is at a premium in the Quarter. We took taxis from the airport and back and used the streetcar to get around,cheaper and more fun. The hotel is half a block from Bourbon St.,far enough that the nightime noise did not bother us but close to all the shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loyal customer who will not be back”
Reviews.Author: pensac0latraveler
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I have stayed at the Prince Conti several times and used to recommend the hotel to everyone. This will not be happening any more. It has been about two years since the last time we stayed there, and they have gone down hill since. The staff is now rude and the rooms have changed. Either that or we were given a less nice room because we paid the discounted rate for Papa Noel. This past weekend we stayed on a Sunday night. We arrived early in the afternoon (around 12:30) and were understanding that we could not check in. We were asked to come back at 2:00. We left, paid for parking elsewhere, and came back at 2:00. The person at the front desk told us our room had not been cleaned yet. We still understood, as it was not yet check in time. She called over her radio for our room to be cleaned. When asked how long it would take, she told us about an hour. Two and a half hours later we came back at 4:15, after check-in time, to find our room was still not ready. However, other people were checking in ahead of us. We were asked to wait. We finally were given our room at 4:30. Upon arriving to the room, the toilet was stopped up. We called for a plunger and left to go have dinner. Yet another two hours later we came back to a clogged toilet! My fiancÃ© walked down to the lobby and on his way someone was bringing a plunger. He just took it from her and told her he would do it himself. Throughout the stay, we were only given excuses by staff, â€œWe had a large wedding party stay and they would not get out of bed in time for check out,â€� â€œWe only have a few people working tonight,â€� among other things. The only staff member of the hotel who was straightforward and helpful was the valet. Otherwise, the 3-7 other staff we interacted with during our stay need some serious work on their customer service. Almost forgot to mention, our room was next to their parking and I was woken up twice from someone honking their horn below my window.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter at its best”
Reviews.Author: bookssunandsand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prince Conti for 2 days after a terrible vacation experience on Carnival Cruises. Both of us love New Orleans but arrived at the hotel more than a little grumpy and very early for check in. The front desk person was cheerful and very quickly found a room that was ready. We check right in at 10:30 in the morning! Bless her. The room was clean and well appointed, I would have appreciated a table and chair in the room but there really wasn't room. This is typical in New Orleans, rooms tend to be on the small side. We found a new (to us) place for breakfast on Royal St called Orleans Beignet, I think. It is next to the police station and has tables and chairs inside and in the courtyard in front of the police station where you can relax over coffee in the shade and commune with the police cats. The hotel has on site parking and restaurants, I wish we had tried them but there were too many places to go to and try. On Orleans St there is a wine bar with a player piano, try their selection of wine flights. One block over is Pat O'brien's, there are several different bars in PO's; one is a dueling piano bar. In the evenings this bar is so much fun. The hotel is a block off Bourbon, if the night life is your thing. Two blocks from the hotel is Royal St for shopping and great eating, Jackson Square and galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Glory days are over”
Reviews.Author: Frunobulax
Reviews.Content: It's not easy to find a reasonably priced hotel in or near the French quarter. Unfortunately the Prince Conti is not the answer to this problem, and we strongly suggest to stay away. We stayed there for two nights. To start with the good things: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located very close to the heart of Bourbon Street, but if you have a room facing north (as we did) you won't hear a thing. The room was spacious (as are most rooms in the USA). On the negative side: First of all the hotel looks as if it was good and prestigeous some years ago, but has taken a beating since. Most of the furniture was well worn, and there was some visible and unrepaired damage. As for our room, the ceiling of the bathroom showed a lot of mould. The beds were pretty soft and unfortunately just about 1,80m (6 ft) long, so even somebody at average height will sleep with his or her feet at lease partially hanging out of the bed. On the first day the linen appeared clean, but on the second day the new linen had holes and bloodstains (we later discovered holes in the blanket too). There were also holes in the curtain. As we arrived, the carpet was pretty wet and the whole room clammy and damp. This state persisted for both days we stayed there. (We were told later that the carpet had been shampooed, but apparently there was no plan to get it dry again.) As in many hotels, the windows couldn't be opened, so there was no way to get the humidity out (the AC didn't help at all). The "included" breakfast didn't help. Since it consisted only of croissants, jelly and some cake. Drinks were coffee, water and a juice that tasted as if it consisted only of sugar and artificial flavours. Everything else had to be ordered separately and of course to be paid for, too - and it took the kitchen a long time to prepare a crepe and some toast, even though just 3 or 4 tables were occupied. To sum it up, an adventurous backpacker might tolerate this in a Motel that costs 20 dollars a night, but to me this is totally unacceptable for a hotel in this class (where a night costs more than 100 dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kerrycavanagh
Reviews.Content: Very central location right in the centre of the French Quarter but was very quiet at night. The rooms were stunning, beautifully decorated, spacious and very comfortable. A continental breakfast was included which was delicous and served in a lovely room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: CrystalSorrows
Reviews.Content: It's hard to believe I stayed in the same hotel as many of the other reviewers on this board. I must've got the room that Kelly writes about, around October 2010. And believe me I was very freaked out once I read about the bed bugs! Anyway, back to my review...The room smelled dank and musty, probably due to the horrible condition of the carpet in the room, stains all over, I have no idea what the original color of the carpet was, but it was VERY VERY DIRTY. I know who cares about the carpet, but the problem was it gave the room an overall shabby & dirty appearance as well as stink! Bed was pretty bad too, very thin mattress with an indentation in the center. Bathroom is old fashioned, so there is very little space for your toiletries, just a shelf above the sink, but it was clean. Location is great, but that's about it, windows are double paned so most of the noise stays out (stink stays in). Perhaps there are rooms that were recently renovated, I certainly didn't get one, and would NEVER stay here again. And last but certainly not least, I did NOT find any bed bugs...but I was up most of the night worried about them.

Reviews.Title: “Beds Worth Bragging About and More”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLutz
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti hotel has the best beds, cleanest, softest sheets and most comfortable, nice-smelling pillows of any hotel I've ever stayed at. I know it sounds crazy to start out talking about the greatness of a hotel based on its beds and sheets, but if you've ever experienced bed bugs, ever woke up with a headache from over-stuffed pillows, or ever laid awake all night at a hotel because of the stiff, itchy sheets that smell stale, then you'll love Prince Conti. This hotel far exceeded my expectations! Aside from the bed, the room itself was pristine. This says a lot considering the hotel building is over 100 years old. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a King Suite upon arrival. The suite was enormous, equipped with a beautiful kitchen, a dining room table for 8, a living room, a large bedroom, a lovely bathroom with full vanity, and a European style patio that rivals anything in Architectural Digest. If you book, ask for room #103. You won't be disappointed. For the reasonable rate of this hotel and its convenient location to Bourbon Street, you'll jump for joy when you discover the many delights of this tiny gem. Again, cleanliness is the most important thing to me when I travel. And this hotel nailed it! Kudos to the maintenance staff and cleaning crew of this hotel. Outstanding job!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing doesn't even begin to cover it!”
Reviews.Author: diepretty
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Prince Conti after looking through every other hotel listing on Travelocity. The three things we were looking for were: 1. Walking distance to the French Quarter. 2. A smaller hotel with a New Orleans feel. 3. No corporate Marriott feel. The Prince Conti not only delivered but secured itself as the ONLY hotel we will ever stay in while visiting New Orleans. Beds were huge and comfortable. I could spit out my window and nearly hit Bourbon Street. The Continental Breakfast was the best we have ever had. The staff was courteous and friendly and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Brad, the manager, was there everyday to ask how our trip was going and recommend things to do. The staff supplied me with band aids for my blisters and made sure my post cards got mailed. The icing on the cake was that while we were staying at The Prince Conti we were actually the very last guests to use REAL METAL KEYS. I can't tell you how cool that was. While we were there they were switching over all the keys to swipe cards. The staff let us keep our metal key! The best souvenir we could have ever asked for. You want to have a great trip? You want to sleep like a baby? You want to feel like not just another room number? You want to be treated like you are a part of a family? Then you want to stay at The Prince Conti!! Call Brad and tell him Room 240 sent you!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's it”
Reviews.Author: cmcSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right near Bourbon Street, but the rooms are still quiet. That's on the positive. On the negative side, there are no real facilities at the hotel, eg no swimming pool which is an issue since New Orleans is generally hot. The staff at the front desk were friendly but didn't seem to be very knowledgeable, most of the questions I asked they weren't able to answer. The cost of the room includes a "continental breakfast" which means that they set out rolls, coffee and juice in the breakfast room which you can help yourself to. Alternatively, if you don't want the continental option, you can order a hot breakfast and receive a $7 credit toward the cost. I would STRONGLY recommend that you forget having breakfast at all in the hotel, the continental breakfast is pretty dismal and the order off the menu option an absolute nightmare. There are only 2 staff serving in the breakfast room and only 1 of these is able to take your order. Getting her attention to take your order or bring a glass of water involves a significant amount of arm waving and usually a wait of around 10-15 minutes.
