On the 1st day I thought maybe they were just short staffed but it was the same every day. I saw a number of tables give up and walk out before placing their order. I watched 1 table resort to wriiting down their order down and hand it to the waitress who is not allowed to take orders and ask her to give it to the other one (needless to say their breakfast never turned up). Once you finally get your order in expect a very very long wait for your food. Minimum wait for eggs on toast was at least 40 minutes and one day over an hour. I saw numerous people cancel their orders and leave after an extended wait. Also expect a very good chance that when the food finally turns up it won't be what you ordered. I got the wrong food at least half of the time and one morning out of a table of 8 women next to me, only 3 got the right food. In one case, after a wait of another 20 minutes to have her order replaced, they brought out the wrong food again. On the morning that I had to wait over an hour and then didn't get what I'd ordered, the manager did waive the bill. But given after taking into account the $7 credit the bill was only $3 or $4 in any event, this was a bit of a token. Housekeeping service was also failry lax. On at least 2 days I left the room at 10am in the morning leaving the please clean my room sign out and returned at 3.30pm to find it hadn't been cleaned. Both times I then asked to have the room cleaned straight away. On one of the ocassions after then being told it would be done immediately and ready in 20 minutes I left the hotel for another 45 minutes and came back to find they hadn''t started yet. The staff all seem to work hard, but the hotel appears to be dramatically understaffed. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and don't really understand why it seems to receive so many recommendations on here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great price!”
Reviews.Author: Jules_and_Jay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint and for the location and price it was well worth it. We were half a block away from Bourbon Street, but you couldn't hear any noise in our room. The room was nice and the bed was comfy. The hotel staff could have been a little more friendly, but they did their job. I was there on business and brought my husband along. If you need to get to the convention center it cost about $6.50, plus tip, for a taxi ride. I took the taxi in the morning and walked back to the hotel in the afternoon, it's only a 20 minute walk. Overall it was a great place to stay and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: bugsy96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prince Conti for 3 nights in October with another couple It was a charming hotel and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We had inadvertently booked a room with two double beds for my husband and I and the girl at the front desk did not hesitate to change us to a room with a king bed when we asked. It is located a block off Bourbon Street, so we found it to be very quiet, yet conveniently located. Our friends stayed in the main building, which appears more recently renovated. Our room was more traditionally decorated and was very charming. We would definitely stay there next time we travel to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mercy_Me42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to Voodoo Fest. Staff was exceptionally polite and helpful. I was consistently greeted by every staff member. The room (junior suite) was HUGE. A separate living room, foyer with mable floor, and separate bed room. The living room had a flat screen TV, microwave, fridge with ice, sink, and a couch with 2 arm chairs. The bedroom had it's own flat screen as well. The room was dark, as there were no windows that faced outside. Only 1 window which faced the hallway. This does result in no natural light, but that makes for some pretty deep sleep. Continental breakfast at Cafe Conti is included ($7) or you can order anything off the breakfast menu and receive a $7 discount. I opted for the Breakfast Biscuit ($10) which was very good. As a vegetarian, I asked that the bacon/ham be substituted with spinach or whatever vegetable was handy. The chef used fresh basil, tomato, mushrooms, baby spinach, green pepper and red onion. I was extremely impressed, as most places don't go through that kind of trouble. It should really be added to their regular breakfast menu. Location is excellent - in the heart of Bourbon Street. Nice German restaurant right across the street with an excellent menu for lunch or dinner. I hope I have the opportunity to stay there again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. stay away fron rooms near the coutyard/”
Reviews.Author: erRN4
Reviews.Content: We like this Hoel and the location. We stayed here thre night before a cruise. The staff was very helpful and getting a taxi to the ship was no problem. Cost &14.00 one way. The only compalint we have is the room we had was righrt above a courtyard and we were awaken several times during the night by loud voices and laughing until 2:30 in the Am. A different room would of made the experience above average.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: kelly125
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my mother and her great grandson and I was very disappointed with the room. It was outdated, the carpeting needs shampoo or a total renovation. I would not have them stay again. Very uncomfortable beds and pillows that need to be totally replaced. Additionally, there are bed bugs. The only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl1944
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with dÃ©cor true to the era one block from Bourbon St. Had a great time and a great stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: UgAbUgA11
Reviews.Content: Had an upgrade to a king suite. The room was huge, with full kitchen, 6 seat table, king bed w/ flat screen tv, a vanity with door that separated the shower and toilet, and a small private courtyard! Staff was friendly, breakfast was continental, and the location 1/2 block from Bourbon street. Easy in and out. The Bombay Club, with our appointed son Jefferey (not Jeff!), made the best martinis. The owner was very cordial. A very homey feel to the entire property. Hopefully will return next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RJames62
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the French Quarter that's close to Bourbon street without the Bourbon street noise at bed time than look no further because this is it. It was nice to enjoy the nightlife and be a short distance to the hotel The rooms are small but we were hardly their so the did the job for us.If I ever return to New Orleans this is were I'll stay unless I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: AlunDeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 11 other friends on a golf outing. Staff very professional and very attentive to our needs. Everything ran pretty smoothly with taxis to and from the courses. Ideal location just off Bourbon Street so not far away from all the action. All in all a very satisfactory stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Quaint and in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: nawlins95
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little hotel with charm. It is about 1 block from Bourbon St., and in a good area of the French Quarter. Our room was very large - a suite where there was a bed, TV and bathroom and the other part of the room (separated by the entrance and a door) was a pull out couch, wetbar and some other furniture. You could definitely fit 2 couples. It was room 102. The only negative is that it was in the interior of the hotel and there were no windows, so it was a little gloomy. Otherwise - a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bellivi5150
Reviews.Content: Steps from Bourbon Street but you hear no street noise from your hotel which is nice. Room was clean staff was VERY helpful and friendly. Would stay again but wish the beds were a little more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain”
Reviews.Author: CanalFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Prince Conti, having selected it after studying a number of TripAdvisor reviews quite carefully. First impressions, arriving on an airport shuttle, weren't good as our driver chose to approach via a couple of particularly tatty streets. In fact, if we hadn't paid in advance, my wife might well have insisted that we go somewhere else. However, once inside the rather cramped reception area we were dealt with in a friendly and courteous manner and given a good recommendation to a nearby restaurant as it was already well into the evening and we had been travelling most of the day. Our room, though fairly small, was clean and comfortable and everything worked. It was also commendably quiet given the hotel's proximity to the frenzy that is Bourbon. The only problems we experienced concerned service at breakfast which can best be described as erratic, with excessive delays all three mornings for different reasons each time. With that slight query I would recommend the Prince Conti to anyone seeking a budget hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ls123sm
Reviews.Content: super close to bourbon, clean.. like all the other reviews say you are not going to be in your room unless your sleeping. this room is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain.”
Reviews.Author: kurtzb
Reviews.Content: I got rooms for this hotel online for $49/night. I can't get a Motel 8 in Baltimore for $49/night so I can't make to many complaints. The rooms were clean but old. The hotel is old. But, it is truly a half block from Bourbon street and you cannot hear the noise. The Erin Rose bar across the street is a really fun little place and the staff at the Conti are more than willing to make recommendations. If you can get this price, take the chance. All you need in NOLA is a bed and a toilet. You shouldn't be spending too much time in your room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “The Manager, Brad [--], is the worse manager ever.”
Reviews.Author: lfeirman
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention. I am a native to the city, but currently live out of town. My company had several rooms booked for the WEFTEC convention. Due to an error in the booking, which I did not know about. By mistake, all rooms were checked out of by a colleague, however, I was to stay 1 more night. Since I didn 't know about the mistake. I was contacted by the manager and told that if I didn't remove all my things from my room they woudl be thrown out on the street. I was in meetings all day and could not get out to the hotel in his time frame. He had a police officer there waiting for me. not only was the situation explained to him, to no avail. He was rude abrasive, and I believe that this is illegal in Louisiana. I travel for a living. I stay in hotels all the time. this was the worse incident, I have ever seen. It would be rude to continue on to talk about the other things that were mishandled by the hotel during my stay, because that could happen at any hotel and my 3 day stay in now way indicates a consistent negative pattern.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel only steps from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: zoej19
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location with good size rooms. Very basic continental breakfast included, car parking $25 per day. Bombay Club (bar at hotel) serves great martinis.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled by the positive reviews here”
Reviews.Author: PeEshAheb1
Reviews.Content: My friend booked our rooms through priceline... last time i am going to use that plus still go stay at the hotel after reading all the reviews here... i figured it would be a positive hotel to stay at... was i wrong.... First of didn't even know where to pull in too to find the valet guys to get my car... while checking in to the hotel... i was given an old GOLD KEY not even a key card... which was so strange since i have never heard of a three star hotel with old fashion keys. By the way you have to use your key to enter from the front door as well, otherwise the frond desk clerk wont even look at you... Stepping into the room the pillows were really flat, my tv was an ancient box, the wireless was good but internet was not secure i got a pop up screen someone was trying to access my files... and i was able to see everyones computer that was connected at the hotel... this is what you get from a non franchised hotel... I would never stay here again... front desk were not friendly.. the guy checking us in opened up a book when someone had called and they had *^&( words written about guest in red that was easily able to be viewed... About the Valet they told me it was $25 but i found out they charge $3 tax on that... which i have never heard of as well... during check out i heard a guest and the manager talking about how the valet driver lost the guests key... and they will have to find a way to get him a new key... the customer was unhappy since he didnt know when they were going to get him a key and when he would be able to make his way back home.... very strange and unprofessional to lose a guest key for a valet service that they charge you $28 bucks a night for.... oh yeah they do not have a vent in the restroom so you have to keep the door open so your mirror doesnt get soo foggy and it gets uncomfortable to get ready after your shower... I heard people have sex in the middle of the night because the walls are so thin... guest checking in and out upstairs... I will never read and go by these people that were happy to find a cheap room and forget about the fact on how of a disgrace this hotel is to a three start... i would give it a one star... oh yeah the breakfast i was told by the front desk is coffee and rolls... which we didnt even bother to try... and ate outside of the hotel... forget this place

Reviews.Title: “Some good - Some bad!”
Reviews.Author: Baley
Reviews.Content: We were shown to our room which was very small and cramped with a tiny bathroom and the view from our window was two concrete walls. Asked if we could have another room since we were staying for three days and was informed that nothing else was available. I found this difficult to believe since there were very few guests in the hotel mid week.. The next morning I inquired if the hotel was sold out and was told NO they had rooms. It is a quaint old building which presents some challenges. We could not lock the deadbolt on our door. Could hear conversation from the room next door. Light fixtures were broken in the hallway. Lamp shade with burned hole on the desk lamp. Definitely needs some attention. Some of the staff could be friendlier and more welcoming to the guests. You are not allowed to use the computer in the lobby unless it is to print boarding pass. Of course there is the $25/ day parking fee that is added and you do not have access to your car. On the plus side is the location. Even though only half a block off Bourbon St. we did not hear the outside world. Breakfast bar is nothing fancy but adequate (coffee, juice and pastry)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: alleneinstein
Reviews.Content: this hotel had very simple but clean rooms. the staff was friendly, but we really didnt need much. the decor was quaint but stylish. the location is perfect. the rates for being right off bourbon street were very reasonable. i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: meardynit
Reviews.Content: Absolutely enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is an older hotel half a block from Bourbon Street. Our room (#100) was very spacious and the bathroom was enormous. The room had a very French gothic feel to it - which we loved but may not be everyone's cup of tea. The front desk staff was very friendly. My only complaint is in our ground floor room we could not lock the deadbolt from the outside (but we did not have a problem with security). Connected to wifi without any problem. Great value. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: stuart390
Reviews.Content: The rooms are Ok with the exception of air conditioning which we could not adjust.. Parking is 4 blocks away so once you turn your vehicle over to the attendants you can not get anything out of it.. Once I got my vehicle back I noticed that the console had been ransacked and the change I had in it was gone. It wasn't a large amount of money at all, it was the point that it was taken...

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel to stay at in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wendyc12
Reviews.Content: We had an awsome stay at this hotel. The room was a suite with a full kitchen , dining table and 6 chairs, couch and two plasma tv's at a very reasonable price. The room was very clean The staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is located a half a block away from Bourbon St. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More like a lesser royal than a Prince!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mpls_MNWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Well, we got it on the cheap, which was the only positive. We had to change rooms due to the noise of being by the vending machines...beware. The rooms on the top floor are quiet but less spacious. Bathroom was pretty basic. Low water pressure. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again. The beds are old and there is a shabby air about the place. The location is great if you are into the Quarter. We really like the bar, and it has great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean. Undeserving and unclean.”
Reviews.Author: Cpeterkelly
Reviews.Content: The price was right. We paid in advance, the discount was welcome. But it didn't make up for some of the shortcomings, many of which were not related to the age of the building, difficulties of running a business in the Quarter, or 'post Katrina'. One minimum expectation of a hotel, I should think, is that the sheets should fit the bed. So unless you are under 5 feet, you can expect to notice that the sheets don't fit the beds. This was the first time I've stayed in a 'short sheet' establishment: a hotel that doesn't use fitted sheets, but takes a top sheet and places it sideways on the mattress - thus leaving the bottom foot of the mattress pad uncovered. Weird. Kind of annoying. The wifi didn't work. You could pick up a signal, or not. It was slow, or nonexistant. The computer downstairs was not for guest use other than to print boarding passes. We drove, access to a google map would have been helpful. I should have expected the drunks in the hall, it is the French Quarter after all. But likewise, when I appeared in the hallway in my boxers at 3:00 a.m.(after 45 minutes of their unsuccessful banging on a friends door), I feel they should have been expecting the disgruntled fellow guest. "Arguing, like sex and dismemberment," I remember advising them, "are better performed inside ones hotel room than outside." They pretty much shut up after that... Stranger was the dust. By arrival it had been hours since anyone was in the room, and even simple movements raised clouds of dust particles. When you lay down on the bed, a veritable 'cloud' of fine dust particles would drift around the room. At first I wrote it off to the sun streaming in west facing windows, but later that night I noticed my breathing was affected and decided to look inside the ceiling A/C. On opening the grill, I was amazed at the condition of the filter, which clearly hadn't been changed in a long, long, LONG time. It had a serious accumulation of dust, which explained the asthma like issues and the visible particles. My son took the filter down to the lobby and asked for a replacement, management said "to thank me for changing it," and sent him back with a filter that didn't fit. All in all, not a satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Starr1229
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy the French Quarter to the fullest try the Prince Conti....located right on Conti Street in the middle of it all...walk anywhere you want...we walked to Jackson Square, visited the Cabildo, The Cathedral, and Louisiana Museum...very enjoyable. Riding the street car is one of our favorite things always stopping at quaint restaurants in that area...Reliving childhood... I always love to ride the Algiers Ferry...just for fun and it's free... Staff was extra friendly and helpful...we felt our car was safe and secure the entire time..Please try Prince Conti the next time you are in New Orleans....

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR A BACHELOR PARTY”
Reviews.Author: grandemack
Reviews.Content: Came to NOLA from the west coast for a bachelor party and stayed at the Conti, PERFECT! Steps from everything Bourbon street has to offer, bars, restaurants, and other shenanigans. Didn't drive a car for four days because everything is within walking distance! Lots of help from the front desk with suggestions and booking excursions. Rooms and lobby a little on the small side but your not hanging out in your rooms in NOLA. A 24 hour coffee shop/bar across the street hit the spot after a night of drinking!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel5
Reviews.Content: Prince conti hotel has it all: very reasonable price, prime location, big rooms, very nice staff, quietness, simple free breakfast. Does not have a pool but is also super cheap. 1 minute away from Bourbon Street. Definitely a more than great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “100%!”
Reviews.Author: lgfromks
Reviews.Content: Great location! 1/2 block from Bourbon St and perfect for walking around the french quarter. Friendly staff, clean and quiet room......just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Navybran
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti offered a GREAT rate with a fantastic room for the price located less than one block from Bourbon Street in the French Quarter. It's an older property with a LOT of character, not a new "box" hotel. Free continental breakfast, friendly staff and more than reasonable rate. We paid less than $90 a night for a large two room suite with fireplace, two flat screen tv's, large bath with bidet. Check the photos and if you're up for an older hotel with a LOT of character this may be your best choice. Ed Brandon, Mississippi

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Mrdbake
Reviews.Content: The hotel has European Old World charm with new world comforts. It is in the perfect location to experience Bourbon Street and the rest of the French Quarter. Half a block away from the 24 hour party that is Bourbon Street but far enough away that you can get some sleep when you need to. Late 30s couple. Me, overweight. We walked the entire French Quarter from the Prince Conti. Remember, these are old buildings so the walls are a little thin. Don't go expecting the Hilton. The Prince Conti is very clean and the staff friendly and enjoyable. If you have any questions about restaurants, bars or local attractions see Cobey(Bellman, Valet). He will not steer you wrong. He will tell you what you need to know with that Louisiana southern draw and charm New Orleans is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, value, and service!”
Reviews.Author: kellyfillingim
Reviews.Content: recently a friend from england and i stayed at the prince conti hotel for 2 nights and were VERY pleased. not only was the hotel extremely affordable, it met all of my expectations to show an out of towner a great time. the view from the balcony was very nice and he hotel staff was more than friendly and accomodating. other than the great price, the next best thing about staying here was the location! we didn't have to take a cab or a car to get to any of the places we wanted to go whether it be food, shopping, or nightlife. another great perk was the bombay club, a martini bar in the hotel. great atmosphere and wonderful bartender! theres nothing better than having a chopin and mint martini with a sugar rim and sitting in the the quaint courtyard listening to the serene sound of the fountain. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, clean room with a great location, wonderful staff, and a great martini bar to get your evening started! will go back everytime i go to new orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Overall this was a nice hotel for the...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel for the price. The location was perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My complaint is the cleanliness of the pillows and mattresses. On the day we checked out one of the pillowcases pulled off the pillow and was disgusting. The pillows were yellow with stains all over them. I understand that you can't continually replace pillows, but put a protector on it or at least wash it once in a while. Old and dated I can handle but not dirty and unclean.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Great place - close to everything! Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie39773
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at this hotel twice - once in Sept 2009 with 5 other women for a bachelorette party. It was so good that when I planned a last minute trip for a friend's birthday we booked it here too! (July 2010) The staff are very helpful and friendly! It is literally steps away from the action - but you get a nice quiet rest when you are inside the hotel. Clean rooms and good value! We will stay here again!!! Even though parking is kind of pricey (however it is ANYWHERE in NOLA) you do not have to worry about your car - they Valet it for you when you arrive and bring it back when its time to go! I also like that you must have your key to enter the main doors after dark - makes you feel safe!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: loislaneNy/nj
Reviews.Content: the price couldnt be beat, great service at front desk, everywhere except bar in Bombay Club, I'll do a separate review. Beautiful room, can't beat central location, we booked 2 nights and last minute did a 3rd night called 10p at night man at front desk was so helpful, would most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I decided to spend the twenty minutes I...”
Reviews.Author: PearceE
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend the twenty minutes I am waiting for my car to come back from valet to write a review. This hotel is awful. It's looks are very deceiving. The service is slow, their breakfast is less then appetizing and the walls are paper thin. If your lucky your neighbors will be quite when they come strolling in at 3:00 am and you won't have to be woken up by their awful singing. Which the hotel will do nothing about. Take my advice spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "free breakfast" we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: DeJaBee
Reviews.Content: The "free breakfast" consisted of large, doughy lumps which bore no resemblance to croissants, some muffins which we didn't try (but the occasional fly did, as they weren't covered up) and some so-so Danish, plus a bowl of apples hidden in a corner (but no knife to peel them) with a couple of half-dead oranges lurking underneath. Very disappointing. We requested an inside room so that it would be quiet, and it was -- no outside noise at all. However, we were disturbed by other guests returning at 4:00 am shouting and laughing. Perhaps understandable in New Orleans. Our king-size bed was very comfortable, the room not at all cramped and the bathroom small but adequate. We got great value as it was off-season rates, so probably shouldn't complain about the breakfast, and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: EnderEd
Reviews.Content: Nothing luxurious, no views to speak of, the rooms are small and spartan. But the hotel is clean, desk and housekeeping are tops, bathrooms are very good, free wi-fi, and the 1/2 block from Bourbon St. location can not be beat. I will stay here again on my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: brian1403
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 days at the Prince Conti Hotel. It was a wonderful stay. We were most impressed with our room. We booked room 101, a King Bed Junior Suite. The room was quite large with a flat screen tv in the living room along with a microwave, mini fridge, and bar area with sink. The back wall in the living room was a brick wall, which gave the room a more historic feeling. The bedroom also had a flat screen tv. The bathroom, which I was worried about after reading other reviews, was clean and well sized. Best of all, the junior suite was cheaper than a non-suite room at almost any other hotel in the French Quarter. The service was great, the ladies at the front desk were always happy and helpful, and the valets were always quick and courteous, as well as helpful with giving weather forecasts. The location was also great. It is in the west side of the French Quarter, so you can easily walk to everything in the French Quarter, and most places in the CBD with little trouble. The hotel is not even a full block off of Bourbon Street, but we never heard any noise. It was always quiet and cool after a long day walking around in the heat. We will definitely head back to it for our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti has a warm and welcome atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Davidpharrell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to New Orleans for our first anniversary. The Prince Conti, for the price, was exactly what we had expected. The service was excellent. Upon our arrival, the desk clerk offered us discount coupons for a wonderful restaurant right down the street from the hotel. Check-in was quick and simple. The room was small but clean and quaint. Although it was very close to Bourbon Street, it was quite a hike to Jackson Square and the French Market. In close to 100 degree weather, it made for a sweaty walk. If you are looking for an opportunity to explore more than just Bourbon, I would recommend finding a hotel closer to Jackson Square and the French Market. The continental breakfast was marginal at best. Pastries and juice was all that was offered but for the price, it was fine. All in all, the hotel and staff were wonderful and it truly was a wonderful getaway for our first wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: WoodFamily84
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance from everywhere in the French Quarter. The hotel is half a block away from Bourbon Street so there was street noise during the late night hours.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic”
Reviews.Author: BrightonMan_8
Reviews.Content: 1/2 block off on Bourbon st it was a prime location. We had a street room which make it interesting to watch the people but it was loud all night up until about 630am. The room was small but well decorated. The staff was real nice and very knowledgeable about the things to do and places to go. I would recommended getting an inside room if you plan on going to sleep before 6am. New Orleans was a very fun and interesting place to visit you just need to make sure as in any big city that you stay on the beating path. The river walk was nice though it was about the same as most river walks. Over all I would say we had a good time even though I no longer drink. It is a drinkers paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: cairotciv
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a room at the Prince Conti Hotel for a short get away. The rate was great compared to most in the area. We had an early morning flight into New Orleans and as check in was not until afternoon we stored our luggage at the hotel and ventured out. About 2hrs later my cell phone rang, Ms. Ava from the hotel called to tell me our room was ready. I've never had a hotel do that before. As we were dropped off at the airport to begin our trip, my sister left her purse in the vehicle (yes, ID and all!) long story short she had to have it overnighted to the hotel. Ms. Ava called my cell phone again when it arrived. If you look up customer service in the dictionary, I bet you"ll find a picture of Ms. Ava there! She was always smiling & made you feel so welcome. I hope someone with the authority to recognize her for her service reads this. The room was very spacious, LOVED the ceiling fan, it was awesome to come back to that after the heat. If I HAD list list something I liked the least I would have to say it was being able to hear the other guests on either side of our room. However, it will not keep me from staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect location, quiet room, and an amazing martini bar!!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthTXN
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel feel, very attentive, friendly, and proactive staff. Not a lot of amenities but then again the real destination is only about 50 yards away - Bourbon street and the rest of the French Quarter. What really surprised me is how you could be on bourbon street, with thousands of people and nightclubs blaring unbelievably loud music, then step into a quiet, cool, and clean hotel room so close to the hustle and bustle. Many hotels are "in the french quarter" but this one is really right in the middle of bourbon street, so all you have to do is pick right or left and walk no more than a few blocks. We popped into the Bombay club martini bar and were delighted with the ambiance, the live music (this was a Friday night), and the incredible drink selection. This is a really romantic place to get a spectacular martini. We didn't have dinner but the dining area had a 5 star feel to it. Very strong WiFi in the room and lobby, no connection issues on my laptop. Sure, you could pay $50 more a night for more "chain" hotel amenities and a pool, but for a vastly inferior location. I'll stay here many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location and unbelievable service makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: evanleefrayer
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Nawlins for the better part of 25 years, and this hotel is in my top 5. If you are looking for old world charm and solitude, Prince Conti is not for you...But, if you want to be in the heart of all the action it is a no brainer. the cons are easily overlooked for me: yeah, the h20 pressure and temp aren't that great in the am, and the continental breakfast is a little skimpy...And the elevator is kinda smallish. That would be my only complaint. the pros : location, and...the staff. Believe me when I tell you they WILL do anything to make your stay better. One of my party got terribly food poisoned on some oysters, and was laid up the entire weekend. The guy parking cars, (I think his name was Nate?) saw my buddy's discomfort and found some peptobismol, and offered to find him more help if his condition got worse. Cmon, usually the valet is not going to do that for you in most places....The front desk lady was really helpful as well: helped us get sunday jazz brunch reservations on short notice, and had great reccomendations on what to see and do. I think her name was Cynthia or Cindy? She is a saint. If this was not too close to Bourbon street, I would have brought my kids as she would dote over them for sure. It's like staying with family. Yeah, it's not the Ritz, but I bet they dont have the staff like PC Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with great price and even better location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler2244
Reviews.Content: Extremely reasonable rates for travelers looking to stay in the french quarter but not be ripped off. I couldn't believe that I was one block off of Bourbon and could not hear a single thing at nights! Seriously, I slept with no disturbances every night. Stay here for the value but not for the hotel itself. It is average quality from the accommodations to the front desk agents and they honestly just should not serve "breakfast" at all. A choice between a danish and a muffin is not breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - no amenities”
Reviews.Author: bobfan
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel was a great value for the price and location. Well kept and basic clean rooms with no amenities other than free continental breakfast - improvement needed with breakfast items - mostly sweet pastries. Suggested to management about breakfast selection. Otherwise you can't go wrong with this hotel - stone's throw from Bourbon St and other French Quarter activities. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & romantic.. great value”
Reviews.Author: Christina_PA
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is a great place for a weekend getaway. It may not be overflowing with amenities, but it gives a cozy and traditional French Quarter feel. It's well located only a block from Bourbon, and within easy walking distance of so many great restuarants. Check out Jagerhouse for breakfast and/or coffee, and Broussards for a romantic dinner or dessert in the courtyard. Both are just across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Prince Conti was an ideal place to spend the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Stanjg
Reviews.Content: We combined a birthday celebration with a trip to a wedding. The hotel was immaculate and the room was spacious and decorated nicely. The Prince Conti is conviently located in the French Quarter just off Bourbon St, And three blocks from Canal St.. The Bombay Club Restaurant is located in the hotel and has an excellent menu. The service in the hotel and the restaurant was excellent. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Value With Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 619BigAl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff Very Helpful and Courteous, Steps From Bourbon Street. Nice Quiet Clean Rooms. Arnold & Anna, San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Quiet Hotel just off Borbon St.”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just half a block off noisy wild crowded Boubon St. and the noise seemed to be turned off by the time you arrived at the hotel! Valet Parking is $25.00 per vehicle and is secured in an inner courtyard so you feel fairly good about leaving your vehicle there. Our room was very small, but we did not plan to be spending any amount of time there other than to sleep. There was no frig or micro. Although few used the free breakfast food in the small breakfast room (which is tastefully decorated), the food offered; croissants, custard & berry topped rolls, large muffins, apples & oranges, milk, orange juice and coffee was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rickmcquillan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels across the country, but the Prince Conti was my favorite. We loved our cozy little room, the service was good, and Bourbon Street was only a 1/2 block away. The staff was helpful and friendly, and we would especially like to thank VANN and CINDY for their help. We are planning another trip to New Orleans in the fall and we will definitely return to the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay! Can't beat the quality for the price!”
Reviews.Author: KiraB148
Reviews.Content: First, the staff was more than accommodating, they were helpful and courteous! The lobby and breakfast area were very nice! The room was clean, very adequate for staying in. (Not a 4 star room, but it did the job, and girls...the bathroom was clean/nice) The hotel is in a great part of the french quarter, feet away from bourbon street, and walking distance from everything else. You can hear some music, but not enough to keep you up at nights. My boyfriend and I absolutely loved the place and would recommend it to anyone traveling on a budget but still wanting to experience the culture of the french quarter!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, historic hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PersicaPit
Reviews.Content: The historic Prince Conti Hotel, located just off Bourbon Street in the heart of the French Quarter, turned out to be one of the loveliest hotels I've had the pleasure of staying in. It had atmosphere, charm, and a perfect location - and it didn't cost us a fortune, either. My mother and I were scheduled to be in New Orleans for a business conference held at the Marriott on Canal Street, but we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a hotel room we could probably find in any city. We wanted a taste of the city, something more intimate, something with personality. When we found the Prince Conti Hotel, it seemed like a perfect fit - and it was. The rooms were very well-priced, and its location was perfect - just a couple of blocks from the site of our conference, and an ideal launch point for walking through the Vieux Carre. Our room was more than adequate - it was comfortable and welcoming after a long day of sightseeing, a little like coming home. The water pressure in the shower was actually surprisingly good, considering the age of the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful; when we arrived at the Prince Conti at 11:00 PM on a Tuesday night, hungry and weary after a thirteen-hour drive, they eagerly recommended a restaurant just a block down the street and gave us coupons for a 10% discount. The restuarant, Oceana, turned out to be so good that we ate there twice. As I mentioned above, the location of the hotel is fantastic. We had no problems walking anywhere we wanted in the city. Jackson Square and Cafe du Monde were only ten minutes of walking away, and the beautiful St. Louis #1 Cemetery was only three small blocks straight down the street. And, of course, the hotel is just off of Bourbon Street - a perfect locale for anyone who wants to go out and party without getting lost on their way back to their hotel room. And yes, the close proximity to the boisterous Bourbon Street did mean that we heard some street noise. At about 4:30 AM during our first night at the hotel, we were woken by a furious argument between two girls on the street below us - yet somehow, it just made us howl with laughter rather than simmer with fury. It was part of the atmosphere, part of the spirit of New Orleans, and I wouldn't trade those whoops and hollers from the balconies lining Bourbon for any silent, frigid chain hotel in the world. Still, I leave a warning for those travelers who just can't abide the "disruptions" - yes, Bourbon is rowdy, and while most of that noise stays in the street, you'll still hear whistles and the thump of a bass. While we ended up loving the mayhem, your mileage may vary. For those of us who can't leave home without our laptops, the Prince Conti had excellent wireless internet service, which was complementary and easy to access. There were no hoops to jump through or passwords to enter; instead, the Conti's internet was unlocked and had multiple access points via routers fixed to the ceilings on each floor. Very easy to use, and very convenient. I also want to mention that for fellow smokers, the Prince Conti Hotel had an excellent designated smoking area. The hotel itself is located off a little enclosed alleyway, where there were ashtrays and a bench just across from the lobby (and in clear sight of hotel staff) for those of us with the bad nicotine habit. It was safe, secluded, and sheltered from the elements. Perfection. New Orleans is a magical city. It has a spirit and character that is utterly unique unto itself, that cannot be found in any other place in America. When I first traveled to New Orleans eight years ago, I fell in love with it instantly. It reminded me strongly of my own beloved hometown of Charleston, with its historic architecture and muggy climate, but while Charleston is a marsh heron, elegant and demure, New Orleans is a peacock, unfurling its brightly-colored feathers with a mischievous wink. I love New Orleans with all my heart and soul, and I cannot wait to come back. And when I do come back, I know exactly where to rest my head after a long day marching down the old, narrow streets: I'm coming back to the Prince Conti Hotel, a surprising shot of tranquility in the middle of a wild, wonderful landscape.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suite size, bad luck with old beds”
Reviews.Author: LeisureGator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Jazzfest 2010 and loved the location, as well as the space of the suite we reserved. The housekeeping services were very professional and the rooms were kept very clean during our stay. However, one major drawback was the age of the mattresses. You could feel the springs on the surface of each bed, which was definitely not something we wanted to deal with after being on our feet all day and most of the night. I didn't complain (which I should have) but when you reserve a room, be sure to ask for a room with newer mattresses. Your back will thank you later.

Reviews.Title: “Small Intimate!”
Reviews.Author: Tarusbull
Reviews.Content: very good location, clean & fair price! the valet was disappointed when I didn't give tip? the reason, the hotel got 25.00 + 3.00 tax per night for parking = 56.00..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: CPatriarca
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NOLA for our daughter's graduation and spent 3 nights at the Prince Conti. We booked a Jr. Suite. The room was at the end of a hallway and it was very quiet. The room was well appointed and an outstanding value. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Price, Overall Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: ebaier85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Prince Conti for three nights in May and really enjoyed our stay. Even though it is a block down from the craziness of Bourbon Street, it was a really quiet and relaxing place to stay. The staff was super nice and the room was really great. I had read reviews that mentioned the smallness of the bathrooms and while ours was kinda small it wasn't anything to keep us from returning to Prince Conti the next time we go to NOLA. Not only was it a great place to put our heads down at the end of our busy and crazy nights, the price made it even greater! We'll definitely being visiting Prince Conti again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need a place to crash after Burboun”
Reviews.Author: TES1442
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel room at the last minute-- just one night-- as a place to crash after a night on the town. The room was decent, bare necessities, clean enough. The staff wasn't too helpful or overly accomidating-- we asked to keep our car parked for 30 minutes past check out time and they refused. The location is great-- I supposed I'd stay here again-- but it's not my #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem”
Reviews.Author: krissa02
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I traveled here for a weekend getaway. Getting to the resort was easy. It is located very close to all there is to do in New Orleans: Burbon Street, French Quarter, CafÃ© Du Mond, Harraâ€™s. You can step outside the front door of the lobby and within seconds you are right where the action is. We always felt safe walking to and from the hotel late at night. The room was very small but ok for just the 2 of us. Our view was of the back of the building and the parking lot, not much to look at. The front desk was very helpful when we asked for directions to the theater and restaurant recommendations. If you are looking for a decently priced hotel right close to all of what New Orleans has to offer this hotel is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for Jazzfest... but don't ask front desk for help!”
Reviews.Author: 4summertravelers
Reviews.Content: The owner/operator really needs to read these reviews. We loved the room and the location... but the front desk needs serious training on how to accommodate and welcome the guest. My wife and I got to the point where we weren't asking questions because they made us feel like we were putting them out. When we did get them to help it was minimal..for example- no personal suggestions for second or third choice for dinner(not even their own Bombay Club..... hmm). Rm #248 good wife says- bathroom and toiletries aren't up to snuff for a higher end hotel...more like motel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: fluffyjack
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti hotel far exceeded our expectations. When we go on a trip, our hotel just serves two purposes: a bed and a place to shower, and that's pretty much it. This place was great! The front desk was friendly, the room was clean and cool, and the bathroom was not at all tiny. I was worried we'd get a little closet for a bathroom but this was spacious enough for two. We booked a king room and ended up on the bottom floor across the parking lot. It was so quiet and the bed was so comfortable. My fiancee and I slept like babies (this might be due to all the Hand Grenades too). Close walk to Bourbon Street, but far from the noise. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms Very Small”
Reviews.Author: megcait
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to one of our favorite cities to escape the cold Northeast....Other than taking the cold with us, we loved our trip. Stayed for the first time at the Prince Conti. The location is within walking distance of so much...right off Bourbon Street, yet amazingly quiet. Staff was very friendly, rooms were kept very clean....steps away from the Bombay Bar: great food, old-world atmosphere. The only drawback was the room size and amenities. There was no place to put anything. No tables (except for small desk), no room to move around, small bathroom with no counter space or shelving below for toiletries, etc. We stayed over a week and felt like we were constantly tripping over each other. Will be returning in 2 years and 4 years to take part in a Mardi Gras parade and will look elsewhere because we just need more room. I literally lived out of my suitcase for over a week.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dk7205
Reviews.Content: Our three-night stay was very pleasant. The "curb appeal" of the hotel entrance was just what we were looking for to set the tone for a stay in the French Quarter. Everything was impeccably clean, a plus for an older property. The location is an absolute bonus and the included Continental Breakfast adds to the value. We have since recommended this hotel to friends who are making plans to visit New Orleans later this year.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RocketIllinois
Reviews.Content: We discovered The Prince Conti Hotel "by accident" several years ago through an opaque booking site. We have been staying there ever since for our semi-annual trips to New Orleans. It is a boutique-type hotel. First, the location is ideal for the French Quarter. It is near the center of the French Quarter, one block off Bourbon Street, and staggering distance to/from all the fun places. The staff is pleasant and helpful; they remember us from previous visits. Yes, the room and the bathroom are a little small, but they are clean, comfortable, and nicely appointed. And, the housekeeping staff is friendly and considerate. The rates are very reasonable (low), especially considering the location and the atmosphere of the place. If you need pampering with room service, a spa, and a pool, this is not the place. But, if you want a charming room with French Quarter feel and support from friendly staff, this place is for you!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: littlesondra
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans for the first time last month, and found the Prince Conti online. I went with your previous reviews for this quaint hotel, and I'm glad I did! The location is perfect for seeing the Quarter, and the staff is so attentive! The rooms are super clean, and well stocked each day. The continental breakfast is really good, and they don't run out of great muffins, croissants, and danish! I would recommend the Conti for anyone, young or old. It is a wonderful place to stay to see New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great room/price/location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaDragonrider
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very nice, the price was great, the location couldn't be beat. The staff was helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was generous, replenished, and served for a wide span of time, not necessarily the norm in the French Quarter, at least in my experience. We were prepared for noise from Bourbon St because of the location, but that was not the problem. We were kept awake by noise from other rooms--we could clearly hear people in the next-door rooms, and a small shrieking child from several rooms away--and the hallway, which was kind of surprising. It won't put me off staying here, but I'll certainly take earplugs the next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: LuckyPuddin
Reviews.Content: Great location in the French Quarter. Staff has been great and we have more than enjoyed our stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mwhite991
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was just wonderful to us. We met Amy first at the front desk and she went out of her way to make our stay in New Orleans a memorable experience. Our room was wonderful. It was not a brand new room but had the charm you would expect in the french quarter. The continental breakfast was adequate. Amy helped us with dinner resevations as well as coupons and tour reviews. A big thank you again to the Prince Conti!!!

Reviews.Title: “I am very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Joandio
Reviews.Content: OK - it's only $69/night for weeknights. It's not the Waldorf Astoria but it is clean, comfortable, and in a good spot. The beds are very comfortable, but from my room (255) I get the sounds of the blues club at the end of the block. Hey, its New Orleans, I've walked all day long, and that sound is almost a lullaby. Oh, and free wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with history and friendly staff that was clean and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Fyre
Reviews.Content: I liked the Prince Conti! No, it wasn't a luxury hotel with all the 'perks', but all the staff I encountered were friendly, kind and welcoming! the double bed room was quite pleasant, and had a window that looked down over a street. It wasn't tiny, but well appointed, had a desk and chair, a lovely armchair, and a double bed. There was also a coffee-maker and a lovely hair dryer as well as a heat lamp in the bathroom. Now if you're looking for super luxury, or a pool, the Prince isn't for you. If you want a cookie cutter hotel with a large lobby, big screen tv in room, it's not for you. However, if you want a great hotel location close to everything, this is a nice hotel. I found it a very comfortable and pleasant place for my stay, and the perks are it's around the corner from Bourbon Street, has a small continental breakfast that consists of juice, coffee, muffins or croissants, milk. Across the street a small restaurant with moderate prices features german food, and up the street there is a grocery store that delivers with a pretty good menu-I had the roast beef po boy with gravy and it was tasty. If I went in the summer, I would probably stay somewhere with a pool, but otherwise I'd stay here again, the prices were good and the hotel is most pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: YellaGray
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/28/10 - 3/4/10. Convenient to all of the French Quarter by walking - no need to drive each day - the exercise is great. Located one block from Bourbon Street, but there was no noise in the rooms. Daily parking rates are kind of high; however, the speedy and friendly valets made up for it. Rooms are quaint, clean, and cozy. Loved the real historic French Quarter feel. Our room had a skylight that was a nice surprise to have in a hotel room and an alternative to a window. Everyone was friendly from the front desk to the valets to the housekeeping staff and offered us suggestions on places to eat and provided directions to get there. And there was free wireless internet! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, unwelcoming and misleading”
Reviews.Author: ALP333
Reviews.Content: After reading excellent reviews of the hotel my friend and I arrived at the Prince Conti to be greeted by a cordial receptionist but disinterested hotel compere. The first room we were offered was dark and damp and had obviously not been cleaned as there was matted hair in the built-in hairdryer and the room entrance light did not work. For a hotel which prides itself on service I was unclear as to how basic gentleman manners and courtesy could be so overlooked; after requesting a room change we were shown a dark double room which was outside and noisy. We agreed to this as the best of a bad lot and were then expected to lug our suitcases up three flights of steep stairs as the compere was smoothtalking a recent arrival in an expensive-looking car. We arrived in our new room to find more hair under the sink and a flip flop left under the chair in the room from the previous occupant - hardly an advertisement for any hotel claiming to be of any star award. The receptionist appeared very helpful in the absence of her manager and provided us with a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine as an apology however the damage had been done and we spent our first evening in New Orleans trying to find a clean hotel that could take us the day before Thanksgiving. Most disappointing was that when we explained the situation again we were informed by the receptionist that we would have no charge for our room. They promised to contact Expedia and refund the several hundred pounds we had paid in advance. On our return to England the refund had not been made. I had to request this myself from Expedia and was subsequently told that we were being charged for the first night. When I contacted the hotel to request an answer on this point I was continuously put through to the voicemail of the manager who never returned my calls. Suffice to say, I would not recommend this hotel and would strongly advise against any dealings with them.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed there before, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: IdrivealotMaine
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Prince Conti in New Orleans. Each time is either as good as or better than the last. They take the time to remember past guests and make you feel welcome. It is an older hotel, but when in the vieux carre, this adds to the fun. There is a breakfast included which consists of pastries, muffins, croissants, fruit, coffee and orange juice. The housekeeping staff is very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: kelly32578
Reviews.Content: Our group arrived on a Saturday for a 4 night stay. There were 10 in our group staying in 7 rooms. You really can't beat the price and location. The lobby was just the right size for us to gather in every morning before heading out for the days events and the staff welcomed our fun, energetic group each morning. Prince Conti Hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter, adjacent to Bourbon street. When arriving at the hotel, be mindful that Bourbon Street is cordoned off in the evenings, which can make it difficult to approach for the first time considering that there are numerous one way streets that prevent easy navigation around the closed off Bourbon street. We drove around in circles for far too long, because we didn't know this in advance. The staff was exceedingly courteous and helpful, especially Cindy. She and the valet were happy to assist us with restaurant and activities suggestions. The rooms were clean with fresh, updated bathrooms. There were plenty of clean towels and toiletries. While we were there, other guests were courteous and respectful of others' sleep schedules. I hope the others thought that of us, too. :0) I look forward to returning to New Orleans and will surely stay at Prince Conti Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient”
Reviews.Author: FelixD
Reviews.Content: One block from Bourbon St. But no noise inside rooms. Perfect to visit the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: BabsTwainHarte_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are seniors and visited New Orleans for the first time January 4 through 8. The Prince Conti was a wonderful surprise given the rate we paid. Our room was large, clean, quiet and comfortable. The location was superb allowing us to walk almost everywhere. The service and information we received from Amy at the front desk and Eric at the valet desk was exceptional and funny. We would definetly stay at the Prince Conti again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Just as Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ann111
Reviews.Content: Our wedding event wouldn't have been the same without our guests staying at this quaint hotel and getting that real New Orleans flavor. We did not want the regular cookie cutter variety hotel and wanted to be close to the entertainment venues of the French Quarter. We had many rooms rented for our guests, over severial days, and all were clean and comfortable. During our stay, we had extremely cold weather and a couple of the rooms had heating problems that were resolved instantly when we requested service. The breakfast could certainly be improved with more variety, though. I found Cindy, at the front desk, most helpful and businesslike during the chaotic confusion of our wedding preperation. She never failed to provide any needed attention but she would come off friendlier if she just smiled more.

Reviews.Title: “The Front Desk Staff couldn't be bothered with us.”
Reviews.Author: SDL5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely disappointed with all the dealings we had at the Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans. Any contact we had with the front desk was unfriendly and uncordial. At one point, upon our checkout, the front desk employee by the name of Cindy, made it quite obvious she was completely disinterested in our stay, our experiences, or our checkout. The valet parking person did not even offer to place our luggage in the trunk of our car, and we had paid for valet services for the entire length of our stay. The continental breakfast was inedible with the only offerings being cheap danishes and poorly made coffee from styrofoam cups. They did not even offer any fruit. The only part of the staff that made any attempt to be helpful was the cleaning staff. They tried to help as much as they could. However, our room was old with outdated furniture and decorations. But, the room was clean. The most disappointing part of our stay was the rudeness and lack of appreciation by the front desk staff, valet parking staff, and management of the hotel. By, the way, we never made any complaints to anyone while we were there, and this is how we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: nic87
Reviews.Content: The staff was only mildly friendly, and completely disinterested in fulfilling any of our requests for extra supplies. We booked the hotel through a 3rd party website and most of our party works in the hospitality industry. We certainly understand that "those types" of reservations are not considered top-priority, but we felt we were disregarded by the staff. Also, the coffee pot was broken, and the hotel smells like old lady.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Traminer
Reviews.Content: Found ourselves a real good deal on their website - $69 for a king suite with breakfast over the weekend before Christmas. The suite is on the ground floor in a separate wing and consists of a spacious living room with a separate bedroom with a very comfortable oversized bed. Windows look into the lobby so only noise is from other rooms. No gym/fitness rooms but the riverfront prominade is just a quick 5 mins run down Conti St. Take care not to step over the drunk college kids on Bourbon St. Free wi-fi throughout the facilities. Breakfast is nothing to shout about - better to wander down to Cafe Du Monde for beigenets and spiced coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: When I booked our room, the only room available was the petite room which the hotel person warned me was very, very small. We were pleasantly surprised on arrival - he must have meant small by Southern standards, not New York or European standards. The petite room is wide enough for a double bed and 2 side tables and long enough for a closet, armoir, desk and a stand for our suitcase. The room and bathroom were clean. The room has the olde world look with heavy curtains and thick, patterned carpeting. Everything looked a little worn, including the mattress which was a bit too soft. Customer service was good and staff are friendly. This is a small, 3-4 floors building so it was quiet - we didn't see many people in the hotel in the 6 days we stayed there. The hotel is 1 block away from Bourbon Street and all the restaurants. One night when the Saints were playing at the stadium, there was drinking and partying on Bourbon street and we could hear people yelling until the early hours of the morning but it was not loud enough to keep us awake. Bourbon street is closed to traffic at night and people can drink on the street but there are police constantly patrolling the strip so it feels safe that we are only 1 block away from them. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TRUCK WRECKED”
Reviews.Author: niceguy101
Reviews.Content: parking attendant wrecked my truck. He didnt even bother to tell me. bed was kinda ragged out. hotels.com lied about price. they claimed that they charged us for parking then so did the hotel. well hotels.com really charged us for a extra person. if you want to stay here i would drive a smart car or something with bumpers all the way around it. not to mention they valet guy came back to work 3 hours late the next morning. was he drunk when he wrecked my $30,000 truck? quess it will be a mystery.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: hbjill
Reviews.Content: We checked in late a t night and the desk clerk was very helpful. Nice, clean, spacious room. No view, but only 1 block from Bourbon street and the hotel was still very quiet. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: grannyKCMO
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans, and I was concerned about location and safety. The Prince Conti was in the perfect spot for exploring the French Quarter, and I felt extremely safe there. The staff was extremely helpful!! I had called the day before we arrived to find out about storing luggage, since our flight came in at 11:00 am and check in wasn't until 4. When we got to the hotel, we didn't have to store luggage - our room was ready! And it was a fantastic room!! It was just a double room, but we got very lucky with one of the biggest ones on the floor. There were 2 tvs, which we didn't even make use of! I really liked the atmosphere of the streets right around the hotel, very cute. The staff also got us a taxi back to the airport very quickly. I highly recommend this hotel, and plan on staying there on my next trip to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Andrew01_9
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Prince Conti. After looking at all of the hotels in New Orleans (in and out of the French Quater) , Prince Conti seemed the best value (great price and location). It's location was great - 1 minute to Bourbon St and close enough to everything else. Two staff members gave great service and tourist ideas. The room was big enough, clean, comfortable and I had no issue with noise (from inside or outside of the hotel). The included breakfast was good enough (pasties, muffins & beverages). I parked in a public parking lot, an easy 5 minute walk away, for around $10 a night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dennis30041
Reviews.Content: Everything was as described. Great location, nice rooms. Convenient but exspensive parking . Free breakfast was not too bad. The only negative thing I could say is avoid their bar. They charge almost double what the Deja vu across the street charges and they have a good happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good!”
Reviews.Author: vfranson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews, I'm not sure why anyone would give this hotel a 3 let alone a 5!! If you any health or Asthma issues, or have high standards do not stay at this hotel. My son and I were to stay here for 9 days but had to vacate after the first night. As soon as you enter the lobby you are assailed by the mildew, I guess our first clue to the shabbiness of this hotel was the fact that they still used keys for the rooms (a safety issue). Our room was very outdated, the beds were of Motel 6 standards, the linens were old and worn, the tv was at least 10 years old, the bathroom was so small that you could pee and brush your teeth at the same time. The walls were so thin that when the people next door sat on their bed, their headboard hit the wall and actually moved my bed! And you could hear every word they said, it was like staying at a cheap airport motorcourt! I have stayed at several very nice French Quarter hotels, so they can't use the excuse that all FQ hotels smell like mildew because they are old, most don't. The day staff seemed to be nice but the night clerk was extremely condescending and indifferent, if not down right rude, can't quite figure out an attitude like this in a town that uses tourists to sustain itself. We were fortunate enough to be able to move to their sister hotel (St Marie) down the street, which was the same price and soooo much better! So do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel, it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, even greater price”
Reviews.Author: TJZwebe
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through the welcome centre on the Interstate for only $49 and free valet parking! Great price. Ask for room 269. Fantastic room. Large room with everything in it. 20 meters from Bourbon Street. Breakfast was disappointing as everywhere in the US, beter go out and have it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, clean as could be!”
Reviews.Author: nanbr
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. It was so clean. The cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. Rooms are a bit small. Great free continental breakfast in cute dining room- french- croissants, danish, fruit, oj, and wonderful coffee. perfect location, close to everything- safe- loved it- will stay again the next time I am in New Orleans. free Newspaper daily in lobby also.

Reviews.Title: “great location but just OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: infocus
Reviews.Content: PROS: Only a half block from Bourbon Street on Conti Street. We could walk everywhere we needed to go. VERY QUIET. Nicely decorated room. CONS:The continental breakfast is a waste of time. Cheap store bought muffins and danishes along with coffee, juice and tea. The hotel recommended breakfast resteraunt was terrible. The bed was spongy and lumpy and the room had a slightly moldy smell. The wake-up call I needed for an early flight never came. Resteraunt reservations I asked the concierge to make were unavailable I was told. When I called myself, I had no problem. In fact, I had to change one to a later time and still had no problem. Was it a terrible, nightmarish stay? Not at all. I would say it didn't meet my expectations for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Bibthesquid
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights here. Asked for a room in the back of the hotel & it was actually very quiet. Couldn't hear Bourbon Street which is 1/2 block away. Location was very convenient. Included breakfast is just muffins, croissants & danish which was ok but the coffee wasn't too great. Go across the street to the Jagerhaus for their coffee. They have great fluffy eggs & good hashbrowns.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel and nice staff but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: jrondajr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another friend stayed at the Prince Conti on Halloween. While the staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel attracted some questionable guests. Every night around 5 am we were woken up by people screaming down the halls and punching each door as they walked down to their room......it was very disappointing. While the hotel is a great value and location, I think we will spend the extra money next time so we can avoid the trashy hotel guests. We also visited the Bombay club and found the bartender (man) arguing with a customer which made us uncomfortable enough to leave and go elsewhere. Pros: Location, price, friendly staff, clean updated bathrooms on the 3rd floor free Wifi Cons: Noisy street (Conti), terrible guests

Reviews.Title: “Great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: chargerfan92103
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long trip in NOLA and stayed at Prince Conti. Pluses location, location, location! Right off Bourbon street minus the noise. Amy at front desk was/is AWESOME! Always smiling and eager to help. Water pressure! Living in San Diego all bars/ restaurants are non-smoking so it was a real joy to be able to shower under a STRONG stream of water. Housekeeping also very courteous. Minuses pillows asked for extra and put 2 per pillow case. Also walls are little thin could hear couple next door during intimate moments.

Reviews.Title: “My little corner of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: otor74
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It's not my first time staying there. It's one block from Bourbon Street right in the heart of the French Quarter. Walking distance to anywhere you want to visit. Quiet, clean, comfortable. The rooms are not large, but they're cozy. Plus, you're probably not going to New Orleans to sit in the room. The elevator is slow, I will tell you that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: catandpooch
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean and the location was great! It's a good deal for the money if you don't mind the super rude staff. They are not indicative of New Orleans folks. The concierge and front desk staff went so far as to make fun of other guests in front of us. The cleaning staff on the 3rd floor fought loudly with each other. In addition, I slipped on the wet tile in the bathroom and my husband had a hard time getting me some ice. He was told to go to the 2nd floor and find the ice machine and a bag to put it in. Thank goodness for one kind cleaning lady, she gave him a bag , because the front desk didnâ€™t care! We wonâ€™t stay there againâ€¦to bad because itâ€™s a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Spooooky”
Reviews.Author: cgoldenstein
Reviews.Content: Found blood in our room. Coffee pot turned on by itself. Our battery cherger unplugged itself. Nonetheless, the staff and accomodations were great and the location was perfect for a bunch of twenty somethings going to New Orleans. The creepy problems that arose here and there almost made the ambiance of New Orleans that much more special. Do not try and key fight to get in after hours however, as they frown upon that.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti, a fine experience.”
Reviews.Author: Ready4MoreBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 4 nights with another couple. We told the hotel we only had 2 and then split the room with our 2 friends. It doesn't make sense to have to pay more, or get 2 rooms when there was an extra bed in our 2 double room just sitting there. At first we felt we had to sneak in and out, but that stopped after we had been there for a couple of hours. No one was ever the wiser, so do not hesitate to split a room here. The hotel is nice, a half block off Bourbon, and was clean. When we arrived we were given a room with no window! I didn't even know those existed! However, I asked the next morning if they had another, and they switched us. They even moved our luggage to the new room while we were out. That was nice and more than I expected. The hotel is close to Bourbon, but we never heard anything. Even when we got our room with a window!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, questionable staff”
Reviews.Author: alilkiti2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a wedding. The room was big (266). However, the staff could use some training. The toilet was clogged when we arrived. I called down to have it fixed and then we left for several hours. When I got back, it was still clogged! I called down again and the woman at the front desk told me they fixed it. Obviously they didn't. So they had to send up 2 different people and finally snaked the toilet to unclog it. She then called back and told me no one came originally. Umm.. duh. We didn't get the room cleaned on the first day. They left a note under the door. When I called the front desk, the man answering was quite rude and told sarcastically "so sorry they left for the day." Also, another day we were waiting in the lobby and the front desk guy was playing with an iphone. My friend had one too, and they got to talking. Turns out, the staff person found it on Bourbon St. 2 days ago and kept it! My friend told him how to contact the owner using the phone and he ignored him. He said "oh well, it's probably a tourist's." I couldn't believe it! I suggested he call the last number dialed to tell the person he's got the phone, but he didn't do that either. Some of the valets were spot on, others seemed a bit lazy. valet is $28/day This hotel has a great location and charming interior. But the hotel is lacking that famed southern hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Gem Right in the Middle of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Rowan555
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night in the French Quarter to celebrate my birthday. He chose the Prince Conti hotel based on its convenient location (right off Bourbon Street) and the many excellent reviews he found on the internet. Well, the reviews didn't lie. The hotel itself is half a block off Bourbon Street, very convenient if you plan on enjoying the bars or even hitting the galleries on Royal Street. Despite its central location, the hotel is pristine, charming, and quiet. We checked in at 5:30 PM on a Friday and expected that might take a while; however, we were checked in and in our room in less than five minutes. Our room was spacious, cool, and comfortable, with a sofa, fridge, and microwave. The room was spotless and the furniture was well kept. We have had trouble before with the air conditioning not working well at some of the older hotels in the Quarter, but the air worked just fine in our room. We turned the thermostat down fairly low and returned after a night of partying to a cool and comfortable room. A complimentary continental breakfast consisting of huge croissants and danishes, as well as coffee and orange juice, is available every morning until 10 AM. Much appreciated after a long night of drinking. Checkout was a breeze - took all of ten seconds and we were on our way. I highly recommend this hotel to any discriminating traveler looking for a combination of convenience, value, and comfort in the French Quarter. We will definitely stay at the Prince Conti again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Conti!”
Reviews.Author: okeedokey17
