Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for my sister's wedding and was disappointed that I wasn't able to get a room at a nearby hotel most of my family was in. I settled for the Conti, which was much less expensive. Little did I know I was actually quite lucky! The Conti is a small charming hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff and terrific prices. The negotiated group rate for the wedding was only $79/night on the weekend and an additional stay Sunday night was only $59. We cancelled the Monday night stay at the last minute and the staff was friendly and gave us no problems. They held our bags all day Monday. Ms D's has a small continental breakfast available for free each morning- nothing to write home about but nice to get something to snack on. The location was conveniently near Bourbon street while still being very quiet. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: RavenStone777
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti Hotel is nothing less and nothing more than what you need when staying in New Orleans. Service is friendly, the price is right, room is clean, sheets are soft. The room we had was a deluxe, which has a ceiling fan, that to ME was the icing on the cake as I am super used to sleeping with a ceiling fan going. It is literally 10 seconds away from Bourbon Street but you cannot hear any of the noise. The walls are thin and if someone is talking loudly in the next room you can hear a mumble, but this was not a problem. I had a good night sleep every night I was there. I don't see the point of spending an enourmous amount of money on a 5 star hotel (which we initially were intending on doing) when the point of New Orleans is to be out and about and then come back to a clean comfy room. They have continental breakfast which on some days there we took advantage of to have some more spare cash to spend on the town. This hotel does not have room service. This hotel is linked to the St Marie Hotel, which is two blocks over, and guests of the Conti can go to the Hotel St Marie, show your room key, the courtyard and swimming pool are yours to use.

Reviews.Title: “pince conti elegance in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: 1norbert
Reviews.Content: stayed at the prince conti for 5 nights/a most elegant spacious beautiful hotel. staff were all courteous helpful beyond belief. desk clerk amy had a sparkling personality (and wit) and was our virgil for things to do/places to eat. even the car parking valet eric was helpful with suggestions. everyone at the hotel catered to us. would most certainly stay again/and recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melissagh211
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about staying here because of the price but I would suggest this hotel to anyone. We were out and about a lot, most of the time, but it sure was nice to return to. The location is great, the price even greater. And there is a 24 bar/restaurant (cafe dejavu) across the street that had pretty good food for cheap and next to that was a cute little euro cafe open from 8am until 10pm( jager haus) went there for coffee and breakfast, it was really pretty good and cheap. If your looking for a hotel that has a grand lobby, this isn't it. If your looking for a clean room, comfy bed, just somewhere to sleep, get a clean good shower, this is the place. I mean really your in new orleans, There is so much to see and do, do you really think your going to spend a lot of time in your room???? stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HOME IS WHERE THE HEART IS!”
Reviews.Author: Nilosn
Reviews.Content: With an enormous pleasure, IÂ´ am able to tell you that I found my second home in the heart of one of the places I like best in this world: New Orleans. PRINCE CONTI HOTEL is safe, clean, honest, friendly, very well-located, silent, charming and, mainly, responsible. Situated in the French Quarter and with a walking distance from everywhere you may want to go, offers their clients peace, understanding, care and a wonderful relation cost-benefit. If you have the priviledge to be with them, say hello in our names, Nilson Rego and Raul Sippel. Say Cindy we miss her. Youâ€™ll have a marvelous time! We will accept your grate hello when you get back. Best wishes and thank you very much, friends! Do you know what it means to miss New Orleans? We would never miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Kmac08
Reviews.Content: On the plus side this hotel has complimentary continental breakfast, wireless Internet, reasonable room rates, and an excellent location in the French Quarter. The rooms were a little cramped and what is to be expected. But service here is HORRIBLE! Our first morning the maid knocked on the door at 9:30am. We asked her to come back later in the day and she never did. Then the next night I happened to see a spot of blood on the pillow I was laying on. I immediately called the front desk and the woman never even apologized! She asked me to check the closet to ensure there were extra pillows before she bothered sending anyone up. I told her I was so disgusted I was leaving the bloody pillow outside my door. Still no apology or empathy. Hours later my friend returned to the room and informed me that the pillow was still there. On the day we checked out, my friend and I brought our luggage down to the lobby to store for a few hours. We were the only two guests in the lobby and neither the bellman nor the front desk agent even acknowledged out presence. We stood there for a few moments before I had to approach the bellman and ask for his assistance. This property claims to be three diamond but considering their service, they definitely don't deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for New Orleans ambiance, value and location!”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because of the good reviews and a $50 nightly special for July. If you want to be in the heart of the French Quarter and close but not too close to Bourbon Street then this is a solid bet. The entrance is through a covered driveway and consists of 3 stories. Our room had a 12 foot ceiling and 2 nice beds/pillows. It was a decent size room, especially for New Orleans. I liked the addition of a ceiling fan, kind of a rarity in hotels. Bath/shower was average sized, good towels. A/C worked well. They have a continental breakfast with juce, coffee, croissants, rolls. It has its own little bar called the Bombay Club which is known for a great cocktail atmosphere. We didn't get a chance to try it on our 2 night visit. My only concern was the noisy hotel patrons who talked loudly while coming back (from Bourbon St?) at all hours of the night. Comes with the territory I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: califclasy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Prince Conti and had a memorable time! The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We had a junior suite and found it perfect for our needs. The hotel is just enough away from Bourbon Street yet still very close to all the nightlife. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the continental breakfast daily. We were very glad that we had not picked one of the hotels on Bourbon Street because the noise from people and the late night music is loud. We were able to stroll back to the Prince Conti and relax quietly. We had a very nice time and will definately stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel....with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: rrwatkins
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent a week at the Prince Conti when we booked our trip thru Expedia. We were very pleased the minute we got there. At 10:30 in the morning, I didn't expect our room to be ready, but AMY (a gem herself), said our room was ready. Later on in the week, I noticed a couple checking in with a baby that was 3 months old. Amy got on her walkie-talkie & asked the maid to get a crib in the room before the couple even gt in the elevator! That girl is on the ball! While speaking of the staff, EVERYONE we met, from the vallet parking guys, maids, cleaning crew, etc. were just as nice & polite as could be. That to me is more important than staying in a 4 or 5 star place. Our room was on the 2nd floor (2 twin beds) near the ice machine which was a blessing since it was the only one in the hotel. Not much of a view, but we wern't in the "Big Easy" to look out the hotel window. I was expecting a small bathroom from the other reports, but it was ample enough for our needs. (There was not much counter space, however, and my wife had to put a lot of make-up items elsewere. The hotel is in an ideal location as far as the French Quarter is concerned. Although it's only a 1/2 block from Bourbon St., you can't hear any noise from the party folks on the street. Speaking of noise, the Conti has very thin walls. For a couple of nights, we were treated to the sounds of a couple that might have been upset if they knew what we heard. (Thank God they didn't take too long with their love-making...slam bam, thank you maam!) Also, another night or two, we heard several young boys raising cain for about a 1/2 hour before they passed out. A few times there was no ice in the machine, but you can't blame the hotel for that since I saw many guests filling up coolers. The breakfast was the same every morning; coffee, OJ, rolls & jelly, pastrys, apples, & oranges. The Conti also provides two newspapers you can pick up in the lobby (USA Today & the Times-Picaunne).The lady the took place of the breakfast room was also another gem. If you wanted something more than the usual continental affair, you could just walk across the street to the De'javu, a restaurant/bar that is open 24/7. We ate there several times. Not much to look at, but the food was good & cheap. Also, across from the Conti is German reataurant that has good weekday specials. Although we didn't go there the Conti has the Bombay Club attached to the rear of the hotel; an upscale martini lounge with jazz every night. I peeked in, & it seemed very nice. The desk staff was went above & beyond the call of duty to help you with anything you needed; from reservations, advice on where to eat, what to see, getting you a cab, etc. They honestly seem to want you to be happy with their hotel. As I mentioned, the location is ideal. It is very close to many upscale restaurants as well as other eating places that serve very good food. It is also very close to Canal St. so you can catch the bus or trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-season rate- European type hotel”
Reviews.Author: shortysboyKansas
Reviews.Content: I've been to NOLA a half dozen times, this was the first time to book a hotel in French Quarter- I couldn't have been happier with the choice; highly researched on TA. This is more of a European-style hotel, don't expect all of the slick and often unnecessary American niceties. Do expect a comfy bed, ample room, functional bathroom and comfortably A/C. There is also free coffee, OJ and grocery store style pastries/croissants. Nothing is spectacular but nothing is wrong with the place. A good place in a great location- just steps from my favorite bar; Erin Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cat22hd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 2 nights June 15 & 16. We originally booked it mainly for the location - it is just steps to Bourbon Street. The $59 rate for booking via NewOrleansonline didn't hurt either. Service was superb! When we arrived the elevator had just broke. The desk assured us the repairman was on his way and they offered to have someone take our bags to our 2nd floor room. We declined the offer an took them ourselves and by the time we got settled in the room, cleaned up a bit and were ready to head to Bourbon Street the repairman was indeed, working on the elevator. By the time we returned it was fixed. We had a king deluxe room and the room was spacious enough with a large closet. The bed was super comfy. The bath was a bit small. The room was exceptionally clean. There wasn't much of a view (the 1st floor roof with a AC units), but then I didn't come to NO to look out a hotel window. The only problem with the room (and I'd read this in other review also) was that right outside the bathroom door the carpet was always wet. I don;t know if the previous guests let something overflow or if the water came from the AC/Heat duct situated in the ceiling. We just threw a towel over it to remind us not to walk on it in our socks. There is no pool. We did use the parking, which is and additional $30 a day with tax. The lot is small but secure. Continental breakfast is served each morning from 6-10 - juice, coffee, apples, oranges, danish and croissants. With just a few steps to Bourban Street, this hotel was a real find. Next trip to NO, we will definitly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: affama
Reviews.Content: This hotel came recommended from a friend, and a good recommendation it was. Location: great location -- 1/2 block from Bourbon St. and a short walk to anywhere else in the French Quarter -- 2 blocks from Acme Oyster House (awesome food!!!) Staff: friendly and nice Room: stayed in a Junior Suite -- the room was clean and cozy -- bathroom is small but ok -- couch in living room was somewhat uncomfortable, but we didn't use it that much anyway -- the only thing i did not like about this room was that there were no windows, but that might be because it is located on the first floor Parking: at $25/day it will be safe and secure and you will not have to deal with any lot attendant scams I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family ... at a good price it is a great place to stay ... next time i'm in New Orleans, i will definitely consider The Prince Conti again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: stravel09
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a classy hotel with reasonable fees, friendly staff and good valet service don't look anywhere but the Prince Conti Hotel. Cindy was very kind to us and allowed us to upgrade shortly after we were married in the French Quarter. The Bombay Club was also great !

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: hoopgirl1250
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is the one word that sums up our experience at the Prince Conti Hotel. . A few days before leaving I received an email advertising summer rates with free parking so I immediatly booked thinking the rate can't be beat and how much time were we going to spend in the room anyway. I was a little apprehensive based on the mixed TA reviews. However, even from the moment of check in the hotel exceeded my expectations. Check in was quick and easy the young man at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant. We were parking a car and that went very smoothly as well. Our room was clean and a decent size for me and my 16 year old daughter. The air conditioning worked very well. The bathroom was decent sized and very clean as well. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and very nice. The location couldn't have been more perfect for us; close to everything we wanted to do and an easy walk from anywhere in the quarter. The last night we were there was the only night we heard anyone returning from there night out. The ladies returning must have had a really great night.... This hotel was perfect for us and we will most definitly stay there again. If you are looking for a nice place to stay that is clean and close to everything I would suggest you consider the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: jaisonlynch
Reviews.Content: me and my buddy were on a bike trip across the southern states and when we landed in the french quarter we were lucky enough to find this hidden gem. Just a half block of Bourbon St you get some quiet and great prices. The best part about it was the personalized customer service. Amy and Eric at the front desk ended up being our personal tour guides of the famous city. They NEVER steered us wrong. Going for more local bars and restaurants instead of the overpriced underperformed tourist stuff. Highly recommended. Thanks you guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti was perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick531
Reviews.Content: Let me start off saying that I did tons and tons of research on where to stay before we came to New Orleans. Being that we had never been before, I wanted to read a bunch of reviews to find a decent place. I wanted a decent hotel that was clean, safe, in walking distance to everything in the French Quarter at a reasonable price. I am so happy that I got exactly what I wanted. The hotel was very charming with a little bit of an old fashioned, New Orleans type feel. When we walked into the lobby, we were immediatley greeted by the woman at the front desk asking if we were checking in. Over to the left, I was delighted to see secuirty guard stand with the security facing us and the elevator. We gave our name, and in a split second she checked us into our room an hour and a half before normal check in time. When we got to our room, I was so happy to see that it was a decent size with a large king sized bed, and a window that faced out towards Bourbon Street. Even though we faced the street, we never heard one bit of noise. The hotel is step away from one of the best parts without all of the noise. The room was clean, the bathroom was a nice size. The hotel was in walking distance to everything, which was great. I will say though that if you plan on walking around all day, it can be a lot of walking. But the location still can't be beat being right next to Bourbon Street. Almost everytime we came in and left the hotel, there was a new staff member at the front desk. Every single one of them was pleasant and extremely helpful if we had questions. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel, and really don't have anything to complain about. Some of the other complaints i saw about this hotel was that it didn't have a pool or a courtyard. Why in the world would you come to New Orleans to swim in a pool? Go to the beach then! And it didn't bother me that there was no Courtyard at this hotel - there were plenty of courtyards around the French Quarter to see and visit. All in all, this hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. If you are alooking for an over the top, fancy place with room service, a pool (I still don't understnad this one), and other amenities, then this is probably not what you are looking for. This hotel was great, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ptown_John
Reviews.Content: Not sure what other reviewer's expectations were but the Prince Conti was exactly what I was expecting. A stones throw from Bourbon St made it very convenient to run back to the hotel when a bathroom break or freshening up was needed. Its an older hotel so there is a musty smell in the rooms and hallways. Again not sure what you expect with a hotel built in 1870. Previous reviews about the thin walls are not exagerated. You can literally hear everything going on in the adjacent rooms. Here is the trick, get out of your room and enjoy New Orleans. Shower, toilet, sink, A.C. and TV all worked fine. TV was a bit of a joke (maybe 17"), but again, put down the remote and take in the sights and sounds of the French Quarter. Booked the room in advance and prepaid the entire weekend for $325 on their website for Saturday thru Tuesday over Memorial Day weekend. A steal in my opinion. Didn't try the continental breakfast but why would I when right outside the hotel is the French Quarter full of restaurants! If your looking for a country club with spa, pool and plush amenities look elsewhere. If your looking for a conventiently located, average hotel for a place to stay while making the most of what the French Quarter has to offer then give this place a chance.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crisofero
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend at the Prince Conti. Our family had a WONDERFUL time! The staff was friendly and accommodating and the rooms were nice and clean. It is in the perfect location -- just a little ways from Bourbon Street. I'm not sure about the prior reviews, but we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice -- Low-End, Noisy, Not Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: lakshmidas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it had great rates, a central location, and the reviews here were very good, which I have a hard time understanding. The biggest problem had to do with sound. The walls are paper thin, and when the people next door had a conversation or argued, it wasn't just loud -- it was as though they were right in the room with us. This made it difficult to get to sleep, and/or stay asleep. The room itself was old and worn, which in itself is not such a bad thing. I expected no frills. But the carpet was actually somewhat sticky, which was not a nice feeling. Ick. The bathroom, to give them some credit, was clean, though the bathtub didn't drain well after taking a shower. I didn't mind the lobby, which is small and bed-and-breakfast-ish. Some of the staff were nice, others were aloof. If you are looking for a pleasant experience, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you do not want the French Quarter charm”
Reviews.Author: Xphile1067
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, clean, but no courtyard, no swimming pool, very loud housekeeping staff and if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room away from rooms with kids. Late night party people will also disturbe your sleep, when coming back, as the halls are narrow and the walls don't sound like they have any insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to sleep just steps from Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: My wife and another couple stayed at the Prince Conti from 4/16-4/20 for French Quarter Fest. Due to the festival the rates were a little higher than normal but less than many of the other French Quarter hotels. About us: I am an avid reader and poster on Trip Advisor. We are also pretty easy going people that don't let the little stuff bother us while we are on vacation. We also typically go for a hotel that is in a great location, at a decent price, and gets good/decent reviews for being clean. I have to say that the Prince Conti met all of our expectations and I would recommend this hotel Check-in : We arrived around 2pm on Thur. Both of our rooms were ready and they put us within 1 room apart from our friends on the 3rd floor. The desk person, I believe Cindy, was very nice along with the rest of the staff we encountered at the desk. Within minutes we were checked-in and on our way. Rooms: We were both on the 3rd floor and our window looked out on the not-so-pretty roof/courtyard...or should I say "courtroof". The rooms were standard size hotel rooms both with king size beds. The bed looked as though it was on a slight slant but ended up not being noticeable and quite comfortable. The rest of the furniture was looking worn but was clean. The bathroom was also very clean. The pedestal sink eliminated having any counter space but helped make the bathroom seem larger. There was a small glass shelf to put things on but little place else to put anything toiletries. We managed but don't expect to spread out much more than a couple of toothbrushes and toothpaste and a couple other small things. The water temp in the shower also did fluctuate at times but it wasn't terrible. Our friends seem to have a similar overall experience except their air conditioner was stuck on the whole time but wasn't bad enough to complain. Location: Hard to beat! Steps from Bourbon and it was very quiet A couple things to reiterate that people have mentioned in the past: 1. There was no in-room safe. Not sure why every hotel these days doesn't have one. 2. They still have metal keys. Not an issue for us since they are decent size but I am sure there would be a charge if you lost one. 3. There was an iron, although we never needed to use it 4. They have a continental breakfast...but who needs that when you are in one of the great food cities in the world? Just give me a hot beignet and coffee from Cafe Du Monde and I am happy! So overall, a nice stay. If you our looking for a clean hotel, at a decent price, and is just steps from Bourbon than this may be a good choice. If you expect new furniture and top notch amenities than you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuRkaMan
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel last week. On either Thursday or Friday evening around 5 pm I called to book my room. I was talking to a young lady who could barely speak. I constantly had to keep asking her "What did you say" or "I'm sorry, could you repeat that". It was quite horrible that she had to talk on the phone with no one around to help her. Other than the phone experience, the non voice person, the hotel was clean. The front desk staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Warning, you may be "walked"”
Reviews.Author: Milestogo00
Reviews.Content: This is an odd review to write because I never wound up staying at the hotel. Shortly before we got on the plane, the online company I had used to booked the hotel called to say the Prince Conti had a maintenance problem and would we mind staying in the Conti's sister property, the St Marie. With no real choice, I agreed. The St. Marie is a pleasant hotel, but cheaper with dark, somewhat musty rooms. While in New Orleans, I checked out the Prince Conti; it had no maintenance problem and was just over booked. Word to the wise: you may want to look elsewhere if where you stay is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: wormula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for my husbands 50th birthday trip to New Orleans. We are normally budget travellors. I picked this hotel based on the very good reviews it recieved even though it was about 50% more expensive than other hotels in similar or just slightly less good location. There was absolutely nothing special about this hotel to justify the cost. Yes the hotel was clean, but most hotels are. the room and the bathroom were tiny just like most hotels in NO. the service was fine - nothing special, even though I had let them know it was a very special occassion for us. The location is excellent, but there are at least 25 hotels with similarly good location I would recommend this hotel only if you are getting a good price. I will not be staying there again, unless I am getting a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: 2blueiis
Reviews.Content: We took a chance on a very inexpensive room (Room #100) and weren't quite sure what we would get. The room turned out to be spacious and beautifully furnished. The bathroom was large with plenty of counter space. The only down side was that it was ground level and they had painted the bottom half of the window for privacy (street side) and the curtains were heavy so no light came in. The desk and housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. We got a great deal on this room but I'm sure it must go for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Location. Friendly staff. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads
Reviews.Content: Have spent more than 45 nights in New Orleans over 14 years. We stayed here for the first time in December 29m 2008-January 2, 2009. We had previously booked this hotel for Labor Day weekend 2008, but our trip was cancelled due to a hurricane. The Prince Conti had refunded our room in full, no questions asked. Very understanding. So, we rebooked for post-Christmas/New Year's trip. The cab ride from the airport to the hotel was about 23 minutes, maybe shorter. Excellent location, 1 block from Bourbon Street, yet quiet. We didn't hear any street noise, only some fireworks on the river on New Year's Eve. We were checked into our room before 11 a.m. which was great. Nice king-sized bed. View was limited of the building/wing next door. Bathroom was nice. Nice soap. Free breakfast was fine for quick pick-up before heading out. We requested no room service each day and this was honored. Thankfully we never heard our neighbors and only light hallway noise a few times. No biggie. I heard this building used to house labs, perhaps pharmacy? Anyway, I didn't get to request a haunted room since we checked in early, not sure there are any. But the hallways are sort of spooky. Nice ambience lighting. I love old hotels and the historic and haunted stuff is exciting. But if you aren't into spooky, you probably wouldn't even think that about this hotel if I hadn't mentioned it. In the opposite direction of Bourbon St. is the Muse Conti Wax Museum, just steps away. Very cool. Been there twice. If you aren't familiar with the Quarter, this area is safe. They are expensive and inexpensive places to eat across the street. But, as with the entire Quarter, a cup of coffee, snack, alcoholic beverage or tasty meal are always a few steps away from anywhere you are. The front desk staff was always friendly, prior to our arrival and during our stay. The elevator was always clean and very fast for an older building. There was parking available but unless you drive in, you don't need a car. We had drinks at the hotel bar, Bombay Club. Great place to go. Romantic, private ambience, warm and dark. Be careful though, if you just order a couple of shots for your coffee without asking price, you may end up with a $20 coffee drink! Doh! Great place for after dinner drinks and dessert. Live music sometimes. Would definitely stay again unless it was the middle of the hot summer because they don't have a pool. OH! We got the online, pre-pay rate from their own website.

Reviews.Title: “Cindy”
Reviews.Author: jwmc80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and was in a GREAT location, but what made my stay so enjoyable was Cindy who was the front desk manager during my stay and couldn't have been more helpful. She was a very warm person that seemed to care about our stay in the hotel. I will be staying there every time I return to New Orleans which is about a few times a year just because of the service I received from Cindy. She deserves some type of recognition for hotel management about how well she does at her job and I will be calling to let them know how great my stay was because of her.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep in late.”
Reviews.Author: J0hnnyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Centrally located right off Bourbon but still quiet. Didn't make it to the bar for a martini. Maybe next time. Location, location. Not far to go to stumble home. Clean rooms. Price is Okay. Breakfast is so, so. Could be better. Very helpful and nice people running it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - As Always”
Reviews.Author: daddysbadgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with a fantastic location. The staff at the Prince Conti are always very accomodating. We have stayed there on a number of occasions and have had great experiences at this hotel. The room rates are always reasonable. Looking forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wre3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, tremendous value for money. The staff are fabulously friendly and helpful. The reception staff are lovely, very enthusiastic and professional. Housekeeping are polite and well-organised. The bedrooms are nicely decorated in a New Orleans style and are quiet at night. I have thoroughly enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best New Years Eve and Day I Have Had”
Reviews.Author: UtahJoe2
Reviews.Content: My Brother, my friends, and I stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel for New Years Eve/Day and the Sugar Bowl. We had a blast. As always, John, Lisa, Rick, Peter, Cindy, Chad, Cliff, Eric, and Brett took good care of us. We have been staying at The Prince Conti Hotel for many years. We are never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel- whether you're travelling on a budget or not!”
Reviews.Author: bp487
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in the French Quarter you can't go wrong with the Prince Conti. We weren't particularly interested in Bourbon Street, but it is situated in a very central location where you're close to everything New Orleans has to offer. We had reserved a deluxe king room but were upgraded to a suite for FREE. I was in disbelief and asked the front desk to confirm there were no additional charges, and the response was "I saw that the room wasn't reserved for the next few days so I figured I would give you two some extra room". I'm not sure if it was a completely honest answer, but the room was excellent. We did get a chance to peek into a regular room and it seemed quite nice as well. Our room was situated on the side of the hotel closest to Bourbon Street yet I was never waken up by noise, even on Saturday night when it was crazy. I did hear a few vibrations and screams so if you're a light sleeper that may be a problem. We requested a late checkout, which was given to us at no additional charge. My advice for people traveling on a budget, aside from staying at this hotel, is to take the bus from the airport if you don't have a car. It is poorly advertised and marked, and you will likely have to ask more than one person to figure out which bench to wait for it at, but a minor inconvenience and $1.60/person certainly beats a $30 cab ride or a $15/person airport shuttle van.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me-great value”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter71
Reviews.Content: I'm a girl who does my research when I'm going to spend my money on something...and as such I spent a great deal of time researching hotel options for this vacation. Granted, I"ve been to NOLA many times -- but always for business, so I never had to worry about accommodations and they were always the higher end hotels. However, it's a little different when you're paying out of your own pocket, rather than using the corporate card and staying as part of a conference or company meeting. In this case, I was going to NOLA for a long weekend/girls' trip with my mom, and I wanted something that was in a great (and safe) location, not too hard on the pocketbook, and DID NOT HAVE BUGS. On a couple of occasions, I'd been about to book a hotel based on a great-sounding description...but then reading further I'd see the magic word (aka - cockroaches) in someone's writeup that called off all bets. NOLA is known for its cockroaches (rumor has it that the cockroach was originally part of the Saints' original logo), but that doesn't mean I want that aspect of the Big Easy up close and personal, thank you very much! :) Anyway, I found this hotel to be what we were looking for. Was it the nicest hotel I'd ever been to? No. Did it have the most amenities? Absolutely not. Would I eat the continental breakfast? Nunca. Would I have been a bit disappointed if it was my first time to NOLA and I was hoping to rely on the concierge for guidance on what to do? Definitely. However, 1) The price for what we got couldn't be beat. 2) It was safe - we never felt in danger, and we were two women out alone. 3) NO BUGS IN SIGHT. 4) Location, location, location! It was literally half a block from the action on Bourbon street, 2 blocks from Canal (main ave where the streetcar lines run), and just a quick 10 minute walk (if that much) to the riverfront (IMAX, aquarium, etc.), and a short walk to Cafe Du Monde and Jackson square. Consider this - you aren't spending your time in your hotel room. If it's about the NOLA experience, then what you want is somewhere clean, safe, and walkable to everywhere (take a cab from the airport and don't even bother with a rental car...parking in the quarter is pretty much impossible and why pay for the valet??). This hotel is it. Oh, and by the way - we were in a room that faced out towards the direction of Bourbon and we didn't hear much of anything at night. We went to bed around 10:30/11 each night and slept very soundly. One night, some people were a little drunk when they came back, so they were a bit noisy in the hallway...but once they went into their rooms we heard nothing. Also, it kind of cracks me up when I read the reviews that say "we were appalled...there were NO amenities! no pool! no gym!" etc. etc. My answer to that - did you even halfway read the hotel descriptions? Any description on Orbitz, Travelocity, Expedia, or any other such site will tell you what amenities the hotel does and doesn't have...so "shame on you" for not paying attention. Granted, I think they shouldn't even bother advertising the free continental breakfast...my mom and I walked into the restaurant after check-in and walked right out. There are plenty of places to eat for breakfast/brunch (we enjoyed Monte's, as well as a place on the Southeast corner of Jackson Park whose name escapes me (across from Cafe du Monde, right on the corner facing the park). Cafe Beignet (sp) was great for a quick on-the-go breakfast our last morning before heading to the airport. As far as the concierge, I've stayed at the Marriott (not the JW but the regular one) before and they have an excellent concierge service. We stopped by there a couple of times and asked some general questions...they were very helpful. We never told them we weren't staying at the hotel, and they never asked. Plus the hotel and lobby are so big they probably don't know the difference. I wouldn't...! As far as restaurants - DEFINITELY check out K-Paul's on Royal (it's across from what I believe is city hall - or some type of federal/legal building). The drum (type of fish) is AMAZING and the service was wonderful...I had eaten there once before while on business and loved it even more the second time around. Bayonna was a great one as well...the redfish was really great (exit hotel and make a left...then take first right and it's on that block, on the right). Redfish Grill wasn't bad. NOLA isn't bad either (one of Emeril's restaurants, for those of you who are fans of his). Recommendations - Walk wherever you can...there are some great sights and photo ops! Hop the ferry over to Algiers, even if you just get back on it and come back over. You get some great views of the city from the boat. Insectarium - that's where you go if you want to see bugs (i.e., safely behind glass). You can even eat them in the cafeteria...and they're quite delicious! Garden District tour is nice - we toured with Katie and she's awesome & feisty. Preservation Hall is a great experience, even if you don't stay for an entire set. Just be sure to snap a pic of the band right when they walk out and get settled, because that's when they make the announcement that flash photography is not allowed. :) On Bourbon - Fat Catz on St. Louis and Bourbon is alot of fun with the resident band called the Connection. They play alot of old 70's and 80's funky tunes. Miscellaneous: I'm into buying a Powerball ticket whenever I go to a Powerball state, and there's a tiny convenience store on Royal about 30 steps from Canal (on the left when walking away from Canal) that sells them. If you're looking for little snacks, there's a Walgreens which I believe is on Royal a few blocks down from Canal...we stopped there every day to pick up water and it's also where you can go for any toiletries you may have forgotten. And of course, in general, be smart about where you go/what you do. NOLA is a city just like anywhere else...there are places you definitely should not go alone, and things you should not do after dark. BE SMART ABOUT THINGS. Stay where the crowds are (you can't go wrong on Bourbon -- save for the revellers who've had too much to drink, but are typically harmless...and there are plenty of cops around). Girls - keep your eye on your drink at all times. That's about all I can think of...happy traveling and enjoy NOLA! Tip big when you can (~25%)...the city and its people need it!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wmsaunt
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is a pleasant hotel in the French Quarter. We stayed in one of the suites and found it to be very clean and well appointed. The price was very reasonable. The beds were not the most comfortable but we were able to sleep without problem. Our room overlooked Conti Street and there was a lot of street noise. That being said, if we had not overlooked the street we would have missed the wedding parade complete with jazz band. If you don't want the noise from the street request a room that doesn't face the street. The staff was helpful. We had a delicious Christmas Eve dinner at the Bombay Club. Overall, pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle8
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor in the double suite. The room was a gem. I loved all the towels we had and the heat lamp in the bathroom so we weren't chilly getting out of the shower. We had two TVs which was great because I could watch something different than my husband. I don't like maids in my room so we always hung the Do Not Disturb sign. The maids hung extra towels, soaps, and coffee on our door! That was terrific. Our room also had a bidette (sp?) next to the toilet!! HA! It really added to the character of the hotel. The maids were terribly noisy. Everyday. They started at 9am on our floor and with it being New Orleans we would have liked to sleep later than that. Couldn't. They jabbered like mules in the halls and their carts were bumping into things and across the floor bumps. The hotel really needs to tell the maids to try to be quiet. The air conditioner/heater didn't work in the bedroom, but we found that the one near the bathroom sufficed to keep the two rooms cool enough. Bourbon Street noise didn't bother us at all, even though our room was closest to Bourbon. There was a lot of cars with their bass really loud, but that could happen anywhere. This location is superb. We picked it for that and also because we were driving from Iowa and needed a hotel with a parking lot. We usually stay at Le Richelieu but that's too far to walk. Our room was spotless and the front desk people were curteous. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place stinks...literally!”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter24
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand how this place is so highly rated. It is old & tired. It smells horrible. The room smells like musty, mildewy rot. The hallways are not that much better. There are NO amenitites...no pool, no courtyard, no refrigerators, no safe in room. Beds are ancient and extremely uncomfortable and the noise from Bourbon Street is hardly tolerable when you're trying to sleep. The staff acted as if you were bothering them if you asked for anything and I mean anything. Very unfriendly. I would never, ever stay here a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: jen83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you need a place to sleep in the French Quarter. The hotel didn't have a pool, gym or other facilities but you really don't need any of that when you're in New Orleans. The room was quite spacious and decorated nicely. It's also quiet (which is surprising considering the hotel is situated so close to Bourbon Street). The people on the front desk were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nothing special but there are so many places to eat in New Orleans you can always eat elsewhere. The Bombay Club is a good place go get a pre or after dinner martini, there's so much choice just ask the bar tender to choose for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Conti!”
Reviews.Author: brunette1122
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to get away for Thanksgiving this year and go to New Orleans. I am surprised at the bad reviews I have seen about this hotel, because everything was 100% great! Check in was super fast and easy and the evening valet person was very helpful. Our room was clean and nice and was actually overlooking Bourbon Street. We didn't figure this out until the last night. That being said, we didn't hear a thing. It was 100% quiet! The desk staff was VERY helpful. We asked a handful of people how to get places and recommendations for places to go and they were great! The only thing I did not like was that depending on the time of day, the valet is either very good or not at all. Some of the guys dilly-dallied and wouldn't get your car when you asked and then one guy didn't leave my keys in the ignition when he went to get another car, resuting in us having to wait for them. Other then that, it was all great. We stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday and the friday evening of the Bayou Classic. After a certain time the hotel locks the main door and you need your key to gain access. They also do see who is coming and going and have a police guard at the entrance at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just about the Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Copronymous
Reviews.Content: Looking for an affordable Thanksgiving get-a-way, I went to Priceline. I put in what I considered to be a ridiculously low bid, and the Prince Conti accepted. I really didn't quite know what to expect given the mixed reviews one can find around the net. We arrived in town around 2:00 PM, but check-in isn't until 4. So, we parked and had drinks. At 4, we drove in to the Prince Conti valet area, which is covered and off of the street. Check-in was a breeze; just hand over your license and a card, and get your keys. Since we checked-in so early, our car was parked in the Prince Conti's exceedingly small on-site lot. That was nice, though, because we could get to it easily go put things in or take things out as needed. They'll also let you in-and-out your car with a little notice. Valet isn't cheap though. Be prepared to pay at least $28/day. As for the room, it was more than adequate. Filled with antiques, it was a little on the small side. But when you're staying the the Big Easy, what should you expect? Beds were not the best, as they were somewhat soft and squeaky. Still, we slept just fine. The room was by no means soundproof, the noise from Bourbon St. wasn't excessive. Our view was of the alley and the building next door. That in itself was entertaining though, as an "exhibitionist" couple put on quite a show (just a heads-up if you're bringing kids). The staff was quite friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable of the city. Free WiFi is throughout the hotel, though my PDA had a difficulty connecting from time to time. Continental breakfast wasn't extensive. Overall I'm very satisfied. Had a great time, and the Prince Conti contributed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: scooby32
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Prince Conti and probably the best. From arriving and Ann on reception recognising us with a warm welcome . Little touches like this make such a difference. Our room was huge and quiet with plenty of New Orleans charm., , The free breakfast coffee, juice and croissants was a nice start to the day. This is a small hotel, and whilst there every member of staff we met was really helpful. As a French quarter base perfect. We are already planning to re book for next year.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: lmns
Reviews.Content: My friends booked the Prince Conti, as they had stayed there a number of times. I had no idea what to expect. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel was very clean and the staff were attentive to our every need. I thought it might be noisy because it was close to a lot of bars, but it was quiet and I always felt safe. There was someone on duty at all times and they really watched the comings and goings of the guests and made sure there weren't people who didn't belong there. Everyone was so nice. The hotel was within walking distance of tons of great restaurants, bars and activites. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: birdtown
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location in relation to the French Quarter. We didn't care much for Bourbon St., but the hotel is also close to other good restaurants and some sights. If you have a car, there is really no other option than parking in their valet, which is $28 per night. There was noise from Bourbon each night, but it was more white noise than anything else, and did not hinder our sleep. The room we had was nice in that it had the obvious historical touches of a former warehouse/factory, but the amenities were few and the sheets and beds were nothing special to speak of. I was a little disappointed with the service. The front desk staff were not incredibly helpful or friendly. We needed to print two sheets of paper, but they would not allow us to do so from the lobby computer and printer even if we paid for it. Instead, we were directed to an Internet Cafe a few blocks away. Had they allowed me to print a page for $1, I would gladly have paid the exorbitant price to avoid the inconvenience of going to the Internet cafe and paying $3 for 15 minutes and $.10 to print a page. They could actually make money on the deal, but they refuse to be accommodating. The other frustration was they would not allow us to keep our car in the lot beyond noon on the day we checked out. We had an event 3 blocks away, and we would have been back at 12:15, but they said we would have been charged an additional $28. It seems like for $28 a day, they could accommodate us for an additional 15 minutes or half hour. The attached restaurant had some really great music the one night we checked it out, but we did not eat there. The continental breakfast was not worth stopping for. I got a great price on Priceline, but I would probably choose a different hotel if choosing myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many ways”
Reviews.Author: tuck78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 2 nights in early October. We like small, old boutique hotels & the Conti does a very good job...the rooms had been recently re-done & were very nice with new linens, carpets, drapes, etc.; the hallways were fresh & sparkling; all of the staff was very nice -- we arrived at 10:30 & they let us check in. The price was terrific ($75 & $89) & the location was a half block from the best part of Bourbon. We very much liked the bar/restaurant & started each evening off there. We would definitely stay here again & recommend it highly,.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_trvler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Price Conti 09/22-09/26. The hotel is convenient to everything in the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and accomodating when asked for reccommendations or directions. We stayed on the 3rd floor overlooking Conti street and it was nice and quiet. We were told by a bartender in Jackson Square that the building used to be a coffee factory and the 3rd floor is haunted. Not sure about that....but it was charming and had the old world charm we were looking for. There's a great restaurant across the street called Deja Vu that's open 24hrs a day. It was decent food for a late nite snack, and it's nice to get away from Bourbon St. We would definitely stay here again when we return to NO.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: WinterInSevilla
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti hotel is in a great location in the middle of the quarter. Honestly it can't be beat. Walking anywhere in the quarter was a breeze, and it is super close to the streetcar stop if you want to head uptown or to midcity. A few reviews mentioned the fact that even though it is only 1 block off Bourbon, there was no noise. That is not exactly true. We were overlooking Conti street and if I wasn't already used to my husband's snoring, I might have had a problem sleeping with all the noise going on all night. If you're a heavy sleeper, no problem. If not, ask for a room off the street. The room itself was spacious and clean (including the bathroom). I will say, though, that we had to kill 2 cockroaches in our room. Now, I went to school in New Orleans, and I know that no matter how clean you are, the roaches are everywhere. AND, it had just rained which tends to bring them out. I don't think it was a negative reflection of the hotel, but bad luck. However, it probably wouldn't happen at a bigger hotel where they have more places to hide. The people were nice enough, and the room was always made up for our return each night. The biggest draw for this place is the GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Close but just far enough away”
Reviews.Author: mluche
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a weekend trip to New Orleans and our stay at the Prince Conti hotel. I must say that we couldn't have been happier. We were one block away from Bourbon St., but the noise level--or lack there of--made us the envy of our friends who stayed at a much louder hotel. This may not be a Hilton, but it doesn't need to be. The staff, especially the woman who worked the front desk in the morning, was very helpful when we needed directions and were dealing with a lost luggage issue. Our room was spotless and comfortable. This was our first time in NOLA and our next will have us back to the Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place”
Reviews.Author: Iceman66
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti Hotel, New Orleans LA (Super Place) 9-14-08 til 9-17-08 Reviewer: Roger & Ruth Ann of Morganton NC My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three days and were totally impressed with it. The room was rather large even with the king bed in there. The furniture made you feel like you were in a different period of time. The bathroom was small but hey what do you actually do in the bathroom. It had all the modern functions. Our room was on the second floor of this three story hotel and it was absolutely quite. And we really slept well on that gorgeous bed.... Front desk staff were extremely friendly, polite, curtious and professional. My wife and I would especially like to thank Cindy, Peter, Ann and Van who made our stay there worthwhile. After all the above this Hotel also has location, location, location.... Just steps of Bourbon Street. My wife and I were so impressed with the staff and place itself that upon returning home we booked to go back there for a week during Mardi Gras Feb '09'.... Thanks for everything Cindy. Roger & Ruth Ann Brisson Morganton, NC

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trillimer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince Conti 8/25-8/29. My father and I met in New Orleans to do some genealogy research. We both booked our rooms online using their value rate, which was $50 for all 4 nights. We had rooms that were newly remodeled and did not face the street, which I think contributed to the quiet despite the fact that Bourbon Street is literally just steps from the hotel. Great location, everything in the French Quarter is within walking distance. Don't bother renting a car if you plan to stay within the French Quarter, which I would highly advise since the rest of the city isn't worth going to. It's unfortunate that this hotel is in New Orleans and not in a more charming city. The staff seemed a little standoffish but that may have been because there was some uncertainty as to whether or not Hurricane Gustav was going to make landfall there. The hotel restaurant normally open for breakfast was closed during this time and they had a free continental breakfast in lieu. Nothing spectacular..coffee, juice, croissants and pastries...but it's free and enough to get you going for the day. There really isn't anything that stood out about this hotel but it was clean, well-managed, in a wonderful location, and you couldn't beat the price. Would recommend if rate is below $100/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With The Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Melanie_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a good deal on the hotel & airfare to New Orleans and did indeed find one. We booked thru Travelocity and the hotel we chose was the Price Conti in the French Quarter. When I was in New Orleans 10 months prior I stayed at a different hotel about a block away from this one - the location is ideal for both, right off of Bourbon Street in the heart of the Quarter, and for that you're generally willing to deal with some things that maybe aren't up to par in a hotel...but the Prince Conti left nothing to be desired. I was already impressed before we'd even gotten to New Orleans, I'd emailed the hotel asking if they would hold our bags after check-out since our flight home was later in the day. I was expecting a 'no' as many of my friends on trips that they had taken were told that after check-out the hotel was not responsible for their bags. Instead, I received a very friendly email from the hotel saying that yes, they would hold the bags, and free of charge. We arrived at the hotel some four hours before check-in time, and I was expecting to just have them hold out bags until then & we'd come back, however the woman at the counter told me that she could go ahead and put me in a room right then and there. This did not happen at the hotel I stayed at during my last trip. The lobby, elevator, hallways of the hotel, and the room itself were all beautiful and clean. The water pressure in the shower was full-on. We have nothing but wonderful things to say about the room. The continential breakfast was also better than some I'd seen at other hotels, and was available for a longer period of time each day as well. The staff was friendly and very helpful. One review I'd seen said that this hotel was pricey. But with all of the travel sites available these days there's no reason why anyone should have to book a vacation that's pricey. Some time & tenacity will find you a good deal, unless the person who is booking is being completely inflexable about the dates they want to visit. We got a really good deal on our travel package - and during a time too when fuel prices were sky-rocketing. We were trying to be cheap, frankly, as neither of us can afford to spend a lot of money on a get-away, and we were very happy with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingwithTandM
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location Just returned from stay on Aug 26th 2008. Was there scouting hotels for convention in January Booked directly their website 3 weeks in advance using "Value" rate. $50 plus tax including rolls and coffee in the morning. This was off season and during a week day. The rates obviously are higher other times, but did want to point out they do have some great deals at times. Am coming back in January, week day "Value" rates in January were only $84... about the same price as the airport Sleep Inn. Very happy with everything. Rooms size for French Quarter was great. Entire hotel was very clean and quiet considering we were 1/2 block from the middle of the action on Bourbon Street. (Google: Conti & Bourbon street New Orleans LA) Nice bar in back with patio seating outside. I did use the valet service for our car ($25.00 per night). When we pulled up in front of the hotel, a young man in uniform asked if we were checking in, and directed us to pull in to the driveway leading into the hotel. When we checked out I told the desk clerk we would be leaving at 7:00, had a roll and coffee, and exactly at 7:00 our car pulled into the drive... Could not have asked for more. Look forward to return in January

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Engfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti because we wanted some place special to celebrate our son's 21st birthday. The room was clean and comfortable, and even though the hotel was less than a half a block from all the "action" on Bourbon Street, it was very quiet. I would have given this hotel an "excellent" rating except that despite the fact that rooms were listed for $59 online and the fact that we were quoted a price of $79, we were charged $100 plus, and a $28 (not $25 as stated) fee for parking. On the plus size, the staff was all very friendly and even gave our son his own key. Also, the hotel bar, The Bombay Club, was a wonderful bar for "grownups." The atmosphere was very laid back and the live performer, a piano player, played entertaining but non-typical pieces. No "Piano Man" here! Too bad it closed so early. On the minus side was the cost and the continental breakfast, which did not include any milk or cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: proudrcf
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the prince conti the valet was a bit confusing. I'm definately not used to the one way streets of new orleans so I had to do a few laps around the conti until my wife and brother found out what I was supposed to do. The rooms were actually very nice; mine with a king size bed. They included everything you needed ironing board, coffee pot etc. Everyday the cleaning staff did a great job and it was nice coming back from a full day of new orleans. The location couldn't have been better as I literally dropped my car off at valet ($25/night) and didn't touch it until we left. We walked everywhere but everything is definately in walking distance. The continental breakfast is nothing to brag about but is still nice. I have had worse at other hotels. The only thing I really had a slight problem with was the staff at the front service counter. They always seemed grumpy especially when we arrived which wasn't a very nice welcome. All in all our trip was great and so was our prince conti hotel. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a great location for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Just off Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: flaguy
Reviews.Content: I expected a little more based on the reviews. There was nothing really wrong with the place but nothing really special either. I had a good-sized room with two double beds and a very small bathroom. My window looked out over where they parked the cars and the only noise was the early morning loud talking of the employees down below. It would have been nice to have a courtyard or similar area to meet and talk with friends. They do offer a free continental breakfast but the menu never varied during the time I was there--coffee, oj, croissants, and danish. I usually skipped the free one and ate at the Deja Vu across the street. My friend had their club sandwich and raved about it and the huge basket of fries. The location is great as it is about a block off Bourbon Street but far enough away you don't hear the late night noise (at least in my room location). I got an excellent rate and would probably stay again if the price was right but might try one of their sister hotels that have courtyards and pools. (Hotel St. Marie I think is one)

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: RobSport
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a three day meeting at the Prince Conti Hotel for my work team. I first visited the property three weeks prior to the meeting and was very impressed by the Sales Manager (Karla) and the passion and energy that she had for this property. She took the time to show us a few different options and never made us feel rushed or pushed into anything. After just completing the stay, I was extremely pleased with everything. The location is outstanding, just one short block to Bourbon Street. The meeting room was incredible with an outstanding view of the street (Conti) below and the service that we received for the most part was commendable. The rooms were very spacious and extremely clean. Keep in mind that you are in the French Quarter and its part of the experience. This is not the Hilton or the Marriott. I would absolutely recommend the hotel and definitely will stay there again when I am in the New Orleans area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: goehringw
Reviews.Content: I read TripAdvisor prior to most trips and have stayed in their top-rated hotels in many cities. The reviews are generally very reliable. The high rating for this hotel is a mystery to me. Like everyone says, this hotel is on the edge of the French Quarter. We had a king room. It was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. The furnishings were in good condition in a Queen Anne style. The bathroom was in good condition but extremely small. I bumped my chin on the sink when I sat down on the facing toilet. The lobby (the front desk, a couch and a valet podium) is separated from the breakfast area by a driveway. The arrangement reminds me of the service department at an auto dealership. The major problem we had with the hotel is the lack of soundproofing in the rooms and an inability to get any sleep. The noise is not comming from Bourbon Street. It is coming from within the hotel itself. You hear everyone coming and going, doors being closed or slammed and toilets flushing all around you. Our next door neighbors sounded just like Meg Ryan in the restaurant scene from When Harry Met Sally. I will definitely look elsewhere when travelling to New Orleans. This place was a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NOLALush
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans started on July 16, 2008 and lasted through July 22nd and our stay was incredible. The staff was wonderfully pleasant, especially the front desk manager, Ann, and the valet parking gentlemen were just as nice. The room was spotless and roomy and had a wonderful view of the streets below. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an enjoyable stay with comfort being key. The hotel is within walking distance to all of the sightseeing but far enough away to not hear all of the noise. This will be the ONLY hotel I will stay at in New Orleans and they will see my husband and I again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: KarenOK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prince Conti on June 17-20th. Prior to arriving, my husband contacted the hotel and told them we were celebrating our 20th anniversary and also his safe return home from Iraq. He asked if the hotel could provide something special upon our arrival or an upgrade. When we arrived at the hotel, they had upgraded our deluxe room (military rate) to a large suite with a king sized bed. They also sent up complimentary champagne to celebrate our special ocassion. This was definitely a nice touch and a great way to start our vacation time together. The hotel is located 1/2 block off of Bourbon St. We did not rent a car, but was within walking distance to Jackson's Square, riverwalk area, and many popular attractions. Considering the location of this hotel and it's location to Bourbon St., there was virtually no noise at all and we always had a comfortable night's rest each night. Just a few suggestions to do while in NOLA: We visited the WWII musuem and was highly impressed with the establishment. A musuem that had a lot of artifacts and actual veterans there to visit with you about their own personal experiences. If you like Italian food, then you must try Tony Moran's on Bourbon St. We ate there the first night and it was the best Italian food we have ever eaten. The atmosphere and the staff was top notch. The Prince Conti did not disappoint. In fact, they went above and beyond to meet our needs. The staff was always helpful and friendly. Thanks Prince Conti employees for making this a vacation that my husband and I will always cherish. The only hotel for us in NOLA is the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NewsWriter07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and walking distance to everything in the French Quarter. It's very close to Bourbon Street but far enough away that you can't hear the noise at night when you're going to sleep. It's also walking distance to Cafe Du Monde, the French Market and Canal Street. The outside of the place is well lit and the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “great overall”
Reviews.Author: adamhadem
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Prince Conti from June 20-24. If you read enough of these reviews you get a good sense of the highs and lows of a particular property. In perusing the reviews I noticed that some people had nice rooms and others complained of worn furniture and carpeting. I called the hotel and was advised that rooms are renoved a few at a time. I requested a renovated room and they replied that they would see what they could do. Upon check in we were upgraded to a beautiful mini suite!!! This was really nice of the hotel management and made our trip that much more enjoyable and memorable. There were also numerous complaints about the free continental breakfeast in the reviews. Having experienced the free continental breakfast first hand I can tell you that there is juice (including fresh squeezed orange juice), coffee, fresh crouisants, assorted fresh danish and assorted fruit, which is exactly what one would expect at a free continental breakfast. everything was fresh, delicious and, did I mention FREE. I dont see what all of the complaing was about. The location is wonderful. The loudest bar on Bourbon Street is the Famous Door, which is about fifty feet away from the hotel, yet you cannot hear a sound from your room. We did not have a car and never felt we needed one. The entire french quarter is within easy walking distance. We walked to the St. Charles Street car and rode all through the garden district. We walked back from Comanders Palace, which was real nice until we left the garden district, then things got a little shady, but we made it back in one piece. We took the ferry to algiers and went to mardi gras world, which was a bit pricey and kind of a tourist trap, but highly recomended none-the-less. We did a cemetary tour with haunted tours which was great. I did not pack any long pants as New Orleans is kind of like a festering tropical hell hole in the summer. As such, I could not eat at the Bombay Club, Commander's Palace, Antione's, Gallatiore's or any of the other really fancy places. However, we did not have a single bad meal the entire time we were there. We ate lunch at Monty's, the Napolean House (twice) and Felix's. We had Dinner at NOLA, Mr. B's, Muriels and we got takeout from the German bistro accross the street from the hotel. Every single one of these places I highly recomend. The food was my favorite thing about New Orleans. The only thing we did not like about our hotel was the view, however, we spent little time in the room. Ms. B's bistro is only open for the free continental breakfast. It would have been nice to have a casual bistro in the hotel. But otherwise the Prince Conti Hotel is a tremendous value and a nice hotel in a great location. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti excellent”
Reviews.Author: Belsornia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (surprisingly quiet despite proximity to Bourbon Street), beautiful room, everything in good condition, plentiful complimentary continental breakfast, all staff very friendly and helpful. Overall our stay was wonderful (great value too).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near the action!”
Reviews.Author: aliciajoann
Reviews.Content: Since we got a room at this hotel for a very reasonable rate, I didn't expect much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is quaint and has an antique charm. The details on the doors, big brass keys, and croissant breakfast made this hotel a nice place to stay. We ate at the adjoining restaurant, The Bombay Club and sat in a cozy booth while a gentleman played the piano under a blue light. They are famous for their many varieties of martinis. It was great! The hotel is half a block from Bourbon Street (the busy part), and has valet parking. Our room didn't have a view (you pay extra for those rooms), but we weren't in it enough to even notice. I highly recommend this hotel! I will definitely stay at this hotel next time I go to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: westminsterboy
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at the Prince Conti Hotel. The hotel was in a great location, only about 1/2 block off Bourbon but miles away from any noise. The room, which was on the third floor, was clean and in a very quiet part of the hotel. The lobby had the USA Today and the local paper every morning along with many tourist brochures, which I found to be helpful. Breakfast was across from the lobby and featured croissant, pastries, orange juice, coffee, tea, apples and oranges which was enough to fill you up to begin your day. The front desk was very helpful in calling taxis and as I arrived at the hotel a little early, they asked the maid service to clean my room as soon as possible and then called me when my room was ready. And if it got too hot, they said I may use one of the pools at their sister hotels Place D'Arms or Hotel St Marie. Walking to anywhere in the French Quarter and surrounding areas was easy. It was nice to see more progress in and around the French Quarter and Canal Street. More new hotels and more new businesses and it was even busier than previous visits. Airboat Adventures was a great time and strongly recommended. The guides know their stuff and are on first names basis with the alligators, which can venture up on to the boats, but you will not be harmed. The Natchez Steamboat is lazy fun going down the river with a drink in hand. You cannot get better food than Commander's Palace, that was the best meal I have ever eaten. Court of the Two Sisters Brunch, Brennans and The Gumbo Shop are also top notch. They are still working on the French Market but it is looking good with more vendors. New Orleans is coming back and I am glad to help in this venture.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a French Quarter stay!”
Reviews.Author: KCL57
Reviews.Content: Booked "run of the house" on Travelocity to add a spur of the moment additional night onto my daughter's 21st birthday trip ( wanted her to wake up in NOLA on her birthday! ) What a treat. First, free valet parking couldn't be beat, included with the Travelocity booking. Check in was easy, and adding an additional guest to our room was fast & no hassle! There was 1 elevator to the upper levels. The "real" keys were great, easy to slip into a pocket. And our room, WOW. When I booked "run of the house" I didn't expect much. I even called 3 days before our trip & confirmed that the hotel had our reservation. I had to run out to the car, and my daughter & her friend went up to the room before I did. I opened the door, and again, WOW. Room 251 faces Conti St. We had a 2 room suite, the "living room" had a sofa bed with 2 end tables, 2 large chairs, coffee table and armoire with a TV. The bathroom, attached to the living room, was nice, with the vanity area separate from the tub & toilet. The room had pocket doors between the living area & bedroom, which had 2 very comfortable beds with nightstands, desk with a chair, 2 more large chairs, another armoire with another TV and a small table holding the coffee maker. We had an exposed brick fireplace, and 5, count them, 5 huge windows! The rooms had tall ceilings with ceiling fans, and plenty of lamps. The room was very quiet, with the most street noise coming from car stereos on the street, and also from an ambulance driver trying to get traffice to move out of the way. The view was of Broussard's, and 2 large palm trees. The windows had great drapes, altho access to the drape pulls was a little challenging at some of the windows, had to move the chairs to get to them. There were no closet doors. The room had 1 luggage rack, and an iron and ironing board. There were extra pillows and blanket for the sofa bed, and plenty of towels, and nice toiletries. The room was very clean. There was an ice machine down the hall, and a soda and snack machine. Breakfast was a pretty good continental breakfast, coffee, tea, orange juice, croissants, pastries, fruit, with jams and jellies at each table. We got a coupon on check-in for a free appetizer or bottle of wine with dinner at the in-house restaurant. The bistro advertised 42 ( I think) martinis!! The server at breakfast was the person who told us about being able to use the pool at the Conti "sister" hotel further into the Quarter, information that I guess should have come from the front desk, but as we were only staying 1 night wasn't really an issue for us. We didn't use the internet at all. The valet parking staff was very polite, and very quick getting our car. The location couldn't be beat, making a late night on Bourbon Street an easy option. The hotel is right down the street from the Vieux Carre police station. Great place, will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Try it. You'll like it”
Reviews.Author: JimmyOlson
Reviews.Content: We had a little bit of apprehension, but everything turned out great. The room was a bit small, with a bed, closet, and TV, but what else do you need in New Orleans. The mattress was excellent. The room was clean. The bathroom was large and very nice. There was some street noise on Saturday night but, hey, it's Bourbon Street. You can't complain about that. The Staff was nice. The location was excellent.. Great continental breakfast. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extras for the right price!”
Reviews.Author: Patcee
Reviews.Content: We reserved one of their suites well in advance because it appeared to offer a lot for a very reasonable rate, and we weren't disappointed. Room 104 on the ground floor is across the carriageway from the main part of the hotel and is way in the back of the property, very quiet and secluded. The suite was huge (more like an apartment, actually), with a separate bedroom, nice-sized bathroom down the hall, a full kitchen (although not equipped, it had a full-sized functioning refrigerator and an up-to-date microwave), and an entertaining/living area, which included a massive board room table complete with 10 leather swivel chairs! And both the living area and the bedroom had french doors opening out into your own small, private courtyard surrounded by a high brick wall. The only real drawback was that there was very little natural light in the suite, as the only "windows" were the smallish french doors opening onto the courtyard. The kitchen and board room area had no windows or natural light at all. As a result, the entire suite was rather dark and dim. But having such a huge space (maybe around 1200 sq ft), good and free wireless internet, refrigerator, microwave, private courtyard, light continental breakfast, and good and efficient service, in our opinion, more than made up for the lack of light. As many others have said, the condition of the room and hotel were excellent and the front desk staff were very helpful and well informed. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and accommodating. The parking attendants were also very efficient, especially given the very small in and out carriageway drive through. It was a great experience for our wonderful stay in New Orleans. Thank you everyone at Prince Conti!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: 1GreatArmyWife
Reviews.Content: Living in Louisiana, I've been to NO several times. Up until THIS visit I usually stayed at the Hilton, a great place. This time the folks I traveled with wanted to stay a little closer to 'the action' so I booked a room at the PC. Located on Conti St, the hotel parking garage was VERY narrow and diffucult to navigate...my fault for having an Explorer I guess. Next we had to deal with Anne, the front desk clerk.
