A rude, difficult woman who became aggitated and surley when we apparently asked too many questions like, "what's a good ghost tour?" and "who makes the best mufalettas?" Yes, the front desk person is ALSO the concierge, kind of low rent I thought. After a few more questions she finally snapped, "I don't know everything about New Orleans, there are brochures over there" and tossed our room key at us. She never mentioned the free breakfast and we were never given the coupons that you're supposed to get at checkin...we found out about this the next day from another desk clerk. The room as OK, clean, but very small. It was also very near to Bourbon St and the area was safe for walking even late at nite. For those reasons I MIGHT go back, but I pretty sure I can get the same the same things WITH good service at another place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jbaker6178
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, we were one block from Bourbon St. and there is easy access from the freeway. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We brought our two small children with us as we were passing through on our way to Florida and wanted to spend two days in New Orleans. Hotel was very clean for an old building and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful group accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Mibster
Reviews.Content: A group of 30+ stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel for Memorial Day weekend to celebrate a class reunion. The hotel's location is outstanding, and the staff are very friendly and helpful, even with special requests. They give you an actual key too, which is a nice change from a key card, and easier to find in your pocket or bag. I wandered into other friends' rooms, and while they vary in layout and view, all are very comfortable and clean. The cleaning staff didn't notice that I'd flipped my "Privacy Please" sign to "Maid Service Please," so you might want to call the front if you've had a hang tag on your door. Even so, they left me a handy bag of fresh towels and supplies. Be advised that one person was given conflicting information when requesting a cot. It seems they are deemed a fire hazard, so if you really need one, call well in advance for arrangements. And though they have WiFi for a charge, don't expect all the big-chain-hotel amenities - this is an old-fashioned hotel, which is part of its charm. I had a 2nd story view of the street and saw a parade of people complete with masks, musicians and beads party their way into Broussard's across the street! It was a true NOLA experience. The Bombay Club downstairs hosted our Saturday night event, and it could not have been more lovely. The food, the service, & the entertainment were excellent. And at $50 a head, quite reasonable too. When there isn't a big group or a jazz ensemble tearing it up in there, it's a nice cool quiet place for a yummy cocktail and conversation. The $99 group rate made it well worth the trip. Even without a group, I'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A European Style hotel in New Orleans...awesome!”
Reviews.Author: traveler32pitt
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel is a great hotel! First, the location is awesome! It's only 1 block from Bourbon Street. The staff is also very accomodating. During my trip, I need help with taxis and the staff gladly called me a cab every time. In addition, the staff gave me directions and suggestion to and from great restuarants in the city. The rooms are very nice and clean. What I like most about the hotel though, is its European style. It's classy and beautiful in a tight space. I will definitely staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: BigWoof
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Prince Conti after combining the stellar reviews and the reasonable price. We requested a quiet room in the back and sure got what we asked for. They gave us room 248, which was in effect a mini-suite, with one part consisting of a room with desk, couch, TV, and 3 other tables, there were 2 small closets, and toward the back, a very large area with king size bed, tables and lamps, and a large chair. All the furnishings were attractive, and in the antique style. Although the hotel is 2/3 block from Bourbon St. there is absolutely no noise from that direction. The only noise we heard was on the weekend from the hotel's nightclub, directly below our room, and that was well-muffled jazz, very pleasant, and ended about 12:30. The continental breakfast was very satisfactory - fresh juices, croissants and pastries, coffee and tea, and fruit - don't know what those who have complained about it expect from a free continental breakfast. All the staff were always pleasant and accomodating, and yes the housekeeping staff was extremely friendly and efficient. Our stay helped contribute to a very pleasant week. We got a complete confirmation upon reserving, a reminder about a week before arrival, and a thanks after our stay, indicating that the management has the guests in mind and cares about their stay and their opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with French Quarter Charm”
Reviews.Author: tstrayer76
Reviews.Content: We booked a large suite for me to prepare for our wedding, which was across the street, and for us to spend the night in after the wedding. The room was HUGE with its own courtyard. Of course, the building is old, but considering that, it was very nice. Plenty of room to get ready and hang out before and after the event. It had a full sized kitchen (the odd thing was there were no plates, cups, silverware, etc., even though there was a dishwasher). The room included a large boardroom sized table with chairs, a living area with a couch and a few chairs with TV and built-in shelves with many books. The living area and the bedroom both overlooked a small but beautiful courtyard. You could enter it though the living area and it had a small table with chairs. The staff was friendly and attentive when we needed something. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Jazz fest”
Reviews.Author: RubyLynda
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Prince Conti several times in the past after taking advantage of a low rate teaser I found at the Rest Stop on the InterState years ago. I was so pleased with the location, amenities and friendly staaf, that I don't even bother to look for other hotels in New Oreleans. This time I was able to book a room during Jazz Fest and not feel ripped off by price spikes for a very popular weekend. My friends and I are ready to book again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Conti!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBanker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our mid-20s) booked our stay at the Prince Conti Hotel well in advance and were given a GREAT rate through the website for pre-paying for our stay. Including tax, for three nights we only spent $315, and part of our stay was over the weekend! We stayed in a King Suite (#366) that was very roomy. We had a nice view of the city skyline from our windows. My only complaints regarding the room itself, are the lack of counter space in the bathroom and the internal noise (voices of people in the hallway coming right thru our door). These were both very minor in the whole scheme of things. The real keys (as opposed to the cards you swipe) are a very nice touch. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. There are lots of brochures available in the lobby as well as a laptop computer that can be used to print your boarding passes if you are leaving by plane. Although the location is only 1/2 block north of Bourbon St., it was VERY quiet at night. We never would have been able to tell we were that close to the nightlife! **Just an extra tip: Deja Vu restaurant is located on Conti St, across the street from the hotel. They have some fantastic Po Boys! My husband and I actually ate there twice in one day and it was very affordable. They're open 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “A French Quarter GEM!”
Reviews.Author: KKemp
Reviews.Content: The best accommodation at the best price in the ideal location in the French Quarter that I could find for 3 girlfriends traveling together on a budget. Prepared for "adequate", I was delighted with the roomy and comfortable suite which was way beyond my expectation. In my experience, the hotel's staff are it's best asset. They are informed, friendly and professional. It was the ideal spot for first-time visitors to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for me!”
Reviews.Author: redheadedwoman
Reviews.Content: I read about the Prince Conti in a guidebook, and thought it sounded too good to be true. Not so! If what you are looking for is a small hotel with a great location and incredible prices, the Prince Conti is perfect. Mine was a midweek stay, and I arrived very early in the day. I had intended just to check my suitcase with the front desk, but since my room hadn't been stayed in the night before, the Conti checked me in at 11am! The suite I stayed in was huge, and in perfect shape. I didn't have any noise issues, but as I said, I was there midweek. Amy, at the front desk, is wonderful. She is so personable, and was able to answer all my questions. She could just as easily be a concierge at one of the luxury hotels. I'll be looking forward to my next trip to NO, and my next stay at the Conti!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice price and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lov-Trav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Prince Conti Hotel April 29, 2008 itâ€™s a fantastic place half a block from Bourbon Street. Big rooms 12-foot ceilings, Kings Size bed, clean tile restrooms. I'd recommend this Hotel to anyone that really wants to get a feel for the French Quarter. I would stay here again this was truly amazing value for the money. For the free no hassle valet parking was fast & efficient. There is no such thing as free parking in the Quarters; Hotel charges $28.00 a night to park in a secure area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 256Eve
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, in the center of the French Quarter. Staff is very helpful and courteous. Room was clean and spacious. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: lricci4903
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend in New Orleans and stayed at The Prince Conti again. We were in NOLA over Halloween and found this gem, so it will be the only place we will stay from now on! The staff is always engaging and helpful, the rooms are spotless and roomy and the location can't be beat. The easter baskets Ann placed in our room were a great touch and we look forward to returning again soon! We feel like we are family there and higly recommend it to anyone and everyone we can!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED Prince Conti Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larrydunn
Reviews.Content: I had never been to New Orleans and my friends had been talking about taking me for about a year. They are frequent visitors, they booked the hotel and told me I would love it. It amazed me how close it was to Bourbon Street and how friendly the staff was. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. Housekeeping works very hard and does a fantastic job. The staff made me feel very welcome. I've worked for a hotel before and this one had the service part down. I plan on visiting Prince Conti Hotel again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: RompinRon
Reviews.Content: After seeing rooms shown on the internet and reading reviews we chose Prince Conti. It was awesome! we've never been to NO before, and wanted to stay in the quarter. Conti is right in the heart, but very quiet. Our room was very large and a pleasant surprise.This was truly amazing value for the money. The no hassle valet parking was fast & efficient. Our only disappointment was that the breakfast bistro very poor selection of breakfast items(sticky buns) & no orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: katamie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 7 nights in February. This was my third trip to NOLA and although this probably was the best location, it was not the best hotel. The price was good especially when they gave a Triple A discount (CAA for us Canadians). It is just one block down from Bourbon Street - close to the action but not right on top of it - and walking to all parts of the French Quarter from the hotel was a breeze. The room itself was fine - nothing special but NOLA is not about staying in your room! The bathroom was tiny and had only one very small shelf to hold toiletry items which didn't work very well for 2 people. The hotel itself was clean but housekeeping seemed to have trouble getting things right - one day our room was not cleaned until after 4:00 when we had left at 9:00 in the morning. They also forgot to empty the coffee grounds from the coffee maker and leave fresh coffee, and we had to ask for more soap and shampoo. We also requested additional pillows from one of the housekeepers in the hall; she never did return. We asked again the next day and were told that they didn't have any extras. One of the best things about the hotel was the French Quarter Deli that we discovered just a few doors down the street. They had excellent food, and their takeout menu said they were open until 4:00 a.m. most nights and they would deliver to local hotels. We didn't try out the delivery service but we did get takeout a couple of times and it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JetSetGirl6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to New Orleans for our first wedding anniversary. Several friends went went us, but we were the only ones from our group to stay at Prince Conti. We lucked out! Compared to their hotel, Prince Conti was a dream come true. Although our room did not have elevator access, we had the entire third floor all to our selves. Due to it's location, the hotel has the convenience of Bourbon Street - it's less than a block away from the entrance - but does not get any of the noise. We slept like babies each night. The room was spacious, clean, huge bathroom, plenty of hot water and the decor made us feel like we were in New Orleans. The hotel does offer a free breakfast, but we never made it! It's about a twenty minute, $30 cab ride to/from the airport for two people. Right off Bourbon Street, Prince Conti is close to pretty much everything, and about a 10 minute walk to the water front. I'm not quite sure how this hotel would be for children/families. We didn't see any coming or going, but New Orleans/Bourbon Street isn't necessarily a family vacation kind of ciity! Our friends were jealous when they saw the size of our room compared to their little shoeboxes and Prince Conti has already made the list for next year's trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ramp builder
Reviews.Content: Good deal in New Orleans. ($89/night on the weekend). A block off Bourbon Street so convenient yet not noisy. The room was fine - very similar to photo on web site. Roomy enough, clean, up-to-date-bath and a great king sized bed. Desk clerks were helpful with recommendatiuons for food. Breakfast OK - just coffee, juice and so-so rolls. How about a pitcher of water.

Reviews.Title: “Best find in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Kmagg
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff was very friendly and made excellent recommendations for places to go and eat. I would recommend two things - 1. Ask for a room not on Conti street. It is quite loud in the rooms facing Conti. Also, the bathroom windows cover the entire bathroom and are not covered by anything other than a sheer. During the day, it's no problem; nightime is a different story. The rooms not facing Conti don't have this problem. The staff was very accomodating when we asked to move to one of the back rooms. 2. Book in advance - we were able to save a lot by doing this. This will be the place we stay when we go to the Quarter which is at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms only Surpassed By Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Oshea33
Reviews.Content: Background: My wife and visit New Orleans 1-2 times/year. We enjoy staying at different hotels and getting different perspectives of the city we love so much. But it looks like our "hotel-hopping days" are over now that we have stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel. Research: Before each trip I do an exhaustive search for the perfect hotel stay. This year, after much review of online websites such asTripAdvisor, we decided to stay at the Prince Conti. People: Over the stay we intereacted with various housekeeping staff, receptionists and even the manager, all of which were pleasant and helpful. The manager went out of his way to ensure that our vacation was a special one. To get a fresh perspecitve one day a man was checking out and I asked him what he thought of the hotel. He stated that he loves the hotel and that this is the only hotel he stays at, and he's here on business a couple days each week. The manager is keen on repeat business and obviously knows the way to have people coming back time and time again. Location: The location of the Prince Conti is truly fantastic. It's less than a block from Bourbon St. and walking distance to absolutely everything in the quarter. Accomodations: We found our room to be very clean and comfortable. The only thing I have to warn you about is that the hotel does not have hundreds of rooms like the big hotel chains (Sheraton, Hilton, etc..) so book early or you might miss out on this New Orleans hidden gem. Also, I would recommend that you treat yourself and get one of the bigger rooms. They are a bit more expensive, but still quite affordable in comparison to other hotels in the quarter or downtown. AAA discount should save you a few $$$. The Big Question: As for staying at the hotel again... the answer is YES.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: elh
Reviews.Content: Incredible location. Just north half a block of Bourbon street, so close enough to the action, but not so close you hear the partying into the night. Besides most people head south of Bourbon street so unless people are lost, the north side of Bourbon street is pretty calm. Front desk staff varied from being incredibly helpful, giving us great restaurant recommendations to seeming put out with simple requests. The hallways and rooms could afford to be updated. Fortunately, the bathrooms are brand new. Continental breakfast (so-so) is included while their restaurant in under reconstruction.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely refuge amidst the chaos of Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: baconordeath
Reviews.Content: What a gem the Prince Conti turned out to be! My wife and I had originally planned a little romantic getaway, but in the end decided against leaving our toddler with her grandparents and brought her along. So glad we did. The hotel gave us a room that I guess you might call a "studio suite" -- long hallway with a big bathroom, then a nice little sitting area, then a large alcove with a king bed. Everything was tidy and comfortable, and considering the jet engine volume at the corner of Conti and Bourbon just yards away, the room was almost tomb-like in its silence. We'll stay there again without hesitation. Nice staff and convenient to pretty much everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: mimawirght
Reviews.Content: It's all about price and location--The Conti is, just barely, a 3-star hotel but at 2-star prices in the very expensive French Quarter. The rooms are a bit worn but nicely appointed, a decent size for 1-2 people, and very clean. WiFi is free, although I had trouble maintaining a connection on the 3rd floor. When I complained, I was surprised to have Dean, the tech guy, stop by my room later that day, check for a signal, discover it was weak, answer all of my questions and then arrange for me to switch my room to get a stronger signal ( I ended up finding a sweet spot in my own room so I didn't move). The hair dryer in the room was also broken and they again replaced it with a brand new one within a few hours of me reporting it. Right in the heart of the French Quarter, near everything, there is a bar/restaurant attached. the staff is very friendly--I watched them handle my disorganized group with great grace and intelligence while dealing with polite yet tipsy guests (who, amazingly, never made noise in the evening)! Great value, highly recommended when you need a clean, nice place for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Nurse86
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to New Orleans we decided to stay at the Prince Conti Hotel...which was a mistake!! When we arrived at the hotel we were told that our room was not ready. The girl at the front desk took our cell phone number and said that she would call us when the room was ready. Well, needless to say she never called. We ended up walking around the city for 5 hours!! When we finally got to our room it was musky smelling and had no windows. Our toilet would not flush and when we notified the front desk they promply sent up the valet driver with a plunger!! Who told us we had to unclog the toilet our selves!! We had requested a queen or king bed when making reservations and ended up with two doubles, we were told that would have to do. We love New Orleans but do not recommend this hotel. We travel quite a bit and have never had an issue with any other hotel. The hotel manager was very unfriendly and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff, will stay at Prince Conti again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Absense1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely the best in New Orleans' French Quarter. Literally a 30 second walk to Bourbon Street but on a side street which is perfectly quiet for when you finally decide to put down the drinks and go to sleep. Hotel is clean and offers 2 ammenities which are rare in this day and age. 1. A Free continental breakfast which is a nice start to the morning after a late night. Fresh Fruit, pastries and coffee and juice. and 2. Free wireless internet in your room. Prefect for searching hotels, checking email etc... The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are a decent size, bed is comfortable and full cable television channel lineup.....Tv is small but you are in new orleans to see the sights, hear the music and of course eat the food, not watch TV! I seriously couldn't have been happier with my stay with my fiancee. Nothing too flashy, cute boutique hotel. Great price. I stayed there on NBA All-star weekend and it was affordable and convenient to all New Orleans has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: swor21054
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 4 nights just after Mardi Gras. Location was very close to Bourbon St., but surprisingly quiet. Our window looked out on an interior light well, which might have helped us avoid the noise from Bourbon. Everyone on staff that we encountered was very pleasant. The room was smallish, and the bathroom small but adequate. The room was very clean. All the rooms are non-smoking. Bed was very comfortable, and there were extra pillows (something I always appreciate.) Keys are old-fashioned brass keys instead of keycards. The rates were excellent. There was a free continental breakfast each morning. It was limited to fruit, some pastries, OJ, tea, and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Very Little”
Reviews.Author: Doolie1
Reviews.Content: I travel around 40-55 days per year and usually only stay at major chains( Marriott etc..). After reading the reviews for this hotel I decided to give it a go since the prices (I stayed jan 23-25) where only 69$USD pls tax. I was actually a bit worried because in New Orleans you usually get about 1/2 what you pay for, since prices are quite high especially in the French Quarter. I was VERY pleasantly surprised. Although not a 5 star type room, it was NICE, clean, quiet, had charm that chain hotels cant provide. Staff are helpful and friendly. Free Continental breakfast(simple but fine) was the renovate a restaurant. The rates climb a bit(changed to about 120$) for events like mardi gra(but thats still a good deal). I moved from this hotel(no rooms availible at Conti) on the 25 to Hotel Sonesta which costs over 200$, and although a better lobby, an inferior room and service at 3 times the price.. And a word of warning, do NOT stay at the holiday INN french quarter(ugly, crowded, 20 minute elevator waits, 1 hour check out, TERRIBLE rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JuliePS
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel on Trip Advisor and everything that was written was correct. We stayed on the 2nd floor and the room was charming and we paid $100 per night including tax. A real bargain. The location is superb. Prince Conti is a block south of Bourbon Street in a quiet neighborhood. We were very concerned the hotels near Bourbon Street were noisy. Once we entered the hotel, there was no external noise. I highly recommend this hotel and New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Noplacelikehome_8
Reviews.Content: I was simply looking for a budget sensitive hotel for a one night stay in New Orleans. Since I was traveling without my wife, it was just a place to crash. What I got, far exceeded my expectations. The Prince Conti Hotel is a small hotel one block off of Bourbon Street in New Orleans. One of the great things about it is that it is a block to the north side of Bourbon. Most of the tourist traffic goes to the south or back toward the Mississippi River. It is very close to the "action" but maintains a seclusive quality. The rooms that I saw were all different in shape and size, but the furnishings were consistant. The rooms are clean and well supplied. The bathrooms were equally good. Overall the rooms had a look of "just completed renovation". Attached to the hotel is bar and restaurant that had the same quite comfort of the hotel. The bar boasts "over 125 martinis". The property staff was friendly and accommodating. I am a long time Marriott, and Hilton customer, and with (no knock on them) this is now my hotel of choice in New Orleans. It is much like staying in the Hotel Monteleone , but is much smaller. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Average amenities akin to 2-star hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: We chose the Prince Conti (pronounced Con-Tie, not Con-tee) based on TripAdvisor ratings and reviews, and of course the price and location. Sadly, the price was right on the money and not much of a bargain considering the actual rooms and amenities. That's not to say we disliked the Prince Conti - it was wasn't anything special or remarkable. The rooms were relatively clean and the bathrooms updated, but the 17" TV from 1982, the tiny room size, the old mattresses, and the bland decor (plainer than the online pictures) left us shrugging our shoulders and thankful we didn't spend more. That all said, the location is perfect - JUST far enough from Bourbon to avoid the noise, but close enough to stumble home before passing out. High-speed internet is free, as was a very humble continental breakfast of juice, coffee, and store bought croissants. If this all sounds good to you, and you can score a crazy price like we did, go for it. If there is anything in the price range that looks better, I'd consider shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti; Great Place to Stay in NO”
Reviews.Author: DiverChaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Thanksgiving. After reviewing this hotel on this website, we booked directly with them. Very courtous staff. Room was huge and clean. We had our own walled-in private outdoor patio. (Room #124). Drawback was no smoking in the room. Very quite dispite the close proximity to Bourbon street. We've stayed in the Quarter over 12 times in the last several years; each at a different hotel/B&B. We will always return here. Prince Conti was the best with the best value for your $$$

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wtracing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti from Jan 8-11 2008. We got a Deluxe Double Queen room at a rate of $58/night. Here is a quick run-down overall of the pros and cons: PROS: Cheap rate during the off season and only half a block from Bourbon Street makes for a good location (Although their sister hotel Place D'Armes is closer to Jackson Square if you plan to frequent there) Hotel staff was very friendly except for one particular woman. They also have a printer to print boarding passes in the lobby (only to print passes, the one unfriendly woman berated me while trying to print my passes) but overall they gave me the room I requested on the 2nd floor. The room was always kept very clean and tidy and the bathroom was nice w/ marble floors and counters. CONS: The free breakfast was a bit of a joke, most mornings it was just croissants with orange juice and coffee; but it was free, so not going to complain so much. (Renovating their kitchen currently so offering free continental breakfast to their guests, not sure how much longer this will last) Try to get a room in the back of the hotel farthest away from Bourbon. There is a bar right on the corner 2-3 buildings down that you can hear very well if your room faces Conti Street. The Deluxe Queen Room we got was not nearly as charming as the photo they show online; no brick wall, no antiques, etc. It was a plain hotel room, no doubt about it. You might request a room with brick wall and antiques if going, as this was one reason I found the hotel charming, but overall did not impact my stay. I really enjoyed our trip overall at the Prince Conti. Its position allowed us to safely walk around at all hours of the night without going anywhere dicey. The area is totally safe, as I thought the entire Quarter was. I was out till around 2am with no problems any night even on the quieter streets. ACME Oyster House, The Cigar Factory, The Absinthe House, and Desire Oyster House are all within just a minute or so of the hotel with Canal Street and the St. Charles Streetcar no more than a 3 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dtsbag
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti Hotel is a great location in the French Quarter of New Orleans. It is within a block of Bourbon Street. I was there just before Christmas and during the week. It was quiet but may be noisy on the week ends. You can walk to everything in the quarter. The service was excellent in the hotel. They upgraded us without a problem. The maid service was very accomadating of our requesting a late room clean. Our suite was very spacious and clean. The staff even took care of getting us a cab for the ride back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: GardenerCarlisle_PA
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend in New Orleans and stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff, and the location. We would definitely stay there again on a return trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: WillaRosen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights 11/18-20/2007 through an amazing deal on Priceline ($39/night). The hotel was in a great location and was able to accomodate our request for a king room. The room faced Conti Street and had very tall windows and ceilings and was very attractive in a European sort of way -- if you are looking for a soulless room at the Marriott, this may not be your place to stay. We could hear the late night partiers from Bourbon Street, which we found amusing, like having a balcony to the Jerry Springer show. The location was an easy walk to any location in the French Quarter and Downtown location and streetcars. We found the parking to be pricey, so we left our car at Harrah's Casino -- where parking is free if you gamble for 30 minutes. We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: sleepladypalmdesert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's birthday. Our plane was delayed so we got in very, very late. The staff was very gracious to us arriving so late. We walked to Cafe Du Monde and had delicious Beinets at 3am. They are opened 24 hours. Then we walked down Bourbon street and had a drink...just to say we did. The front desk was great and got us reservations at Commanders Palace for my husband's special birthday dinner which was memorable. Luckily, they wrote down the reservation information for us because Commanders lost our reservation but since we had the details written down they honored us anyway and treated us wonderfully. Everything was walking distance. We also ate at K Pauls and did a Swamp tour...all that the desk staff arrainged for us. The room was a little worn...but all in all it was great fun and we would stay here again. The location is just about 1/2 block off of Bourbon Street so it is fairly quiet. The breakfast in the hotel cafe was not that good...go to petunias down the street or eat Beinets until you can't walk. Or go down to where the French Market is and there is a wonderful bakery that is worth the walk. We gained a couple of pounds...but didn't care. Worth every calorie.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet hotel right by Bourbon St!”
Reviews.Author: JeffAstle
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated, a minute's walk from Bourbon Street but you can't hear the revelry at night. (You can hear the cleaning staff in the morning, but that seems to be the rule in U.S. hotels). Reasonably sized, well-equipped rooms, including a nice, clean bathroom. Friendly counter staff. Excellent value for money, even with the valet charge for cars.

Reviews.Title: “A year really does make a difference!”
Reviews.Author: onewiththefun
Reviews.Content: After last years wedding and our wonderful treatment within this hotel we decided we should return on our 1st anniversary this year. This hotel held a special place in our hearts and we absolutly loved it, the unique furniture, the closeness to bourbon and amazing staff all made it an easy choice. Unfortunatly though the experience was not as we hoped and our dreams of reliving our amazing wedding didn't work out as planned. While booking the hotel I was surprised that the prices had been lowered to $69.99 per night, which was a treat as last year we paid nearly double that for our special room, but that is were the positive surprises ended. Upon arriving at the hotel we checked in and all was good until we arrived at the room, all the unique furniture was gone, just hotel style furnishings filled the room, yuck. When we unpacked as we headed down stairs I asked the front desk about the furniture and was told it was just gone, quite rude actually, but never the less we weren't going to let that ruin our anniversary. The city itself was great, but just didn't seem quite the same, there seemed to be alot of rudeness among many store keepers and the people, almost like they didn't want us Canadian's down there. And the hotel was no different, except the night time parking guy, he was great and a friendly change to not so nice front desk staff. All in all the location is great and the price works well on a budget, but other than that its a hotel like so many others in the French Quarter. Why they did all the renovations and destroyed the character of this place I will never know, but my wife and I will be looking for other places to stay the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: xcntrytraveler2007
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute. Very pleased. Awesome location, secured parking and an interesting interior. Absolutely a place we will consider again the next time we are in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Conti - Excellence in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SleepyMike
Reviews.Content: Conti was great!!! The staff was fun and full of great places to send us in the French Quarter. We loved the room, it was clean and elegant with high ceilings and good ventilation. The bathrooms had recently been remodeled and looked great!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable in EVERY detail !!!”
Reviews.Author: zenlunatic
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived for my girlfriends 21st birthday, we were treated like royalty. Every time we went downstairs, we were greeted by every worker and asked if there was ANYTHING they could do for us. The valets were incredible giving us all kinds of great idea's of where to go and where to eat. Only a block off Bourbon street, I highly recommend this hotel and it's beautiful ambiance to ANYONE looking to enjoy their first trip (or hundredth trip) to New Orleans. Jonathan Risko III theinspiredzenlunatic@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Lets keep this place to ourselves!”
Reviews.Author: kacysox52
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here October 14-16, 2007. Everything about our stay was perfect! We had no problems at all. I booked our room on the hotels website and requested a room on the second floor. My request was granted and we had a beautiful room. I asked for the second floor based on other reviews but I am pretty sure that the entire hotel is remodeled and any floor would be just as good. I loved the old fashioned room keys, the wood paneled ceiling, and the huge bed. There was not much to look at out of our window. So if you are looking for a hotel with a view this is not the place for you. The location can't be beat. We were able to make numerous bathroom breaks between eating and drinking. The street was well lit and friendly. I can not wait to come to New Orleans again and stay at this hotel! My only fear is the hotel will be in such high demand the prices will rise! Lets keep this place a secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Realaloha
Reviews.Content: Great location; clean room; high ceilings. Pleasant and accommodating staff. Small efficient room decorated nicely. We had a room with a window but not much of a view. A lot of rooms are located on an interior corridor so ask for a window if natural light is important to you. Couldn't beat the Value Price on hotel website. Walls thin and could hear neighbors TV and people in hallway. Restaurant was being renovated so complimentary continental breakfast (coffee, croissants and pastries) was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: travelerIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed - in 2 separate reasonably priced rooms, both clean, comfortable and well appointed. On sight/off street parking with valet with made exploring the larger city so convenient. There was a one time charge for car retrieval no matter how many times we got the car out to use it. Great service. The hotel is one short block off Bourbon Street and within easy walking distance to everything in the French Quarter. We all gave the Prince Conti "thumbs up" and would definitely return sometime. Our only criticism was that the pillows need to be replaced as they were a bit old and flat. Overall a great place to stay while visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Almost wanna keep this place a secret!”
Reviews.Author: kdanielson2011
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem. The elevator (yes, just one) was very slow and that was annoying, but the price, hotel staff, clean rooms and perfect location (1/2 block from Bourbon Street) made up for that one thing. What a find! We are planning on making this hotel a part of my husband's yearly birthday weekend celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PensacolaRoadie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince Conti for one night, and wished I could stay for a few more. The hotel is located directly off of Bourbon Street, and has a wonderful 24 hour bar right across the street. The room was clean and ample sized for two people. The view out the window left something to be desired, but then again, I didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The hotel was very reasonable in price, though it doesn't include the 24 bucks for valet parking per day if you're driving there. The hotel also offered a bunch of services that I didn't need, like internet and business related stuff. If you need it, it's there for a nominal fee, but don't be a sucker and spend ALL your time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Hotel, New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: travelbug025
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Prince Conti. I had booked a room with 2 beds, however, upon our arrival my aunt and I requested a suite. The desk clerk was very helpful and accommodating. The suite was lovely and very clean. I would highly recommend this quaint hotel in a very nice location. All desk clerks were nice, and helpful. Our beds were made every day and the room cleaned. The sheets were even changed after the second day. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: greggeast
Reviews.Content: I booked our Prince Conti stay through Travelocity, using the Good Buy pre-pay deal. We were very satisfied with the quality of the hotel for the price we paid, especially considering the free valet parking. The ease of booking through Travelocity was a plus, as well. Although it was not needed, the Travelocity guarantee was also a reason I chose that website for booking. We arrived late evening, after driving through the rain bands of Tropical Storm Humberto. It was nice to be able to pull into their covered valet drop off. The valet quickly greeted us, took care of our luggage, and personally walked us to the front desk. We were quickly checked into our room and issued keys. Yes, old fashion keys; not the best way to handle room access, in my opinion. Our room was spacious, with 15-foot ceilings and two double beds. The beds were clean and well made, but the mattresses were definitely not premium and were aged, as might be expected in the French Quarter. The bathroom was small, but very clean with a pedestal sink and well placed shower nozzle. The TV had plenty of channels, but lacked the expected hotel entertainment menu system (which was no big deal considering our plans to eat and drink on our vacation). There was a desk and a wing-backed armchair, as well as a small table. The closet was adequate size for two to four travelers. There was a hair dryer and an iron with an ironing board. The hotel is located less than 1/2 block from Bourbon Street and about 3 blocks from Canal. There was no street noise in our second floor room, even though our window faced Bourbon Street. You could hear the people in the room above us walking around, but it was not much of a disturbance. We utilized the valet two times during our 3-night stay. Both times, the response was quick and courteous. Check out was as quick as check in, with no hidden charges or surprises. I suggest not paying for the telecommunications package, even if you need the internet, as their (or someone's) WiFi was unsecured and accessible to anyone. I would definitely recommend the Prince Conti hotel to other travelers, including singles, couples, and families. I am not sure about business travelers, as I didn't check out that portion of the hotel. We did not eat at the restaurants or drink at their bar. There are too many other great places that we have yet to try in New Orleans. Go visit the Big Easy; they need you!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treasure”
Reviews.Author: jeepgirl288
Reviews.Content: A real treasure, the Prince Conti Hotel located directly in the French Quarter far exceeded my expectations. With a truly friendly staff, my "economy" room located on the 3rd floor was very well kept, beautifully appointed, and to my great relief, exceedingly clean. Though there were no windows in this particular room, a high skylight offered ample sunlight during the day and provided enough privacy to leave open at night while listening to the bustling crowds on Bourbon Street. The replica period furnishings were a fantastic touch and even the bathroom had a vintage appeal. I also happened to glimpse the rooms located on the second floor--the floor I will book on my next visit. With their soaring ceilings and equally beautiful furnishings, these rooms seem to embody all the decadent grandeur that is New Orleans. For the experience I had, I would expect the nightly rate to be at least three times what I paid. The Prince Conti is a truly tasteful hotel where location is key, but thankfully not everything.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: HViddy
Reviews.Content: We requested a room on the 2nd floor (based on other reviews) and loved our room. It was French inspired and had a huge bathroom. I especially liked the high ceilings, exposed wall and ceiling fan. There was obviously some remodeling going on, on that floor-so I would suggest asking for that floor! It is literally only steps away from Bourbon street and is located in the heart of the action. However, as others have said-you are close enough for the action and for an emergency trip to the bathroom. The staff was very nice and even wished me a happy birthday on my birthday! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Needless to say-the Ritz it ain't-but it is a charming little gem of a hotel. Have fun in 'Nawlins!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: vanmer
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans, and I loved my room at the Prince Conti. The unseasonably cool weather and some rainy days didn't matter at all. The room was cozy and well-furnished with a beautiful antique bed. The hotel itself is well-maintained and thoughtfully staffed. I greatly appreciated the ever-present and knowledgeable personnel; the housekeeping; and the convenient location. I will, indeed, return.

Reviews.Title: “Good option...”
Reviews.Author: pearland1
Reviews.Content: This was a good experience. The hotel had a lot of that "New Orleans charm", but I'm not sure I'd stay here again. It was just a bit old and dark for my taste...but definitely had a New Orleans appeal. It was just a little old-smelling and honestly felt a bit haunted! :) The room sort of swayed when you stepped on a few spots, bc/ the foundation is aging (I guess?). Try to get a room away from the elevator too...you can hear it dinging every time it opens. It was in a fabulous location, and the service was awesome!! Overall, if I had to stay there again, I would...it's just not a favorite! I give it above average rating though.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: rhyan
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The regular rooms are cool, but if you have a chance to get a room in their back cottage (rooms 201 - 202) I recommend it. The staff was awesome are very helpful. I ended up locking myself out of my room so I had to get another key, and as busy as the front desk was at the moment, she quickly gave me another key without making me wait. They have a valet named Vann who was probably one of the coolest valets that I've met in my many travels to New Orleans. Compared to the prices of the other hotels in the same area as The Prince Conti, theirs was far more reasonable. The Conti was also very clean, which I can not say for the other hotels in the French Quarter, at least from what I've experienced since traveling there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mayberryrfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New Orleans at the last moment. This hotel was advertised in a tourist pamphlet along with a couple other French Quarter district for 69.00 per night. We got there at 4:00 pm and they actually had a room left at this rate!! We got a double bed, although they offered us a room with 2, but I left that room in case someone came in with a party larger than 2. They thanked me for being considerate of someone else. I loved the room!!!! It was a little small, but we were only going to be there for 1 night and only to sleep. It was decorated beautifully. Antique furnishings, including the tall, 4-poster bed. We were right around the corner from Bourbon St. The parking fee was high for me but average for the French Quarter, from what i understand. i was worth having a hotel we could walk to and from!! We would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & Charming”
Reviews.Author: rowlenthunder
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Prince Conti for a 3 night stay on April 1. Having visited the French Quarter before, it was such a pleasure to have on site valet parking. At $22 a day, the parking was a great deal. Check in was prompt, the lobby comfortable. Our room was on the second floor, and our key opened a door to a clean, comfortable room furnished with antique furniture including a gorgeous double bed with carved head and foot boards. There was a slightly cracked window pane, but so what? This is the most European of American cities, and one of the oldest neighborhoods. We were delighted! True, it was the special rate that got us here, but I'll stay again at the full rate next time. Mrs. D's Bistro served the most heavenly Eggs Benedict too. And when we walked out of the hotel, we were there, right in the French Quarter, 1/2 block from Bourbon St. Great Experience at the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location”
Reviews.Author: kbrian2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti for 4 days during Easter week. What a great location. The hotel is perfectly located in the French Quarter. Just a half block walk and you are on Bourbon Street. The hotel is very quiet. New Orleans is a fun city. If you go, I recommend eating at the Gumbo Shop. They have some amazing food. Just a reminder that the hotel does charge 22 dollars a day for parking. In addition, the hotel charges you when you use the phone. I didn't buy the communication package because I didnt bring a laptop. I had a phone card and I was charged for using it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location, good shower”
Reviews.Author: pixelhead
Reviews.Content: after trying the b&b's and a large canal st. hotel this place is where we will return to this year for jazz fest. bombay club bar is adjacent to hotel and is very mellow, non-bourbon st. bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: botgar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti last October into November. I found the front desk staff extremely helpful going out of their way to get us info and arrange tours, etc. We enjoyed breakfast in the little shop adjoining and also talking to the people who ran the restaurant. We found people there and in New Orleans extremely personable and very grateful to have tourists visiting. The hotel was in a good location for us. We were able to walk to most things we wanted to see yet never had a problem with noise at night. The rate we got was very good. When we go back to New Orleans, we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Baccibleu
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, however BEWARE the pictures they show on the internet do NOT represent all the rooms in this hotel. The pictures we were shown were of an elegant room that was very tastefully decorated and looked very nice. The room we were given looked NOTHING like the picture, the bathroom was so small you could hardly turn around in it with the door closed, and when we pulled back the curtains to look at the view we noticed very large black "mold" like spots all over the wall. The wallpaper was discolored and peeling off the walls as well. When we inquired why our room was not the one shown in the picture we were told that must be on the "renovated" floor which was the one below us. After we left the hotel, i recieved notification from my bank that the hotel had double-charged my card for the room, and ALSO charged me for parking for 2 vehicles for the week (we only had 1 car). After a couple of days of calling the hotel and explaining that i was double charged they refunded me a "partial" refund. So pls beware of this place.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Gem”
Reviews.Author: StevebPittsburg
Reviews.Content: Prince Conti, a great well maintained Historic Hotel 1/2 Block from Bourbon Street. Immaculate rooms. We have been coming to New Orleans for 30 years. Stayed all over the Quarter and have walked by this Hotel many times. We decided to stay this trip before we went on a 7 day cruise. From the moment we got to the hotel to the time we left the staff was very attentive to our needs and questions about the post Kartina New Orleans. Ann made all our dinner reservations. The Hotel staff and the feel of New Orleans made us very welcome to the City we have come to call a second home. Now Prince Conti will be our home away from home when we visit. One great moment on the Cruise Ship we sat down for our first dinner and I shared my views on the City after Kartina. I mentioned our hotel and the frantastic treatement and great value for the room. One of our table mates said he enjoyed hearing about that and he would pass it on, he is employed by the Valention Hotel chain Owners of the Prince Conti Hotel. Thanks Lenny Labrousse and everyone at the Prince Conti, its a small world. We will be back...........Steve Bitner

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: kimberleymb
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here. I booked for a convention and was very worried about how my colleagues would like the hotel since I had never been there in person before. My boss and my associates were very pleased with their rooms. Nicely furnished rooms and the bathroom tile and fixtures were all new and very clean. Some rooms are larger than others and extra-elegant, so you may want to ask about what's available. Prices are very good. Peter (front desk) was very helpful to us one night when we needed a restaurant reservation for 11 people and had only a few hours to find one. Another front desk employee sent my colleagues and I to a fantastic hamburger place (Yo Mama's across from Preservation Hall). It was the best hamburger I've had in a long time. I mistakenly short-booked one of my colleagues and the staff caught my mistake based on something they heard in passing. Management found another room for him in a hurry and moved him to a very large suite while charging us the same rate. Great hotel. We will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for French Quarter off season”
Reviews.Author: nola_girl76
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate here for a Friday and Saturday on priceline. This hotel is in a great location, just a block off Bourbon St. But miraculously it wasn't loud at all in my room, so it was really the best of both worlds. The hotel reminds me of the ones I stayed at in Europe, which I love, it has atmosphere and all the rooms are a little bit different and charming, not like a generic American Motel 6! An older looking elevator is just off to the side of the very small reception area. The room was very large and clean and had a big window. The shower and water pressure were great, and there were nice toiletries provided. One minor but weird little annoyance was that the TV (as is common in hotels) was encased in a stnad which had two doors. But the furniture wasn't designed too well because the doors didn't swing out far enough, so it was hard to get an unobstructed view of the TV! the furniture was nice though, and didn't seem cheap. At the front desk, they were very nice and let me check out an hour later with no problem. Overall my stay there was great and I'd recommend this place for those on a budget. Other hotels that are similar in class and price, and also good values in NOLA are the Queen & Crescent, Ambassador, and Baronne Plaza hotel. not the fanciest place in the world, but really nice for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Contii added to a great weekend”
Reviews.Author: buubys
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with 2 friends. We were made to feel welcome through our entire stay, from the moment we approached the building to the moment our cab arrived to take us to the airport. All of the employees we encountered were friendly and professional acting. All 3 of us had different room layouts (which added the the charm of the hotel) that you wouldn't get to enjoy in a franchised, cookie-cutter design, chain hotel. As far as the location goes, if you're in New Orleans to experience the French Quarter, this hotel is hard to beat. It's 1/2 block off of Bourbon Street, which gives you the advantage of a very short walk to the night life but just far enough away to give you some quiet. My friends and I are already talking about our next trip to the area and about staying in this hotel again. The Prince Conti and its staff were a big part of a very nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Pince of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhioEnjoy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place in N.O. Staff are all helpful, from opening doors to getting an extra boxof kleenex. Rooms are always clean and well taken care of. Ask anyone on staff, and you can get ditections torestaurants or a taxi to any destation. This was our second stay at the Conti and it will not be our last. Planning to stay there for Thanksgiving of 2007.

Reviews.Title: “What a Rare Gem!”
Reviews.Author: vtxriders
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online based on previous reviews but mostly for the price and location. The location is just 1/2 block off Bourbon street (close enough for the many trips to the bathroom during a night out on Bourbon) but quiet enough to seem a world away. The price was outstanding especially for the New Year's weekend with the Saints playing in town and the Super Bowl this week. The staff at the front desk and the cleaning service was quite friendly and check in was a breeze. However, they did manage to sell us on a $4.95/day telecommunications deal that I don't think was necessary. It was to include high speed internet and unlimited incoming and outgoing phone calls w/ voicemail. We have cellphones so our reason for taking it was for the internet. The internet was an unsecured wireless set up which means that we could have used it without paying the additional $5/day. I probably would have complained but the room price was so reasonable, I didn't feel like I was being robbed. We had booked a Deluxe Room w/ a queen bed. Upon arrival we found the room to be very clean, spacious and nicely furnished. The Bombay Club, located on site, provided a great location for dinner to avoid the heavy rains outside. They managed to work the two of us in for dinner even though we did not make previous reservations. There is also Ms. D's onsite which is a breakfast cafe. The hotel is older so the following, while not a trip breaker for us, may be problems for those who expect perfection. The bathroom was SMALL but it was very clean which is more of a concern for me than the size. The water pressure in the shower could have been better but it didn't keep us from getting clean. The wallpaper was coming loose in a couple of places and there was a dripping noise from time to time in the ceiling. But, it is an older hotel and not a reason to avoid staying here. We had previously stayed at the Hotel Monteleone, which is a fantastic hotel, but I would recommend the Prince Conti any day. The price, location and room size just can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: stonesman
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is less than 1/2 block from Bourbon Street but worlds away in feeling. I booked 2 suites online and was more than happy with my rooms. The hotel was clean with a helpful and honest staff. The front desk was in operation 24 hrs a day and Aimee was very helpful. She even let us put some leftovers in the fridge. The suites were clean and large, quite a value that left me surprised with the value they provided. Ms D's had a great breakfast and the onsite parking and valet service can't be beat. Yall should give the Big Easy a chance and you won't be disappointed--the french quarter is open for business it just needs more people to make it pop like the old days. As the old commercial said "Try it You'll Like it" Alan T & Family

Reviews.Title: “get star treatment at the Prince Conti hotel”
Reviews.Author: zbee
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from N.O. what a time I had. It was my first time there. The hotel was wonderful it's in a great location of the french quarter, 1 block off of Bourbon street.The hotel is very well kept and clean. The staff are very helpful,friendly and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel. The bistro across from the lobby is very convenient for breakfast or lunch. If you want a nice no hassel vacation stay at the Prince Conti hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: memboy
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the negative views, and they make me wonder if we are talking about the same Prince Conti hotel. My check in was smooth and friendly. My room was very roomy, clean and quiet, with attractive and comfortable furniture. The shower and the water pressure were very good. The location is super -- just a block from Bourbon Street and yet far enough away so that it is not noisy. My checkout was fast and easy, and the valet delivered my car to me within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, loud and bathroom full of bugs”
Reviews.Author: sddistel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a DISASTER. I booked this hotel after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor and because of the terrific location in the French Quarter. We looked at different rooms within the hotel before choosing one with actual windows. The rooms located in the interior of the hotel, have no windows and many of the rooms on the perimeter of the hotel face brick walls. We finally settled in room 334 which had windows looking over Conti Street (pronounced Con-Tie). The room was very small and besides a coffee maker and hair dryer, had no amenities. The bed was large but the bed spread was stained and the pillows flat. The bathroom had newer tile but the walls were cracked, moldy and, I'm not exaggerating, BUGS, lots of tiny bugs crawling in and out of the cracked walls, over the windows and the sink. My toiletry bags were covered in bugs after leaving them on the windowsill, they even crawled into my makeup, I had to zip them up and put them on top of the tv to avoid any more creepy crawlies. This was also the loudest hotel I have ever encountered. After arriving on a Friday morning, I tried to take an afternoon nap. However, the housekeeping staff was constantly in the halls, yelling to one another, slamming the storage closet doors and fighting over their personal lives. On Saturday morning, the housekeeping staff was cleaning the halls, the rooms, and again yelling up and down the hallways at 10 in the morning. And sure enough, on Sunday morning, at 9:00 a.m. they were yelling about which guest rooms were locked and who had the keys. The walls in the hotel are paper thin, so we heard every person in the hallway all weekend. And when someone with heavy footsteps walked by, the bed board actually vibrated. Dreadful! We ended staying at the hotel for 2 nights and 2 days because of the excellent location. Our favorite place in the French Quarter is the Bombay Club, which is located within the hotel, but is THANKFULLY not affiliated with the hotel itself. Since we began and ended each evening at the Bombay, the hotel was convenient. We also ate at the delicious Bayona Restaurant which is a 1/2 block from the hotel on Dauphine Street. The best breakfast in the French Quarter is at Petunia's on St. Louis Street, also 1/2 block from the hotel. The hotel staff was adequate and helpful in storing our luggage and hailing cabs. Besides the excellent location of this hotel, there is nothing to recommend it and we learned the hard way that location isn't everything. Next time we will stay elsewhere and walk or cab to our favorite places. We paid $150 a night for our room, and we got what we paid for, cheap accommodations. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NewHavenTraveller
Reviews.Content: Got a great web price, and what a pleasant room w/king bed. Clean and our room faced off the street so was blissfully quiet. Lots of space, ceiling fan. Some rooms we saw in had canopy beds. Attentive, professional front desk staff. Great location- just far enough off Bourban St (1/2 block) to be quiet-er but close enough to get into the action when you want. We took the airport shuttle both ways - easy. Lots of stops for other passengers though. Cab only few bucks more it seemed. Try to get to see some of the storm-damaged neighborhoods - helps understand the impact of it all. Fr Quarter and Garden District unaffected that we could tell, except St Charles St trolley line nonfunctional. Clover St Grill on Bourbon - great huge burgers and omlettes!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ericsvans
Reviews.Content: From the house keeping staff, to the General Manager John Patterson, I was impressed with the personal attention we were given throughout our stay at the hotel. Our room was more than we could have ever expected. Everyone was so helpful in making sure we enjoyed ourselves. From restaurants to night life, they made sure we experienced the true flavor of New Orleans. For a city and it's people to have gone through such a horrible tragedy, you would not know it by the smiles and open hearts we found there. To everyone at the Prince Conti we thank you for everything. We can't wait to come back and visit again soon. Eric B. and Courtney R.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti excels”
Reviews.Author: TN06Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 340 at the Prince Conti 9/14-9/18/06 and had a wonderful experience. The charming room was lovely and clean, with it's own coffeemaker and an ironing board (wish there were a few more hangers). The cleaning staff were prompt and helpful, and when Lisa left her rosary in the room when we returned to Nashville, Betty (on your cleaning staff) found and turned in the rosary, which was mailed immediately to her(Thank you Eva). This kind of honesty and service is hard to find these days, and whenever we visit New Orleans, we will stay at the Prince Conti and have already recommended it to several friends. Many thanks to all of the staff who provide such and enjoyable, safe place to stay in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “eehh! three strikes”
Reviews.Author: dallascitizen
Reviews.Content: stayed at the prince conti over the labor day weekend. first room offered (third floor) had badly damaged drywall from water/moisture. and a very heavy mold smell. second room (second floor) nicer furniture but just as offensive to the nose. third room (also 2nd floor) had leak damage to the cieling from its a/c system. but a lesser mold smell. i took it . thed bag was getting heavy. the previous guest had left the comment card .check out my pictures. the room had damage to the wall paper .as did all the furniture. the wingback chair had the fabric of each arm rest in shreds. two or three window panes had cracks across them and scotch tape place over the cracks. my buds stayed at the monteleone and raved about it. there you have it. the oysters at acme were small and flat.disappointing but at oceana and arnauds the oysters were fat. and tasty port of call is worth the walk - hit it early alone or late with friends ( w/f to better enjoy the wait)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: GoBeavs
Reviews.Content: Great location. I go to New Orleans at least twice a year and I would say this was my favorite hotel so far (and we stay in a different one each time). It's only a half block off of Bourbon (easy to stagger back to). We stayed in two different rooms, both were nice, but a little different. The only problem was there seems to be some kind of steel business next door that is working on the weekdays, so there was a lot of noise (could have been clean up recovery) early in the morning on the work day.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a great city recovering from Katrina”
Reviews.Author: tnsoutherner
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Labor Day weekend in New Orleans and stayed at the Prince Conti on Conti Street in the Quarter. It was a great deal on a hotel in an excellent location - just steps away from Bourbon Street but quiet and safe feeling. The front desk staff (Peter & Cindy in particular!) were really accomodating and helpful. They have on-site valet parking at a good price and the rooms were nicely appointed. This hotel isn't the Ritz, but it's several steps above the chain hotels like Comfort Inn, Holiday Inn, etc. and the price and location can't be beat. Go back to New Orleans and help them recover from Hurricane Katrina - and when you do, stay at the Price Conti!!!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedBelle
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel right off Bourbon Street, then this one is in an excellent location. Several locals were concerned I wouldn't get any sleep due to noise from Bourbon Street, but I never heard a sound (of course I was on the third floor on the side away from Bourbon Street). Bed was comfortable, bathroom was small but functional, nice decor (however edges on veneer of several pieces of furniture was chipped), clean, and no musty odors. Staff was friendly and helpful- it was the staff which raised my rating from average to above average.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Unknown2006
Reviews.Content: I spent May 10th to May 16th at your hotel. I just wasnt to say how nice and professional everyone was. The 3 women that worked the front desk were just SUPER. Also, the housekeepers were very nice. The manager was always asking if there was anything he could do to improve my stay. Everything was wonderful. I will return. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: eraserheadgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had to stay at the Prince Conti earlier than expected because the power went out at the bed and breakfast we were staying at. We had booked a suite for Thursday night and we were lucky enough to get it for Tuesday and wednesday night, too. Wed. and Tues. night rates were higher though, which was odd. The front desk clerk was nice on the phone but extremely snotty and condescending to me in person. I needed him to put the new room charges on a different credit card and when the bill he handed me didn't make it clear that a different card had been used he got very huffy. We went to our room and although it was large, the carpet was filthy and our feet turned black from walking around. The bathroom sink was clogged and I was told that they didn't have a plunger to fix it. Someone had stolen it. They said that someone would come by after noon to fix the sink (as we are late sleepers) and was rudely awakened before 8am by the guy wanting to fix the sink. We were not dressed and still sleeping so we told him to come back. He never did. Also, one of the valets was quite rude to me. We came in to park at 6pm and he asked if we needed to use the car for the rest of the night. When I told him I wasn't sure (it was pretty early to make plans for the rest of the night) he demanded that I make up my mind. I repeated that I didn't know, and he said he needed to know so he could go park our car down the road to make room for other cars. I told him he'd better leave it there and he got pretty [---]. I do not enjoy being talked down to by valets. I don't pay money to stay somewhere only to be treated like a second-class citizen. The room was shabby and there was no "private courtyard" as advertised on the website. I'm sticking to at least four-star from now on. I advise everyone else do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Room, Great Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only comparable hotel in any city we've stayed at in the last several years is Conti's sister, the lovely (and even nicer) St. Marie. Both are members of a family of New Orleans boutique hotels that, in their own ways, exhibit their unique style of understated elegance. If you desire acres of lobby with marble, brass and ferns, cookie cutter rooms with a high-rise view or a glut of staff members tripping over themselves to generate a tip, neither will be to your liking. On the other hand, if you prefer a more personal experience with friendly and capable staff, every nice room slightly different, and a location within walking distance of nearly every French Quarter attraction, these are great choices, especially so for those without an auto. The Conti has a very small and nice but unpretentious lobby. The hallways gave no hint of what we would find in our room, actually a suite with a small kitchen (which we didn't use.) It was quite well furnished, with antique or reproduction furniture. It had its own little garden off the separate sitting area, a completely unexpected treat. This room also offered a substantial library of books a few of which, if we weren't in the French Quarter and otherwise occupied, I would have loved to read. In some rooms close to Bourbon St. I'm told you can occasionally hear the revelers; but ours was utterly quiet at all hours. The bed, though high, was quite comfortable. Two restaurants are on site; we patronized one for a good breakfast. The French Quarter missed the worst of Katrina, though many staff at many businesses suffered great personal loss. With all that New Orleans has gone through, it would be foolish (and unkind) to demand perfection at any hotel or restaurant, but we found little complain about even by pre-Katrina standards, and much to love.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My grand daughter and I had our first visit to New Orleans, Louisana, this summer.(2006) We stayed @ the Prince Conti Hotel. The rates were reasonable. The rooms were quite,very clean, the beds very comfortable. The front desk clerks were friendly and very courtesy..they gave us maps to the places We wanted to visit. They would be my first choice went we return to New orleas.

Reviews.Title: “Graduation via Conti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our son graduataed from Tulane in May. We booked 3 rooms in Jan. at the Marriott. In March we got an email giving us a much better deal at the Prince Conti. We had our son check it out for us and with his thumbs up we booked into the Conti and canceled the Marriott. The Conti was cheaper and much better located for our needs. We brought in our daughters and spouses and all stayed at the Conti. With no car that would accommodate all of us it was great being so close to the French Quarter. Our children could come and go as they pleased w/o the hassle of a car or cab. At the last minute our son decided he wanted to be at the hotel with us and the desk manager gladly made the arrangements. It was a great time for all of us and none of us would hesitate to stay at the Conti again. It was clean, convenient and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Biscuitjones
Reviews.Content: Every single employee, from the concierge to the parking attendant to the maid staff, was friendly, courteous, helpful and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. Our room was lovely and comfortable. In room wi-fi service was steady and dependable. And the location is really quite convenient - especially if you plan to spend the majority of your time in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: wldwm2
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for Sun-Tues 4/23-4/25/06 so I could attend the French Quarter Fest on Sun and celebrate my birthday on Mon. My room was an interior one and very quiet--the room was immaculate and service was great! The manager(John) and the front desk attendant(Velda) were very personable and very helpful. I arrived early in the morning (8am) and the desk clerk that day(didn't catch her name) found me a room that was ready, which I hadn't expected. I would definitely return here. The mattress on my king bed was excellent--got a great night's sleep both nights. After many hours of walking both days, it was definitely appreciated. The location is wonderful--just a half block from Bourbon. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti staff helped make trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: Cardone15
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the French Quarter and picked the Prince Conti for its location. We were in no way disappointed. Be warned, it overlooks Conti and Bourbon Streets, and it can be very noisy outside at night. I hear they have "inside" rooms, but we didn't know that. However, if it's a French Quarter location and a French Quarter type hotel you want, the Prince Conti is superb. We walked everywhere. The Prince Conti is not a chain hotel, so don't expect large impersonal rooms. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the one little problem (broken light switch) was fixed immediately. The real bonus was the staff. Amy at the desk knows EVERYTHING about New Orleans, and she and Peter (also at the desk) set up tours and events for us; they and other hotel employees also made restaurant suggestions which were fantastic. We had a memorable meal every night. When we had a problem with our airport pickup, Amy got right on the phone herself and got someone there for us at once so we didn't miss our flight. I would certainly recommend visiting New orleans (they need the tourism) and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good However.............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After thoroughly reviewing this hotel via their website and Tripadvisor.com as well, I decided to give it a try. I am a frequent traveler to the French Quarter and I do know my way around. My experience with the reservations agent was fine, was impressed with the check-in process and the valet staff who assisted me with my truck. The room was clean and my wish for a room over-looking Conti was honored. I was awoken at approximately 3am by the noise coming from Bourbon Street, but hey, it is NOLA after all. My only concern is that this hotel still uses the age-old key-lock for the room doors. This can be a security issue if there is an unscrupulous staffer or an errant key left around. I mentioned this upon my check-in but was assured there should not be a problem. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Agree With Previous Two Posts”
Reviews.Author: sbm0303
Reviews.Content: My friends and my finace stayed at this hotel the weekend before Valentine's day. I thought the hotel was charming. Our room was an interior room with a big comfy King-sized bed. Our friends had a room facing Conti Street which was a little noisy on Saturday night - but hey - this is New Orleans. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk wasn't all the friendly, but the Valet and bell hop were. The maids did a great job cleaning and all our basic needs were taken care of. I have been to New Orleans many times as it is my favorite city anywhere and have stayed in numerous hotels. The Prince Conti has an old-world charm and great location - if you are looking for your average big hotel - stay on Canal Street - not in the Quarter. Even post-Katrina New Orleans still charms - the people were friendly and the food as incredible as always.
