We were able to eat at almost all favorite places - Antoines; NOLAs; Petunias; Gumbo Shop; and tried the wonderful Cafe Adelaides in the Loew's Hotel - go for the 25 cent martinis and their gumbo was fabulous. These restaurants are all in walking distance from the Prince Conti Only downside was Commander's Palace had not yet opened. I would recommend this hotel as good inexpensive hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to crow about”
Reviews.Author: compassquest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night, The room was very small with two double beds. There was hardly enough room to open the luggage carrier. I will say the room was clean and nicely appointed. I asked for a king size bed upon check in and was told by a very snooty front desk person that was not possible. No southern hospitality here! Bathroom tiny also. New Orleans is a very very sad place after the storms. We used to love coming to the city before, but will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mellow_goat
Reviews.Content: I stay in the quarter very often so I know what to expect from a Quarter hotel. They are usually not in the best condition but the history and the architecture make up for the few shortcomings they may have. This hotel was fantastic for the price. I went to this hotel several times last summer. Every time I went I paid a great price, $50 a night. The location is a 1/2 block from Bourbon Street. This is great if you are into wild nights or even if you are into mild nights. My advice is to ask for an inner room. Some nights are a little noisy. The hotel was very clean. If you have seen some of my past reviews this is the most important thing to me when I stay in a hotel. The staff was very friendly I think. The way the hotel is setup you rarely need to speak to their staff because everything is already taken care of. I wish I could afford to go back to this hotel. The rooms are no longer $50 dollars for mid-week summer prices. Since the hurricane destroyed and disrupted New Orleans their prices have gone up quite considerably. If you can afford to stay here, please do.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel, all-around, was average. People who have rated it 5 stars have obviously not stayed at some of the other finer hotels (Monaco & Le Pavillon come to mind) in New Orleans. The location is excellent, if you're looking to peruse and party in the French Quarter, and another great perk is the martini bar/restaurant (Bombay Club) in the hotel that sevres 125 types of martinis. But the rooms are small and offer few amenities (no ppv movies, etc.) If you can get a rate for under $100 I'd recommend it; otherwise, stay someplace else. Parking fee is $20 a night, but that is standard in New Orleans; I think the only hotel that doesn't charge in the area is Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: NeelyTurner
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a Mortgage Brokers' Convention Wed-Fri the week before Katrina hit. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor and after finding a special internet rate, I decided to book the Prince Conti even though I was leary of the hotel because of such a great rate in such a good location. However, when we arrived in New Orleans, I was very impressed with the hotel and their staff. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful and the rooms were very nice and clean. The ONLY problem I had was that the room we got did not have a window and I am very claustrophobic. However, I was not ever bothered by it. The hotel was very quiet and it was 1/2 block from Bourbon Street, which was great. When you are on Bourbon Street drinking, it's great to be able to walk to your room anytime you want to use the restroom and take a break. :) I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when it reopens.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conti!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLKallio
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel turned out to be everything the website claimed it would be--beautiful! Charming Victorian furniture and decoration, great restaurants (check out Mrs. D's, people! Best biscuits I've ever eaten in my life!--and the Bombay Club, though a bit expensive, had delicious food and about 125 different kinds of martinis). The staff was helpful and fun and pointed out all the hot spots (and where NOT to go), and I include the housekeeping and bellboy staff in this. Right around the corner from the excitement of Bourbon Street, the Prince Conti offered a cool, comfortable oasis away from the noise when you were ready to sleep. Loved it! And would definitely visit again. Not to mention the price was EXTREMELY reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Prince Conti Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel price and pleasant staff. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. It's near Bourbon street and close to restaurants we enjoy. We also had a good time listening to the live music at Bombay Martini Bistro. We had a great time! We've told our friends and plan to visit again...maybe during Mardi Gras!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room / Great Location / Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was entirely satisfied with my stay at the Prince Conti. I was shocked to find a safe and clean room at a price as low as the Prince Conti's midweek rates. While the hotel may lack some of the amenities of the 5-star New Orleans hotels, it is still an ideal place to catch your breath before heading back out to the Quarter or the Faubourg Marigny. It is clean, comfortable, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel while we were in New Orleans. I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel and their staff. The hotel is beautiful and located less than a block from Bourbon Street and is in a great location to walk anywhere in the French Quarter and to the River for that matter. The staff helped us book tours of the city and gave us some great advice on some of the things to see and do throughout the city. They were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this to anyone thinking about traveling to The Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “No major problems despite bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the Prince Conti tues-sunday the last week of July. I found the hotel staff very helpful. A few of the girls at the front desk were not overly friendly, but only in an overly "just business" sense. The shuttle came on time and my questions were answered and that is what counts. The cleaning staff was extremely friendly and it was a joy talking to them. Where they loud in the morning? I could hear the talking and joking, but this was always around 9-10am. I don't know if I would want that right outside my door, but they were never right outside my door anyway. You figure the noise is coming from a open room being cleaned. This too, did not seem like something to complain about. The bathroom was the size of a normal apartment bathroom. Mine was not "ultra-tiny". If you want the big Marriott, double sink bathroom, this isn't it however. Just a normal apartment style bathroom. The ceiling was a good 15 feet high. No air--but a air system that does not work so good. It was up to high and not doing much. There is a great ceiling fan though. It was on low. ( I had to stand on a chair to pull the chain!) and the room cooled right away. I woke up shivering most mornings. Lets see....everything was clean, no problems there. In the shower, the little pull did not want to stay up sometimes and I had to pull it hard to get it to do so. Cable TV but you cannot rent movies--no HBO etc. oh--by the weekend I had a bunch of girls in the room next to me. They were loud and I did hear them through the walls. So long as my TV was on I could not hear them. I would go back here, it is cheaper then what you will spend elsewhere. I read the reviews here to and was worried--but it all worked out. I did have one gripe though. My last day there I was getting ready to leave and saw something odd on the floor. Went over to look and saw the largest roach I have ever seen in person. Big and brown and they type that fly I imagine. It mush have crawled into the room from the hall. I kicked it, and it was dead--might have been the cold air. Keep in mind this is New Orleans, and bugs are everywhere, but someone else here said they saw one too. It's a nice hotel, but I made sure the wash everything when I came home just in case. I would stay there again next year unless I see more comments about critters. Look yourself and if you don't see more I think the place is worth it. No noise from Bourbon at in my room either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amwtcorley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in June. (yes I know I am late in writing my review) This hotel was great. The staff were friendly and the rooms were nice. Excellent deal for the price. I had read in the travel books that this was a good hotel but the bathrooms are small, that was not the case for our room (which had a bathroom the size of any average hotel) A bonus is that this hotel is so close to everything in the French Quarter (1/2 a block from Bourbon!!!!) but you don't have to put up with the crowds and the noise. The only reason I did not give the hotel a Excellent was that the majority of the rooms don't have views. When you looked out our window you saw a asphalt roof over what probably used to be a beautiful courtyard. Not a pretty site at all. We where probably lucky to get a window because there are alot of interior rooms. But if you are not going to spend alot of time in the room, then stay here for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Price Conti was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: CentaurNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti hotel for 8 days. This hotel is 20 steps from Bourbon Street (very close to the action) but because of the location of the rooms, there was no noise from the madness nearby. From this location we were able to walk all through the Quarter and still get back to the room easily for a change of clothes, shower, or nap (if you go in July you will need all of these.) The rooms were spacious and clean and all of the staff from housekeeping to front desk were very friendly and polite. We love staying at the Prince Conti and will gladly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Hotel--Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day two night visit to the Prince Conti Hotel in New Orleans. The hotel is magnificent, and we have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely and the people so warm and friendly that we hated to leave. The room was wonderful with an antique/traditional decor with all the modern conveniences. We had a queen size bed in a large room with TV, internet service, ironing board, coffee maker and a bathroom that looked like you could eat off the floor. The location was superb as it was just off Bourbon Street and all the night time action, but also within walking distance of the French Market and wonderful restaurants. People had warned us that staying so near Bourbon Street might be loud and noisey, but it was not. We never heard a thing! The staff was amazing--so quick to serve and ready to help. They really went out of their way. From the beginning we were greeted by friendly faces. The desk personnel and the young men serving as valets were so great about giving directions to us (first time visitors) and even maps to guide our way. We felt like we were coming home each evening rather than going to a hotel. Not only were they were they polite and gracious while we were actually there, but after we left and had forgotten an item at the hotel, they were super about finding the item and calling us back long distance to let us know they found it. They would have sent it to us, but we decided to go back by and pick it up. They remembered us right away even after a week! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The price was right and the atmosphere superb. I've already recommended it to my relatives! The next time I am in New Orleans, I will make it a point to stay at the Prince Conti.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prince Conti for 3 nights and really enjoyed my 4th of July stay there. The hotel is just steps away from the Boubon Street wild night life yet my room was quiet, well maintained, clean and spacious and all for $49 a night. The restaurant offers a great breakfast, the staff was very friendly and I was very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Hote”
Reviews.Author: CathyTChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti hotel on Friday 6-17-05 and again on Sunday 6-19-05. The first night our room faced the street which was quite loud, resulting in only a few hours of sleep for us. The second night we had a room in the back which was much more quiet. The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice. Everyone said hello to us when they saw us. The restaurant attached was very good for breakfast. All rooms are now nonsmoking, which may not please everyone. A good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Large Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Oilfieldclass
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Prince Conti Hotel in downtown New Orleans. I must admit I was very apprenhensive at first when I booked the stay at this hotel due to the location. However, it turned out to be a very pleasurable stay due to the kindness of the staff, restaurant and the clean room. I have stayed at many many hotels in my travels and have stayed in some places I really didn't want to stay but did not have an option. In short the people at this hotel made the difference. They were kind, all had good personalities and very responsive to my needs. When I return to New Orleans I will definately be staying at this little quaint place again. I don't often write about my stays anywhere but these folks definately took care of me and my needs. My highest compliments to the Hotel and Staff. Sincerely, James Griffin Willis, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been beautifully restored with antiques, high ceilings, beautiful rooms/linens and old-fashioned customer service (excellent). They even have real keys for the doors! The location is great - right off Bourbon street but there was absolutely no noise from the partiers on Bourbon! I highly recommend this hotel for a relaxing get away!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently. On top of seeing roaches in the hotel lobby, the staff had no clue of what they were doing. My credit card was charged 3 times for my stay, the housekeeping staff was smoking in my room while they were cleaning, and the TV's are about as old as my mother. The room wasnt really all that accomodating. On top of that, reservations messed up my stay and put me in a room the size of a shoebox. I'm tellling you, please, try somewhere else. Save yourself the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PT4485
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Prince Conti Hotel. The hotel is close to the day and nightlife of New Orleans. The hotel staff were extremely pleasent and always ready to help with making tour arrangements and providing information. Best of all they always greeted you with a smile and a hello when you entered the lobby. The room was small with a tiny bath but confortable and adequate for my needs (you don't spend much time in your room in New Orleans). Only downer for me was the Hotel had gone non-smoking since I booked my room. Ms. D's Bistro featured an excellent breakfast (their only meal). I highly recommend this hotel for a French Quarter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti was Great”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Nice staff. Very helpful. Booked through Orbitz. No problems. The location couldn't be beat. Steps away from Bourbon, but not very loud. The room was a bit worn... but who stays in their hotel room in New Orleans? Great AC... especially needed during the hot and humid summer months. The bathroom was immaculate. Very clean. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean. Prices are excellent. Sunday-Thursday $69 per night and Friday-Saturday room rates jump to $179 per night. Even with the higher weekend rates, this is still an excellent value. We stayed at this hotel 5/22/05 to 5/28/05. We requested a non-smoking room (all rooms on the second floor are non-smoking) with two queen beds. The room is not overly large, but it met our needs. The bathroom is tiny, no counterspace, just a pedestal sink, tub & shower and toilet. Air Conditioning is climate controlled and there is also a ceiling fan (not available in all rooms). It was great having the ceiling fan for those hot days as it really cooled the room. Internet access is available for an additonal daily charge. Ice machines are located down the hall and complimentary coffee is available in your room. This hotel also has inside rooms which do not have any windows (think inside cabins on a cruise ship). The only drawback to our room #256 is that while we had a view, it was of the backside of a building and roof but since we didn't plan on spending a whole lot of time in our room it wasn't too big of an issue. Also, since this is an older hotel, the noise level outside our room is more noticeable. The walls are not very well insulated against noise so that you can hear your neighbor's TV and muffled conversation. For this reason, I'm only giving the hotel an above average rating rather than an excellent rating. The location of this hotel is excellent as it is just around the corner from Bourbon St. so you are within walking distance to restaurants and the streetcars. For breakfast, it's a 15-20 minute walk to Cafe Du Monde in the French Market or to Croissant de'Or on Ursuline St. Croissant de'Or has french pastries & desserts from $1.25 and a large cafe au lait is $1.40. Adjacent to the hotel is a restaurant (didn't eat there so can't say how good the food is) and the Bombay Club. Entertainment is nice but did not have dinner there only drinks at the bar. We did have a tiny sample of the Bombay Club's duck appetizer at the Wine & Food Festival on 5/28/05 and it was delicious. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is a clean and well runned hotel. The staff is well trained, friendly and courtious. I'm always treated well when I stay there. I will continue to stay at the Prince Conti when I'm in New Orleans and I always recommend staying there to my friends and family. I would not consider staying anywhere else when in New Orleans. John Patterson and his staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti Terrific Midweek Value”
Reviews.Author: Diditall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prince Conti April 17 thru 22, '05. It's a terrifically located hotel between Dauphine and Bourbon. Just back far enough on Conti to be quiet, but close enough to stroll to the action in less than 2 minutes. Sunday thru Thursday we stayed for $89 a night. BEST DEAL IN THE QUARTER. Admittedly, I've never been to Mardi Gras, but I found all the adventure and excitement I need could be found on Bourbon any day of the week. The Prince Conti has valet parking ($20 a day - you're not going to avoid that anywhere in the Quarter) and our car was accessible in 5 minutes. Our room was smallish, but service was great. We had a fantastic time and will return. The Prince Conti will be the first place I call.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marytny
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Hotel has charm and room was nice. No view and chair was threadbare, but the location makes up for it all. Staff helpful and friendly. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel is just steps from Bourbon St. and a quick walk to the Riverwalk and French Market areas. The rooms are small, but the hotel is clean and fairly quiet for being so close to all of the action. If you want posh luxury, look elsewhere. But if you want a clean, quiet, relatively inexpensive place to rest between sightseeing and partying, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel in OK location”
Reviews.Author: rmcc189
Reviews.Content: OK location in the French Quarter within easy walking distance of the main attractions in New Orleans. Despite having booked and paid for a non-smoking king size room in advance on arrival they claimed to have none. Only rooms available were extremely small with the smallest double bed and shortest shower. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: puffinCary_NC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prince Conti from March 13-19, 2005. We found the best price by booking directly with the hotel. We had a large clean room that was quiet every night, even though we were only half a block from Bourbon Street. The desk personnel were helpful and we had several excellent breakfasts at a reasonable price at Ms. D's bistro at the hotel. We also enjoyed good food and good service at the Bombay Club at the hotel. We feel we received excellent value at a good price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a couple of days in New Orleans and this time actually stayed IN the French Quarter at the Prince Conti Hotel. It is a short block from Bourbon Street in the best part of the Quarter. Talk about convenient-- walk to breakfast at the Cafe du Monde, shopping , night life, fabulous restaurants , and never worry about finding parking because your car is in the hotel lot. What I appreciate the most is that we didn't have to give up a nice quiet place to stay. In spite of its proximity to Bourbon St. the Prince Conti is wonderfully quiet, with a great bed, lovely accomodations , and probably the nicest management and staff you'll find anywhere. All of this at a very resonable price. We are ruined! It's the Prince Conti for us from now on! We feel it really does offer the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed Dec 23 04 - Dec 27 04 but just remembered to review. I loved the Prince Conti. The 2 best things are the location and the price. We've stayed at several hotels around the quarter and paid more for all of them. The Conti is right in the middle of everything. We had good maid service, quiet rooms, friendly staff and great prices. Some reviews wrote they didn't have coffee makers but we had everything we needed including the coffee maker. I'd like to thank the friendly desk staff, valets and maid service for our wonderful stay. We'll see you again next Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Same Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel August 2004. I am so glad to see that the hotel is still great. When I was there the staff was very helpful and friendly. I was traveling alone and they did a great job making me feel welcome. The housekeeping staff did a great job. I hope to be in town in the near future and would love to stay there again. The only disappointment was no ghost.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, inexpensive, What a DEAL.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Prince Conti, the week before Mardi Gras. We knew nothing about New Orleans. The desk people were amazingly knowledgable and helpful. They steered us towards the tours that had the best value. All in all, they made it a fantastic trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Deal, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel, the Prince Conti meets or exceeds all expectations I had. I've read the other reviews and was a bit concerned about some of the complaints made but the cheap price was well worth the chance, and I wasn't dissapointed. For $59 a night I got a very clean and nicely furnished room with 2 double beds and a sitting area with a sleeper sofa. The bathroom was small but very modern and clean. The maid staff was very friendly and did a great job of changing and replenishing linens/towels daily. The front desk help was also always very accomodating and kind. Also, as I was walking out of my room I would sneak peaks at other rooms as the maids were cleaning and they all looked very neat and clean as well. The only downside I can think of is the noise factor. The walls are thin so you can hear pretty much everything that is going on outside your door, however I didn't hear any noice whatsoever from Bourbon street. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with the reviews that indicate this hotel is an excellent value, don't expect a luxury hotel. Our friends had a non-smoking room on 3rd floor, we had smoking, ours was bigger. Staff was very helpful, accept their recommendations for the swamp tour, we had the best tour guide EVER. Restaurant across the street had the best pork chop breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great place, even better location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews about this hotel, so I was a little leery of staying here--especially at a rate of $49 a night! However, I was very pleasantly surprised. We had reserved a queen/king room. Upon arrival, we were put into a king suite. It was fabulous! Nice, comfortable bed, large sitting area, and nice bathroom. This room was on the third floor, the floor most good reviews came from. I don't know what the rooms on the lower floors were like, but I did peek into a couple of regular rooms that were open for cleaning and they also seemed nice. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. I have never had a room in the French Quarter for less than $100/night, so I was absolutely thrilled. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very suprised upon arrival. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. The location of the hotel is fantastic, we were close to everything. Great martini bar in the restauant. We were there seven days over christmas and are looking forward to returning. Oh, on our 2nd to last day we discovered the quaint little restauarnt/bar accross the street, don't wait that long to try it your self (inexpensive and GOOD food).

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: oliviadawg
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti is a great deal for budget-minded travelers who want comfort and convenience. No, it's not a five-star hotel, but it's definitely at the very top of its price range. Clean, reasonably furnished, quiet, and within stumbling distance to all of the attractions in the French Quarter. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff!”
Reviews.Author: godbe
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for four nights in December. The room was very nice and the price was excellent. My sister fell onto a pot hole and sprained her ankle. The staff was thoughtful, beyond belief. They directed us to the hospital and then later to all the wonderful sights in New Orleans. They even recommended an incredible African restaurant which we absolutely loved. We will always stay in the Prince Condi when we travel to New Orleans, and will recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “the best both in rooms, service and dining”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed 8 days at this great hotel, with a basketball team of 15 year old boys. The location is fantastic both for the adults and the boys. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The boys enjoyed the hotel as much as we adults. But the real treat was the meal in the Bombay Club. The barbequed shrimp was the best we have ever had. The chef was willing to share and provided us with the receipe. What hospitality! The rooms were so clean and staff always ready to assist. John Patterson, General Manager, is committed to personal service, which is demonstrated in the relaxed warm personalities of the entire staff. The martinis are sooo smooth and the recipe for that great Barbequed Shrmip all guarantee a return visit to this delightful hotel. Lynn/Mike McDonald - Prior Lake MN

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to N.O. and we wanted a nice place near the center of the action, and that's exactly what we got. The hotel is easy to get to and less than a block from Bourbon Street. There is valet parking at the hotel for about $20 per night. I don't know where they put our car, but they were always fast about getting it for us. As for the room, it was great. The online ads don't say much about this, but I gather there are some very different rooms there. Our room was on the third floor, had a king, a sofabed and sitting area and two TVs (one facing the bed, the other facing the sofa), and a coffee maker with the ingredients. We booked through expedia and paid $129. The maid service was excellent and the room and bathroom were clean. This is an older building in a humid town, so it's not surprising it has a faint musty smell -- you notice it when you arrive, then forget about it. I'd definitely stay there again. P.S. after lots of different dining experiences (all great) we wanted something more intimate -- very much enjoyed The Pelican Club, an easy three block walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: rt1092
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room was large and nicely decorated. The staff was pleasent and very helpful. The location is great, near everything in the French Quarter. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant, food was great,but the service was a little bit slow, but we were on vacation so why rush. The rate I got this hotel for was almost to good to be true. But our stay would have been worth 4 times the price. I fully recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A nice room for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans for the Halloween weekend. I did not have reservations, but was able to get a nice, clean room for $79.00. The Conti Hotel is a 1/2 block from Bourbon St. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and helpful. I would use the PCH again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Shyyydoggg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, especially on the 3rd floor, Rue Conti side, with a whole row of windows and a good view over the tops of buildings. Lower floors have no view other than the street. Pretty quiet, considering the location, but a very pleasant and safe spot on Rue Conti. The rooms are better than average motel, though the hallways are a bit dim and smelly. Room doors are thin and no lock other than on the knob. Good towels, water pressure and clean bathroom. Comfortable bed. The staff at the desk were very nice and moved us to the 3rd floor when requested. The price was super ($102 including tax) gotten on Travelocity. Try the restaurant Latrobe's just south down the street past Bourbon, especially on a rainy afternoon. The building is very historic and beautiful. Ask for a tour. Also, an all-night restaurant across the street from the Prince Conti, and Broussard's for old-line New Orleans fair directly across the street. Prince Conti good choice for the price (got a $49 room last August on Travelocity), but a significant come down from the Royal Orleans where I had been the previous 5 nights! But the Royal was also $235/night convention price! If you're on your own money, the Prince Conti is an excellent, safe and clean choice.

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti: Great service, nice rooms, but no coffee”
Reviews.Author: erinwyher
Reviews.Content: If I had to stay in New Orleans again, I'd stay here for the price, the location and the fact that it is very well kept. Can't hear anything from Bourbon street, but did hear the neighbors when they stayed up late partying in their rooms. Not a huge deal. Great, comfortable beds, very nice bathroom, good water pressure, huge towels. Surprisingly luxurious. Except for the no coffee... There is absolutely no coffee in the rooms or in the lobby. We got around that by going out to the convenience store next-door every morning, which opened at 7:30 (a time at which the only people you'll run into in New Orleans are the street cleaners, washing away the stale alcohol from the streets.) The service was fantastic, the front desk clerks were nice and helpful and guided us to some great restaurants (they suggested Olivier's which had yummy, authentic creole food and the best pecan pie I have had to date). Because I was one of the first to arrive for the week, the woman at the front desk gave us one of the best rooms in the hotel, and it was gorgeous and huge!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would go back”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Only 1/2 block from Bourbon Street - but our room was very quiet. Great location. Charming hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment at the Prince Conti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to New Orleans, unfortunately timed with Hurricane Ivans arrival, the staff of the Prince Conti Hotel in the French Quarter did all that they could possibly do to ensure our safety and to reassure us. They, (the staff) were constantly informing us of precautions and processes in place at the Conti. Generators for electricity, staff staying on site, etc. In particular the Front Desk Staff were outstanding in theri ability to accommodate and provide top service to many frightened and panic tourists attempting to leave New Orleans. Thanks Prince Conti for your friendly and efficient care.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Prince Conti, New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Prince Conti. It is a lovely old hotel, quite attractive & well-kept. Very comfortable kingsize bed, nicely appointed room, fat fluffy white towels... The staff couldn't be more friendly & were of great assistance to us. I've read some say it was very noisy but that was not the case at all for us at least!! We'll be returning to New Orleans in Spring & will definitely be staying at this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a decent NOLA hotel”
Reviews.Author: freetoafault
Reviews.Content: Out of the numerous hotels in the Quarter and Business District that I've stayed in, the Prince Conti wins my vote for best place to stay in this price range. My room was quaintly decorated and clean. Housekeeping kept us well stocked on supplies. Everything worked. This is a huge step up from other comparably priced hotels in the area. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. The only down side to staying at the Prince Conti that I can think of is that there is only one elevator (although we never had to wait for it for more than a minute or two). Other than those two small things, this is a great place to stay in a very convenient location. If you're looking for a clean, safe place to stay and aren't looking for high-maintenance extras, give the Prince a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Prince Conti in late Sept. 2004. Great location, close to everything in the Quarter. Walls are a little thin, we could hear a lot the hall traffic and street noice, but we liked the room. It was clean and well kept. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife is from NO, and we stay in the FQ frequently. This was our first time at the Prince Conti and we found it to be very charming, friendly, and a wonderful value. (Hopefully on their next refurbishment they will soundproof the walls as they transmitted noise between rooms and hallway. Snoring from the next room was troublesome during the night - and when we woke and were discussing our plans for the day - the snorer actually banged on the wall and screamed obscenities at us to quiet us down). All this to say that privacy is a problem - but the only one that I would call attention to. The staff were outstanding. The Bombay Club on premises was perfect for us - "J.J." saw to our every need - dinner and martinis were superb. Ms. D's cafe also was perfect for us - a nice menu, and a great place to enjoy breakfast and the morning newspaper. We didn't drive, therefore we didn't have to deal with problems of parking in the Quarter. Location was central to shopping, some of our favorite restaurants and nightlife. The accomodating staff checked us in early and kept our bags until the limo picked us up. Even though we like to experience different hotels in the Quarter, we would definitely return to the Prince Conti, if only for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff, rooms, and rates at the Prince Conti were excellent. I definitely will stay here again next year. The closeness to Bourbon St. is a very great amenity all to itself. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the budget traveller. Ideal location just a short walk from Bourbon St. Close enough to jaunt back to the room after a shopping trip. But you don't hear the noise of Bourbon St here (although the walls are a little thin). Clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great price & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel, and it was in the French Quarter so we booked it. My Husband and I stay in the French Quarter at least once a year. This was a great value for what it was. There is no pool, no fridge in the room, no coffe makers et,,, but the room was nicely decorated, nice sized, and comfortable. The Bombay Club is on the premisses, which has the famous martini bar ($8-$11) each but an extensive menu of martini's! They also have a fabulous menu for dining (a little pricy, but great items). We did eat else where but we do intend on visiting the Bombay Club to dine, on our next visit. There is a bristro next door, outside the lobby, that serves breakfast. Dont be fooled by the "buy one get one free". Breakfast for 4 of us cost, over $60.00 by the time you add $2.50 for coffe each, and $2.50 for toast! The breakfast was delicious, but if you just want eggs over easy, go across the street to a local diner/bar, a bit dark and dingy but an excellent breakfast for $5.00! The Prince Conti was a nice location one block down Bouorbon Street which concerned me but I must say, our room over looked Bourbon, and there was no noise at all. This hotel is great for walking around the French Quarter, close to everything. The only complaint I would have is, though the decor is nice, it seemed a bit dirty to me. The lobby chairs were dirty, the wallpaper had stains, the bathroom tub had redisue up the walls. (I am a clean freak). There were fresh clean linens and towels every morning and the staff was friendly. I would have just liked to have gotten on my hands and knees and scrubbed the corners!!! I have to say though, a great value for the price, and a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Prince Conti. The staff was great. Be warned though, French Quarter hotels are generally in very old buildings, this is part of the "charm". If you are looking for spacious accommodations, this may not be the place for you! We had a king deluxe room. The room was lovely for two of us, and the bathroom was nice, but small as well. Along with the old building thing...the shower pressure could be considered "low" by some standards, but don't let that scare you. It still gets the soap off. The location of this hotel is perfect, you can walk anywhere from here. Some reviews suggested that the hotel seems unusually noisy, but we didn't notice it. We were on an inside room (Sorry no lovely views or courtyards...but honestly We don't come to the FQ to sit in our hotel room) I have also stayed at the St. Marie, run by the same hotel group and it is wonderful as well...good to consider if the larger room and courtyard view is important to you. We would definitely stay at either property again!

Reviews.Title: “Prince Conti is the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Prince Conti Hotel, one-half block from Bourbon, is outstanding in every respect. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel like family. The general manager greeted us warmly; the desk clerk was friendly and gave us several recommendations on clubs and restaurants that proved invaluable and accurate. During our 6-day stay, they called cabs for us whenever we needed them, changed large bills for us, and kept our luggage after we checked out. The young men who handled our luggage were friendly, polite and accommodating. Our room was immaculate. We always had plenty of fresh supplies and linens, and the cleaning staff was sweet and kind. We have traveled extensively, and our stay at the Prince Conti Hotel has been the best hotel experience we have had. We heartily recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed on the Prince Conti, after reading the rave reviews placed by others. The room rates for summer are great. However there were some disappointing factors: sheets were clean but bed cover had a cigarette hole; there was hardly a view; walls are thin that I could hear the next door's guest jumping in bed; some guests were running down the hall around 3 am; there is no courtyard to sit in for some relaxation. The day concierge was friendly and very helpful with sightseeing. Next time, I will look for a hotel with more amenities like coffee in the morning and a courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Must have been in a different hotel than others”
Reviews.Author: joedoe587
Reviews.Content: Seeing all the rave reviews of this place, I must have been at another hotel, there is nothing decent in downtown NO, or its clientele is too young and/or drunk to know any better. Desk service is condescending, except for the sheets rooms are really not well-maintained, carpet is badly stained, and everything is worn-out. Good but noisy location with thin walls. Downstairs breakfast restaurant looks mediocre and expensive, though the night club looks intrguing. Would stay again only if stuck. Tip: Unless the season is very busy, you can probably get very deep discount coupons at Visitor Center, so don't reserve ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prince Contri April 5, 2004. The desk clerk had a condescending attitude (she was training someone) the rest of the staff were excellent and the Valet most accomodating. The hotel was clean, well kept and mostly quiet. It is 1/2 a block from Bourbon Street and within walking distance of everything. Very much enjoyed our stay. Great hotel for the price but do check for coupons!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Many Times, Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: StinkyHotelsBeware
Reviews.Content: Over the past few years, I've stayed at the Conti at least 6 times. My experience has always been above average. The rooms are well-appointed, the staff cordial and helpful, the location great, and the price reasonable. Plus there's that little grocery store next door that is convenient I've had the misfortune at staying at other hotels in the Quarter when I couldn't get a room at the Conti, and have always found myself wishing I had thought far enough ahead to have booked a room. For example, the St. Ann / Marie Antoinette, which is also on Rue Conti is a block off of the other side of Bourbon. They're more expensive than the Conti and a total hell-hole. Try the Conti once, then try another place the next time you visit, and you'll be a Conti patron from then on.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jsgcsa
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a moderate price. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. Make sure you ask for an interior room however. The garbage truck is loud at 4:00 in the morning! The interior rooms are extremely quiet! The location is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “great location/prince of a dael”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dec. 03; got coupon from LA visitor's center I-10 Coupon honored w/o hassle. Great location-close, but not too close to Bourbon St. Park your car w/ hotel and walk anywhere in 1/4. Overall, a 7 out of 10 in price/quality scale.

HotelInfo.Name: Prince Conti Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 830 Conti Street, New Orleans, LA 70112
